This issue, set to hit stands on September 12, 2001, was a tie into the DCU event \"Our Worlds At War.\" In the issue \"This Is Not A Job For Superman,\" the second page contained a panel of the twin Lex Corp buildings in Metropolis, smoldering while a helicopter hovers above.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a class=\"bc-title-link\" title=\"5 Times Batman Couldn't Save The Day (&#38; 5 Times Superman Couldn't)\" href=\"https://www.cbr.com/batman-superman-failures-comics/\">5 Times Batman Couldn't Save The Day (&#38; 5 Times Superman Couldn't)</a></span></p><p>DC Comics went ahead and sent the issue to retailers on November 2001. This issue wasn't the only DC book to feature a building being crashed into by a vehicle in the air as <em>DK2: The Dark Knight Strikes Back</em>, which was scheduled for release around this time, featured the Batmobile crashing into a building.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">6 </span>The Attack On The World Trade Center (Marvel)</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/UNCANNY-X-MEN-189.jpg' /></figure><p>In 1985, <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/x-men-chris-claremont-biggest-changes-comics/\">Chris Claremont</a> penned the story 'Two Girls Out to Have Fun\" (<a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/x-men\"><em>Uncanny X-Men</em> #189</a>). This issue followed <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/rachel-summers/\">Rachel Summers </a> (a refugee from the future) and Amara (a time-displaced citizen from ancient Rome) while sightseeing in Manhattan. When touring the Statue of Liberty, <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/rachel-summers-costumes-love-never-want-see-again/\">Rachel recalls how in her timeline</a>, the Twin Towers were attacked and destroyed, leaving thousands dead and injured.</p><p>Following the terror attack on the World Trade Center, fans suggested that this issue was an example of Claremont's apparent foresight, since he envisioned the attack years before it happened. This despite the fact that Claremont only mentions the destruction of the Twin Towers as a passing side-note, as it does not play into the overall story.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">5 </span>The Attack On The World Trade Center (Marvel)</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Sabotage-X.jpg' /></figure><p>The \"Sabotage X<em>\"</em> event teamed <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/spider-man/\">Spider-Man</a> with the <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/x-force/\">X-Force</a> against the Unstoppable Juggernaut. It came courtesy of Rob Liefeld and Fabian Nicieza on <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/marvel-comics-x-force-strongest-rosters-ranked/\"><em>X-Force</em> #4, </a>and Todd McFarlene writing<em> Spider-Man </em>#16. Coincidentally, this crossover depicts the destruction of the World Trade Center once again.</p><p>As the mutants and Spider-Man battled through the streets of New York, <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/juggernaut/\">Juggernaut</a> destroys the Twin Towers in an eerily prophetic manner. This attack has seemingly faded into comic book limbo, as the destruction the World Trade Center was never mentioned again in the Marvel Universe. The Towers were likely rebuilt off-panel, and <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/times-the-juggernaut-was-stopped/\">Juggernaut never had to answer for this crime</a>.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">4 </span>The Challenger Space Shuttle Explosion</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Man-of-Steel.jpg' /></figure><p>The space shuttle Challenger explosion of 1986 was a tragedy that killed all seven crew members, including schoolteacher Christa McAuliffe. This just happened to coincide with John Byrne's post-<a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/crisis-on-infinite-earths/\"><em>Crisis on Infinite Earths</em></a> issue one of his <em>Man of Steel</em> limited series, which reintroduced the slightly updated post-<em>Crisis</em> Superman to the DC Universe.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a class=\"bc-title-link\" title=\"Superman: Every Love Interest The Man Of Steel Has Had In The Comics\" href=\"https://www.cbr.com/superman-love-interests-girlfriends-ranked-lois-lane/\">Superman: Every Love Interest The Man Of Steel Has Had In The Comics</a></span></p><p>Following the Challenger tragedy, Byrne redrew one of the pivotal scenes where Superman saved a space shuttle with reporter <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/lois-lane/\">Lois Lane</a> onboard. Wanting to avoid seeming insensitive, Byrne replaced the space shuttle with a futuristic-looking \"space plane.\" This would not be the last time that Byrne's comics work mirrored real-world events.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">3 </span>The Death of Princess Diana</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Wonder-Woman-126.jpg' /></figure><p>The August 1997 issue of <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dc-wonder-woman-overrated-underrated-member-of-justice-league/\">Wonder Woman</a>, written by John Byrne marked another instance where his writing mirrored real-world events, occurring almost simultaneously. In issue #126 -- Byrne's first issue in the run -- Princess Diana of Themyscira is struck down by the demon Neron. Wonder Woman dies in issue #127, and she would be brought back to life shortly after.</p><p>However, the timing of the story was eerie because of what would happen shortly after. Just four days after issue #126 was released, another Princess also named Diana tragically perished in a car crash in Paris, France, on August 31, 1997.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">2 </span>The New York City Blackout Of 1977</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Marvel-Team-Up-60-.jpg' /></figure><p>When writing for <em>Marvel Team-Up,</em> John Byrne also unknowingly predicted a blackout in NYC. In 1977, parts of the Bronx and Bushwick experienced the first extended power outage since 1965. This was caused by stress on the power grid, following a series of lightning storms in Westchester County. This was then exacerbated by what the New York Times deemed \"human and mechanical error.\"</p><p>The same week as the great New York City Blackout, <em>Marvel Team-Up #60</em>, was released. Here, <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/weirdest-spider-man-team-ups-marvel-comics/\">Spider-Man and the Wasp</a> tangle with the villain Equinox. During the battle, an electrical transformer blows up, plunging all of Manhattan into darkness.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">1 </span>Massive Earthquakes In Japan</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/X-Men-118-Vol1.jpg' /></figure><p>What happens when Chris Claremont and John Byrne collaborate? Apparently, the ability to predict earthquakes in Japan. The two worked on <em>X-Men #118 (Vol. 1)</em> in 1978. Here, the X-Men go to Japan, where they find the city Agarashima evacuated in advance of a strange and unnatural earthquake.</p><p>The mutants learn that Moses Magnum gave the Japanese government 24-hours to secede all power to him, or he will use his \"magnum force\" to sink Japan. The same week that this issue hit the stands, Japan was hit by a series of massive earthquakes.</p><p><p style=\"text-align: left;\"><span class=\"next-single\">NEXT: <a class=\"bc-title-link\" title=\"10 Times John Byrne Created Stories From Unresolved Marvel Story Elements\" href=\"https://www.cbr.com/john-byrne-used-unresolved-marvel-plots/\">10 Times John Byrne Created Stories From Unresolved Marvel Story Elements</a></span></p></p>\n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 24 Aug 2020 16:30:33 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Comics-Predict-Future.jpg","linkMd5":"d28110a40c5fee60e29b04a97530e595","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn51@2020_3/2020/08/24/21-43-11-367_cdd3886749703fcf.webp","destWidth":1700,"destHeight":900,"sourceBytes":116938,"destBytes":116938,"author":"Chad Burdette","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Comics-Predict-Future.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn51@2020_3/2020/08/24/21-43-11-367_cdd3886749703fcf.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Superman-38.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn16@2020_2/2020/08/24/21-43-31-797_9b2ed275f08e6397.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Superman-Newspaper-strip-1945.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn28@2020_6/2020/08/24/21-43-32-699_e0d6f0ff002dc1b5.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Pearl-Harbor-National-Comics.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn11@2020_1/2020/08/24/21-43-26-777_1d32fc4329c5a9d5.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Adventures-of-Superman-596-World-Trade-Center.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn48@2020_4/2020/08/24/21-43-21-199_67182c65f4bca5ae.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/UNCANNY-X-MEN-189.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn31@2020_6/2020/08/24/21-43-25-194_b7129f20c4dfc305.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Sabotage-X.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn72@2020_3/2020/08/24/21-43-24-813_6441ff673f366c87.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Man-of-Steel.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn47@2020_6/2020/08/24/21-43-24-665_a2df11687eb6db7d.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Wonder-Woman-126.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn20@2020_6/2020/08/24/21-43-23-559_a2433eade7db321f.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Marvel-Team-Up-60-.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn95@2020_6/2020/08/24/21-43-24-429_a13adb0b2e38ed64.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/X-Men-118-Vol1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn3@2020_2/2020/08/24/21-43-22-472_6f26a85af991bed6.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598305389181},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","title":"Is The Batman Following Joker in Its Portrayal of the Wayne Family?","link":"https://www.cbr.com/batman-following-joker-portrayal-of-wayne-family/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/pattinson-smokey-eye-batman-header.png\"/></figure><p><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dwayne-johnson-black-adam-dc-fandome-panel/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">DC FanDome</a> featured <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dc-fandome-batman-panel-matt-reeves/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Matt Reeves sharing new information</a> <em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/the-batman/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">The Batman</a>, </em>including sharing a few films that inspired him when he was developing the film, <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/the-batman-director-reveals-movies-inspired-dark-knight/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">such as <em>Chinatown</em> and <em>Taxi Driver</em></a>. Another DC film that was inspired by <em>Taxi Driver</em> was the 2019 smash hit <em>Joker</em>. In the film, director Todd Philips decided to not portray the Waynes as the patron saints of Gotham as they had been in previous iterations. And based on Matt Reeves' comments about his film, it seems like <em>The Batman</em> may follow suit in its portrayal of the iconic family.</p><p>Reeves mentioned that the film will explore the corruption that runs rampant through Gotham City and the influence that years of deception have had on the city. He went on to explore the issue by explaining that Robert Pattinson's Bruce Wayne will be grappling with his family's involvement in the corruption of Gotham. Therefore, not only will he be contemplating his family's legacy in Gotham, but also his own.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/the-batman-images-leak-reeves-warner-react/\">The Batman Images Leak, Matt Reeves, Warner Bros. React</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/10/joker-thomas-wayne.jpg\"/></figure><p>In <em>Joker,</em> Thomas Wayne is depicted as a scumbag who parades around Gotham City in his fancy cars and suits, treating people without his privilege and advantages with disrespect. Obviously, this was a starkly different characterization than the caring version seen in <em>Batman Begins</em>. In that film, Bruce's father was depicted as a family man, a doctor and a champion of public service programs in Gotham, aligning him closer to his comic book counterpart.</p><p>However, in the current climate of questioning the social structure and the ever-growing wealth discrepancy in the world, audiences are perhaps tired of the saintly depictions of billionaires. People on the internet will criticize Bruce Wayne in the abstract for spending his money on his Batman persona and equipment, and not enough on things like social programs. While those criticisms are not true of all iterations of the Dark Knight, the increasing amount of these types of jokes are indicative of fans' wish to prod at the billionaire aspect of the Batman character.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/suicide-squad-idrid-elba-character-revealed-john-byrne-superman-run/\">The Suicide Squad: Idris Elba's Character Revealed (Hint: He Shot Superman With A Kryptonite Bullet)</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/batman-trailer-batman2.jpg\"/></figure><p>By leaning into these criticisms and forcing modern Bruce Wayne to confront that legacy, a new aspect of the character can be explored. <em>The Batman</em> may be doing more than following the lead of <em>Joker</em>, as it could also be pushing the concept of a broken Gotham and corrupted legacies to the primary hero. The perspective of the Wayne family in <em>Joker</em> is not to be trusted thanks to the unreliability of Arthur as the narrator. That version of Thomas Wayne is how Arthur perceives him, and potentially could be a complete falsehood.</p><p>However, in <em>The Batman</em>, the reliability of the narrator, at least within the footage and information currently available, can be taken at their word. Therefore, Reeves' film will address the potential corrupt history of the Wayne family head-on. By having the source of the questioning in regards to the morality and honor of the Wayne name actually be a Wayne, it forces a sense of responsibility upon those with privilege and advantage to self-reflect on the role they play in the suffering of the world.</p><p><em>The Batman is directed by Matt Reeves and co-written by Reeves and Mattson Tomlin. The film stars Robert Pattinson as Bruce Wayne/Batman, Andy Serkis as Alfred Pennyworth, Jeffrey Wright as James Gordon, Zoë Kravitz as Selina Kyle/Catwoman, Colin Farrell as Oswald Cobblepot/The Penguin, Paul Dano as Edward Nashton/The Riddler, John Turturro as Carmine Falcone and Peter Sarsgaard as District Attorney Gil Colson. The Batman is set to be released in theaters on Oct. 1, 2021.</em></p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/batman-teaser-trailer-dc-fandome/\">The Batman Teaser Trailer Unleashes Catwoman &#38; The Riddler</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 24 Aug 2020 as they raise kids of their own. Season 3 arrives in 2021.</p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 24 Aug 2020 15:40:29 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/Cobra-Kai-rivalry-2.jpg","linkMd5":"6e4f94bdd53f8c8c18519f49ecadd265","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn51@2020_2/2020/08/24/21-43-10-389_ca86cd288ba955a4.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":52216,"destBytes":52216,"author":"Sam Stone","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/Cobra-Kai-rivalry-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn51@2020_2/2020/08/24/21-43-10-389_ca86cd288ba955a4.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598305389180},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","title":"The Boruto Manga Resurrects Sasuke's Most Important Shinobi Relic","link":"https://www.cbr.com/boruto-49-resurrects-sasuke-important-shinobi-relic/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/sasuke-evil-Cropped.jpg\"/></figure><p><em><strong>WARNING: The following contains major spoilers for </strong><strong><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/boruto/\">Boruto: Naruto Next Generations</a></strong><strong> Chapter 49, by Masashi Kishimoto, Mikio Ikemoto and Ukyo Kodachi, available now in English from Viz Media.</strong></em></p><p>In <em>Naruto</em>, Sasuke's headband was an iconic relic, a symbol of how the <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/boruto-episode-159-hashirama-senju-weaponized/\">shinobi world</a> was filled with injustice. He left a scar across the Konoha symbol, which indicated he no longer followed the village's ways and was now a rogue ninja, committing crimes to tarnish Konoha's reputation. It also served as notice he'd return one day to attack it.</p><p>Luckily, as much as he and Naruto feuded in their teens, they patched things up after Kaguya's defeat and a brawl that left both without a hand. The two matured to lead the village. In <em>Boruto</em> Chapter 49, Sasuke's headband appears once more, but this time, it's Boruto who gives it significant meaning.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/boruto-every-key-event-in-vol-9/\">Boruto: Every Key Event in Vol. 9</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/boruto-sasuke.jpg\"/></figure><p>It was a big deal seeing Sasuke sully the headband because he no longer had love for the village. Konoha used the Uchiha Clan and then the Third Hokage had Itachi kill them off, including Sasuke's parents, which is why he wanted to murder his brother in revenge. Weighing all this, he turned his back on Konoha and that headband would become the stuff of legend, as Naruto also realized Konoha made mistakes in the past and turned ninjas into weapons of mass destruction.</p><p>This isn't the first time <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/boruto-anime-framed-narutos-son-for-murder/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Boruto</a> has been gifted it. When Naruto was kidnapped by Momoshiki and Kinshiki, Sasuke gave him the headband as he recognized his potential. It became more meaningful to Boruto than even Naruto's iconic jumpsuit, because Sasuke was the first person to tell Boruto he could go on to become Konoha's most powerful shinobi, acting like the father figure Naruto should have been.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/boruto-needs-bring-back-fan-favorite-redeemed-villains/\">Boruto NEEDS to Bring Back Two Fan-Favorite Redeemed Villains</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/2-boruto-sasuke.jpg\"/></figure><p>Boruto gave it back, but now he needs inspiration once more as Isshiki comes to destroy the village. The alien wants Kawaki in exchange, which is why Naruto heads out to fight him. But Sasuke makes it clear they'll need Boruto's help, even if it means he has to tap into Momoshiki's power with the Karma mark. Boruto's scared Momoshiki might take full control of his body. While Sasuke confesses he'll kill the boy if that happens, this relic acts as a totem that'll (hopefully) keep him tethered to the light.</p><p>Sasuke gives him his headband when he asks, all so Boruto could hold onto hope for the future and also so that the kid will survive and return it in person. Sasuke knows it's Boruto's True North, and once he can remember his compass, he'll come home. It's a very touching moment, and Boruto feels safe and complete with it. It reminds him he can change destiny and maybe he isn't fated to be possessed by Momoshiki after all. And as for Sasuke, it's a personal testament that <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/boruto-episode-159-hashirama-senju-weaponized/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">powerful</a> tools such as himself and Boruto can be pointed in the right direction with proper guidance.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/boruto-episode-160-naruto-ninja-alliance-incompetent/\">The Boruto Anime Confirms Naruto's Ninja Alliance Is Totally Incompetent</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 24 Aug 2020 09:45:38 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/sasuke-evil-Cropped.jpg","linkMd5":"2b80f0bb392eca72fa86a12157093970","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn71@2020_3/2020/08/24/21-43-11-473_3634a35ac40f4505.webp","destWidth":1280,"destHeight":640,"sourceBytes":29320,"destBytes":29320,"author":"Renaldo Matadeen","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/sasuke-evil-Cropped.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn71@2020_3/2020/08/24/21-43-11-473_3634a35ac40f4505.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/boruto-sasuke.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn23@2020_6/2020/08/24/21-43-30-166_da1efb4b2472b70b.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/2-boruto-sasuke.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn59@2020_6/2020/08/24/21-43-30-516_abd09e77ec48e1f9.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598305389185},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","title":"Titans: 10 Arrowverse Sidekicks That Would Fit Perfectly Into The Team","link":"https://www.cbr.com/dc-titans-arrowverse-sidekicks-fit-team/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Titans-10-Arrowverse-Sidekicks-That-Would-Fit-Perfectly-Into-The-Team-featured-image.jpg\"/></figure><p>With <em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/titans/\">Titans</a> </em>being <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/titans-season-three-speculation-comic-best-worst/\">featured at the upcoming DC Fandom event</a>, there's a possibility that DC Comics could announce more roster members for the team. Each season the group has steadily grown to include iconic sidekicks like Aqualad, Robin, and Wonder Girl. There's always room for a crossover though in this multiverse of possibilities!</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/facts-teen-titans-most-people-dont-know/\">10 Fun Facts About The Teen Titans Most People Don’t Know</a></span></p><p>The Worlds of DC as it was once known, means that there's plenty of heroes from across the multiverse that could be valuable allies to the Titans. The <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/arrowverse/\">Arrowverse</a> in particular has a number of heroes that may be perfect additions to the team, perhaps because of their sidekick status, their abilities, or because they are in need of some real guidance right now.</p>\n                        <h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">10 </span>Arsenal</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Aresenal.jpg' /></figure><p>Arsenal, <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/roy-harper-speedy-facts-trivia-fans-forget/\">otherwise known as Roy Harper</a>, has been Oliver Queen's sidekick for quite some time. Team Arrow was already firmly established when Roy joined, but he demonstrated that perhaps the Green Arrow needed a little more help in the field.</p><p>Arsenal has been explored deeply in both the present and the future, but there's no telling how much more he could contribute as a vigilante. The now one-armed character could be a new team leader if Nightwing ever wished to step down from the role. He has both the training and experience to be a key member, matching up to the original roster in skill.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">9 </span>Kid Flash</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Kid-Flash.jpg' /></figure><p><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/death-speed-force-speedster-should-appear-event/\">A speedster</a> is a useful person to have on any team, but luckily for the Titans, Kid Flash is actually one of the fastest heroes in the world. He's seen himself work with the Legends and Team Flash before but is always looking for somewhere to fit in.</p><p>The Titans may be that new family that Wally West is after and he'd certainly be able to contribute a lot in terms of his speed, creating a set of abilities that aren't really present on the team. His calm attitude would be useful in the high tension situations the Titans seem to find themselves in.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">8 </span>Batwing</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Luke-Fox.jpg' /></figure><p>Luke Fox is yet to fully suit up as Batwing but has had a taste of the vigilante life working alongside Batwoman. Now that a new hero will be below the cowl, perhaps it's time for the son of Lucius Fox to move on to new things.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/best-new-titans-members-debuted-last-decade-worst/\">The 5 Best New Titans Members Who Debuted This Last Decade (&#38; The 5 Worst)</a></span></p><p>Asides from being a great tech genius that could serve as the 'man in the chair' for the team, Luke would be in safe hands if he wanted to start <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dc-comics-little-known-facts-trivia-history-luke-fox-batwing/\">transitioning into a role as Batwing</a>. The bond between Dick Grayson and Luke would be a compelling one since they have so much in common.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">7 </span>Allegra Garcia</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Allegra-Garcia-arrowverse.jpg' /></figure><p>Allegra may be a relatively new character for Team Flash, but it's obvious that she still has so much more to learn. It's possible that she won't get everything she needs from Barry and the group, as they are all too far ahead of her in terms of their experiences.</p><p>Allegra may learn more from people of a similar age to her. The Titans would take the sister of Ultraviolet in and perhaps demonstrate how she can use her abilities for good, without hurting anyone.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">6 </span>Speedy</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Thea-Queen.jpg' /></figure><p>Thea Queen didn't actually come from the comics but is instead an original creation of the Arrowverse. This iteration of Speedy seems to have her life together, now that she is creating a new League of Heroes.</p><p>However, what would happen if Thea was moved into an alternate reality. She'd still be looking to build the future of vigilantes and would perhaps find a suitable place amongst the Titans as a mentor and a lethal combatant on the battlefield.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">5 </span>Dreamer</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Dreamer.jpg' /></figure><p>Dreamer <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dc-characters-define-next-era-comics/\">could continue to define the next era of comics</a> as she gains more of a spotlight in her own right. Initially joining team Supergirl, she is overshadowed often by the larger theatrics and characters like Brainiac and Martian Manhunter.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/teen-titans-never-died/\">10 Teen Titans That Have Never Died</a></span></p><p>Dreamer could be a significant member of a different team if she was used properly. Therefore, she may find herself in a much better position with the Titans. They need someone of Dreamer's abilities to predict their next threats and she'd perhaps be an interesting character to crossover with Rachel's powers.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">4 </span>Jesse Quick</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Flash-Jesse-Quick.jpg' /></figure><p>Another Speedster now, the original Jesse Quick was becoming the Flash of her own Earth before it was destroyed in <em>Crisis</em>. There's no telling where she could have ended up, but there's a good chance it's on Earth-9, home of the Titans.</p><p>A new version of Jesse would certainly still be finding her feet, especially in a completely different reality. Once again, someone with the powers of the speed force is an invaluable addition to the team and her hopeful attitude could rub off well on some of the more cynical members of the group.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">3 </span>The Canaries</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Zoe-Ramirez.jpg' /></figure><p>The Canaries were formed in the future of the Arrowverse, with <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/arrowverse-black-canary-differences-dc-comics/\">Black Siren and Black Canary</a> leading the group. Members like Zoe Ramirez are still around in the Arrowverse after <em>Crisis </em>and could be an interesting addition to the Titans.</p><p>There's currently no version of the Canaries on Earth-9. While Black Canary herself may exist, Zoe should be able to move to the Titans universe, pick up some more skills, and perhaps even take up the mantle of Black Star or some other significant title.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">2 </span>Reign</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Reign.jpg' /></figure><p>Reign was actually one of Supergirl's villains for a period of time, acting as one of the world destroyers. However, Sam eventually snapped out of her evil trance and can in many ways now be considered to be a sidekick.</p><p>However, the character has not been seen since, which begs the question where has Reign actually gone? Perhaps she could move to the Titans and learn how to hone her abilities as a hero and as someone who is in control, as opposed to being manipulated by ancient Kryptonian forces.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">1 </span>Lita</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Lita-Arrowverse.jpg' /></figure><p>Lita is the daughter of Mick Rory and is potentially <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/the-flash-captain-cold-heatwave-comparison/\">a future variation of Heatwave</a>. She possesses many of her father's qualities and has started to team up with the Legends on a number of occasions.</p><p>The young warrior needs better role models than a former Flash villain though and could be a far better fit for the teens over at Titans tower. She's resourceful and intelligent and may just have a few heat guns to bring along with her.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">NEXT: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/arrowverse-dc-realities-titans-should-explore/\">Titans: 10 DC Realities That We'd Love To See The Titans Explore</a></span></p>\n                        \n ress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Lita-Arrowverse.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn24@2020_4/2020/08/24/21-43-26-102_46ac7d59e9475684.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598305389175},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","title":"Marvel's Avengers Takes Up a MASSIVE Amount of the PlayStation 4's Storage Space","link":"https://www.cbr.com/marvels-avengers-storage-space-ps4/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Marvels-Avengers-Header.jpg\"/></figure><p>When <em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/marvels-avengers/\">Marvel's Avengers</a></em> debuts next week, it will require players to free up quite a bit of storage space.</p><p>YouTuber TheRelaxingEnd posted an unboxing video of the \"Earth's Mightiest\" edition of the game for Playstation 4 and noted that the game will take 90 MB of memory space. That is double the space of other games, including <em>Marvel's Spider-Man</em> and <em>Batman: Arkham Knight</em>. More space will undoubtedly be taken up for future updates to the game, as well, including DLC content.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/marvels-avengers-first-look-modok-monica-rappaccini/\">Marvel's Avengers Debuts First Look at MODOK, Monica Rappaccini</a></span></p><iframe width=\"480\" height=\"270\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/dfvKwe46Q9w?feature=oembed\" frameborder=\"0\" allow=\"accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture\" allowfullscreen></iframe><p>The \"Earth's Mightiest\" version of the game includes several collectibles inspired by the titular team. Those collectibles include a Hulk bobblehead, a Mjolnir keychain and the blueprints for Iron Man's armor. Players who have purchased the \"Deluxe\" and \"Earth's Mightiest\" versions of the game will have three days of early access. The Beta version of the game has been available to play over the past three weekends.</p><p><em>Marvel's Avengers</em> centers on the reformation of the superhero team after the death of Captain America caused them to disband five years ago. They are joined by Kamala Khan, who takes up the superhero name of Ms. Marvel after being exposed to the Terrigen mists. A.I.M (Advanced Idea Mechanics), meanwhile, intends to use the mists for their own purposes.</p><p>Developed by Crystal Dynamics and Eidos-Montréal and published by Square Enix, <em>Marvel's Avengers</em> arrives on PlayStation 4, Xbox One, Google Stadia and PC on Sept. 4.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a CBR","link":"https://www.cbr.com/yakuza-like-a-dragon-sega-trailer-release-date/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img video game franchise returns for its eighth installment in <em>Yakuza: Like a Dragon</em>, featuring radical gameplay changes to the beat-'em-up series.</p><p>A new gameplay trailer confirms the PlayStation 4, Xbox One and PC release date for Nov. 13, with an <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/xbox-series-x/\">Xbox Series X</a> release set for a currently unannounced date in November and a <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/playstation-5/\">PlayStation 5</a> release also in development. The game had previously been released for the PS4 in its native Japan in January.</p><iframe width=\"480\" height=\"270\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/yJAIqglaIC4?feature=oembed\" frameborder=\"0\" allow=\"accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture\" allowfullscreen></iframe><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/persona-5-royal-is-the-perfect-game-for-quarantined-students/\">Persona 5 Royal Is the Perfect Game for Quarantined Students</a></span></p><p>In a switch from the franchise's usual third-person action in real-time, the action for <em>Like a Dragon</em> sees players engage their opponents in <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/yakuza-like-a-dragon-trailer-different-gameplay/\">turn-based combat</a>, with up to four combatants. Players can use different elements of their environment as battles take place to give the combat a more dynamic feel than most turn-based action sequences.</p><p>The new trailer also spotlights the eclectic character classes players can choose from, including professional break dancers, pop stars, chefs, television show hosts and more. Each class has its own signature move list, as well, making even the most outlandish class choice capable of devastating attacks, including a musician class whose music inspires the crowd to attack the enemies.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/sega-pc-ports-what-want/\">Sega Plans to Port More Games to PC - Here's What We Want</a></span></p><p>Developed by Ryu Ga Gotoku Studio and published by Sega, <em>Yakuza: Like a Dragon</em> arrives on PlayStation 4, Xbox One and PC on Nov. 13.The Xbox Series X and PlayStation 5 release dates have yet to be announced.</p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 24 Aug 2020 17:36:40 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/12/yakuza-like-a-dragon-header.jpg","linkMd5":"c7070b4867c03c51fdd61469366c104d","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn64@2020_2/2020/08/24/21-43-10-465_d120d98c8a845f01.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":701,"sourceBytes":84638,"destBytes":84638,"author":"Sam Stone","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/12/yakuza-like-a-dragon-header.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn64@2020_2/2020/08/24/21-43-10-465_d120d98c8a845f01.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598305389176},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","title":"How John Cena Went From Fancast US Agent to The Suicide Squad's 'Douchey Captain America'","link":"https://www.cbr.com/john-cena-went-from-fancast-us-agent-to-the-suicide-squad/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/john-cena-peacemaker-feature.jpg\"/></figure><p>The DC FanDome event took place over the weekend, and there was an exclusive video first look at the upcoming James Gunn movie, <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/suicide-squad-2/\">The Suicide Squad</a>.</p><p>This video included scenes from the movie, plus interview clips with the cast and director of the film. In the video, John Cena talked about his character, The Peacemaker. When describing his character, Cena called The Peacemaker \"a douchey Captain America,\" and Gunn seemed to agree. The director describes this character as \"the guy who believes in peace at any cost, no matter how many people he needs to kill along the way.\" Cena finishes with a small quip: \"okay, I got it.\"</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dc-fandome-the-suicide-squad-bts-video/\">The Suicide Squad Debuts First Look At DC FanDome</a></span></p><p>For wrestling fans, the role is reminiscent of the character he played throughout his WWE career. Fans of the WWE begged the company to turn Cena heel and have him become a full-fledged bad guy. However, he was too marketable, and that change never happened. As a result, he was a good guy to the end.</p><figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/suicide-squad-john-cena-peacemaker.jpg\"/></figure><p>Now that he is getting a fresh start in movies, he looks like he is moving into that direction. He has a villain role coming up in the next <em>Fast and Furious</em> film, and in <em>The Suicide Squad</em>, he plays a villain forced to be a hero, pure irony based on his past. In the film, he plays a soldier who worked in the comics for Amanda Waller's Shadow Fighters, and one has to wonder if this is the new movie's version of Rick Flagg.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/suicide-squad-idrid-elba-character-revealed-john-byrne-superman-run/\">The Suicide Squad: Idris Elba's Character Revealed (Hint: He Shot Superman with a Kryptonite Bullet)</a></span></p><p>It is also ironic that John Cena will take on the role of The Peacemaker, who is a \"douchey Captain America.\" Two years ago, he teased fans on Instagram that he might be taking on the role of John Walker, causing a lot of dream casting for fans of the Marvel Cinematic Universe.</p><iframe width=\"320\" height=\"320\" frameborder=\"0\" src=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/BpwJr2sF-eo/?utm_source=ig_embed&utm_medium=loading\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe><p>To understand Cena on social media, he seldom posts anything that has his own words and thoughts written out. Instead, he posts photos and images, allowing fans to determine what he means. He also never lets anyone know if they are right or wrong, allowing his pictures to speak for themselves. The image above is of the shield used by John Walker, the man who at one time was Captain America and then became U.S. Agent when Steve Rogers returned.</p><p>What Walker was, at the end of the day, was a \"douchey Captain America,\" and someone who fought for the little people but had no use for saving the world. He openly spoke his mind, had no problem disregarding other heroes and was someone who had no problem killing anyone and everyone to achieve his goals of protecting people. Seeing Cena take on the role of The Peacemaker, which was an exaggerated version of U.S. Agent already, makes all the sense in the world.</p><p><em>Written and directed by James Gunn, The Suicide Squad stars Viola Davis as Amanda Waller, Joel Kinnaman as Rick Flagg, Michael Rooker as Savant, Flula Borg as Javelin, David Dastmalchian, as Polka-Dot Man, Margot Robbie as Harley Quinn, Daniela Melchior as Ratcatcher, Idris Elba as Bloodsport, Mayling NG as Mongal, Peter Capaldi as The Thinker, Alice Braga as Solsoria, Steve Agee as King Shark, Pete Davidson as Blackguard, Nathan Fillion as TDK, Sean Gunn as Weasel, Jai Courtney as Captain Boomerang, John Cena as Peacemaker, Taika Waititi and Storm Reid. The film arrives in theaters Aug. 6, 2021.</em></p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a class=\"bc-title-link\" title=\"WATCH: The Suicide Squad Costumes Revealed in Roll Call Video\" href=\"https://www.cbr.com/suicide-squad-roll-call-video/\">WATCH: The Suicide Squad Costumes Revealed In Roll Call Video</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 24 Aug 2020 17:45:50 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/john-cena-peacemaker-feature.jpg","linkMd5":"b421ac7a6027c4dd6ea4dbb350917050","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn59@2020_6/2020/08/24/21-43-10-633_2b7907ce0ba96107.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":144391,"destBytes":180150,"author":"Shawn S. Lealos","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/john-cena-peacemaker-feature.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn59@2020_6/2020/08/24/21-43-10-633_2b7907ce0ba96107.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/suicide-squad-john-cena-peacemaker.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn83@2020_4/2020/08/24/21-43-26-761_9527e09e019d9147.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598305389175},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","title":"The A.I. Army & 9 Other Superhero Groups That Belong In The MCU","link":"https://www.cbr.com/mcu-marvel-comics-ai-army-superhero-groups/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/AI-Army-MCU.jpg\"/></figure><p>Marvel Comics has generated <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/marvels-avengers-beta-file-massive-roster-earths-mightiest-heroes-villains/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">a long list of superheroes and villains</a>, including many who have never seen their way to any screen as yet. There have been many memorable hero-villain pairs and <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/marvel-superhero-duo-pairing-most-powerful/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">superhero duos</a> over the years, but it’s the big groups like the Avengers and the Guardians of the Galaxy who continue to shape the <a href=\"https://screenrant.com/tag/mcu/\">Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU).</a></p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://screenrant.com/mcu-marvel-movie-avengers-hero-death/\">MCU: Ranking Every Hero Death In The Movies</a></span></p><p>With all the MCU movies – and all of Hollywood, for that matter – delayed, the shape of the next story arcs in Phase 4 is still very uncertain. Here are a few ideas on how some of the more obscure and forgotten super groups, both heroic and otherwise, could shake up the Marvel Cinematic Universe to be.</p>\n                        <h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">10 </span>The A.I. Army</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/AI-Army-1.jpg' /></figure><p>In the world of Earth-616, Tony Stark became convinced that he was an A.I. version of the real and human Tony Stark. He became Mark One, and established the force that looked to put the status of artificial beings on a par with the human race.</p><p>In the MCU, Tony's gone but maybe he created this crew in secret – which includes his sidekick Machine Man, the Awesome Android, Quasimodo, M-11, and an assortment of Nick Fury LMDs (Life Model Decoys) – who could finally make their onscreen debut.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">9 </span>The Anachronauts</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Kang.jpg' /></figure><p>The Anachronauts deserve a spot in the MCU for their name alone. Formed by Kang and appearing in multiple Fantastic Four comics starting in 1992, Kang and his allies battle all the other warriors they meets in their journeys through time and alternate realities. When Kang defeats them, he gets them to swear allegiance to him – and they become one of the Anachronauts.</p><p>Rumors have been swirling for months over a possible appearance by Kang in an upcoming MCU flick or maybe even have him as the next Thanos, meaning that the Anachronauts could follow close behind.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">8 </span>The Illuminati</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/gjco7mfb4mc11-cropped-1.jpg' /></figure><p>The Illuminati would be a cool and very handy way of drawing different story lines together in future MCU ensemble movies. The Illuminati agree to meet behind the scenes to pool information and work together to combat threats to Earth. In the comics, that major threat was the Kree-Skrull War. Controversially, the Illuminati (minus Namor) thought throwing Hulk into space was a good idea, and this decision blew up in their faces during the events of <em>World War Hulk.</em></p><p>Doctor Strange and T'Challa are already in the MCU, making it likely that they'd form a version of the group at some point. Other members include Namor, Reed Richards, and Professor Charles Xavier; all three who have long been rumored to join the MCU in the future. The most problematic members are Tony Stark and Black Bolt, since Tony died in <em>Avengers: Endgame </em>and the King of the Inhumans' MCU debut in <em>Inhumans </em>failed to meet expectations.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">7 </span>The Defenders Of The Deep</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Namor.jpg' /></figure><p>The latest rumors about Namor the Submariner include a possible hint or Easter Egg in the upcoming <em>The Eternals</em>, which will hit screens in February 2021. Once he’s actually made his way into the MCU, the Defenders of the Deep -- his super group who protect the world’s oceans -- can’t be far behind.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/xmen-marvel-cinematic-universe-improvements/\">10 Ways The X-Men Will Make The MCU Better</a></span></p><p>The group includes Tiger Shark, King Crab, Andromeda the Atlantean Warrior, Echidna (a character based on Greek mythology), and other denizens of the deep. They set themselves up to defend the oceans against the abusive air-breathers.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">6 </span>The Offenders</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Offenders.jpg' /></figure><p>This squad of super-villains would shake up the universe of Phase 4 and beyond, with members like Red Hulk and the classic version of Tiger Shark in it. Unfortunately, it may be a while before this villainous team becomes a reality as plans for a <em>The Offenders</em> animated special on Hulu was scuttled, along with a solo <em>Howard the Duck</em> and <em>Tigra &#38; Dazzler</em> TV series.</p><p>The almost-but-didn’t-happen <em>The Offenders </em>would have included Howard, Tigra, Dazzler, Hit-Monkey and M.O.D.O.K. (Mental Mobile Mechanized Organism Designed Only for Killing) as its main cast. Reportedly, Hit-Monkey and M.O.D.O.K. are still moving forward with their own shows, so maybe we’ll see at least some of the Offenders come together at some point. A full-blown live-action incarnation isn't off the cards either, but it may be a long wait.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">5 </span>The Power Elite</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Power-Elite-feature.jpg' /></figure><p>The Power Elite is a highly influential and politically powerful group that formed after Hydra's brief takeover of the United States with the help of a Hydra-influenced Captain America. With Hydra gone, <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/power-elite-secret-illuminati/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">the Power Elite</a> and its message of strengthening and purifying America becomes popular with the public. With public distrust of Captain America and democracy at an all time high, the Power Elite easily secures power.</p><p>During this time, Wilson Fisk becomes mayor of New York City, ex-Hydra commander Baron Strucker runs a prison, and Norman Osborn runs Ravencroft Institute. To top it all off, a Red Skull-controlled Aleksander Lukin commands the Power Elite and a resurrected Phil Coulson is working with them. The members of this group have already been assembling in the background of the comics – the MCU could reveal them through an Easter Egg or have one of its major members make a cameo.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">4 </span>The Unified Thieves &#38; Assassins Guild of New Orleans</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Gambit-Feature-Image.jpg' /></figure><p>Gambit's solo movie may have been cancelled (and this may be stretching the definition of “hero”) but Remy LeBeau, one-time member of the Assassins Guild, often likes to play both sides of the table. Bringing in the Guild would gift the MCU with a unique New Orleans setting plus members like Gambit's ex-wife Bella Donna, the zombie-creating mutant Threnody and others who would provide undeniable color and spice.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/xmen-gambit-best-worst-mutant/\">X-Men: 5 Times Gambit Was The Best Mutant (&#38; 5 He Was The Worst)</a></span></p><p>The Unified Guild didn’t last for very long in the comics, but the conflicts between the Thieves and Assassins would add even more entertainment value to the broadening world of the MCU. Also, someone needs to give Gambit a cinematic break.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">3 </span>The Thunderbolts</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Thunderbolts-10-Worst-Things-Baron-Zemo-Ever-Did.jpg' /></figure><p>In print, it was Baron Zemo who formed The Thunderbolts as part of a nefarious scheme for power. The plan was for the Thunderbolts -- made up of villains donning heroic gimmicks -- to gain public trust by looking like a great replacement for the Avengers, only to then use this newfound goodwill to advance Zemo's plots. Unfortunately for the Baron, members Songbird, Atlas, Moonstone, and others turned against him, and they went on to become forces for good.</p><p>As time went on, the group came to be led by many different characters, including Hawkeye, Luke Cage, and even Norman Osborn. As reformed villains who are now technically anti-heroes, the Thunderbolts know how to beat the enemy because they were once the enemy. They would be an interesting way of recycling old villains who were misused in the MCU.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">2 </span>The Annihilators</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Annihilators.jpg' /></figure><p>Made up of non-Earth based creatures, the Annihilators helped to prevent and/or contain intergalactic warfare. They’ve appeared alongside Groot and Rocket Raccoon, so this group may be a way for those two offbeat heroes to continue their story after their team's presumed finale that is <em>Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 3. </em></p><p>At various times, the Annihilators included the Silver Surfer, Ikon/Spaceknight, Ronan the Accuser, and Beta Ray Bill – someone fans have been waiting to appear since he was teased in the background of <em>Thor: Ragnarok</em>. Now that the MCU includes outer space, it needs its own Space Force.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">1 </span>Heroes For Hire</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Heroes-for-Hire.jpg' /></figure><p>To be fair, we already got a tantalizing glimpse of what the Heroes for Hire might look like, as seen towards the end of Netflix’s<em> Luke Cage</em> series. In the comics, the group forms when Iron Fist joins up with Luke Cage, and they become Power Man and Iron Fist, respectively.</p><p>Heroes for Hire, Inc. -- a group of mercenary heroes who save the day for the right price -- was first formed by lawyer Jeryn Hogarth, and the stories often include Misty Knight, who we miss from the Netflix shows. Others who made their way in and around the group include Black Knight, White Tiger, She-Hulk, Ant-Man and even Deadpool.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">NEXT: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/netflix-marvel-cinematic-universe-best-seasons-imdb/\">The 10 Best Netflix MCU Seasons, Ranked By IMDb Score</a></span></p>\n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 24 Aug 2020 18:30:53 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/AI-Army-MCU.jpg","linkMd5":"570585e6770c5145ea846ac5c587ad08","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn3@2020_3/2020/08/24/21-43-10-475_aa80ef60b998e0ad.webp","destWidth":1710,"destHeight":900,"sourceBytes":339464,"destBytes":339464,"author":"Anya Wassenberg","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/AI-Army-MCU.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn3@2020_3/2020/08/24/21-43-10-475_aa80ef60b998e0ad.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/AI-Army-1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn99@2020_5/2020/08/24/21-43-31-692_4c49dd95eb15fd5f.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Kang.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn39@2020_5/2020/08/24/21-43-26-981_3b6f2e1dc2015241.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/gjco7mfb4mc11-cropped-1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn19@2020_6/2020/08/24/21-43-24-402_27bfe6ae66ec5771.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Namor.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn4@2020_4/2020/08/24/21-43-27-539_bd8d41ca2273485b.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Offenders.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn80@2020_6/2020/08/24/21-43-22-305_287e72eb466a0404.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Power-Elite-feature.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn68@2020_1/2020/08/24/21-43-30-616_512cabaf1c05f0fc.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Gambit-Feature-Image.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn11@2020_5/2020/08/24/21-43-24-381_cb8077e770bda345.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Thunderbolts-10-Worst-Things-Baron-Zemo-Ever-Did.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn36@2020_5/2020/08/24/21-43-26-906_ff7582c772f13a7f.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Annihilators.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn55@2020_5/2020/08/24/21-43-23-286_c1c5b361a9696548.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Heroes-for-Hire.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn63@2020_6/2020/08/24/21-43-29-801_4d604933b4b5f034.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598305389173},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","title":"Star Wars: The Original Version of Lando Calrissian Was EXTREMELY Different","link":"https://www.cbr.com/star-wars-original-version-lando-calrissian/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/lando.jpg\"/></figure><p>Every <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/star-wars/\"><em>Star Wars</em></a> fan knows Han Solo's suave frenemy, Landonis Balthazar Calrissian, better known simply as Lando Calrissian. He has lived many lives -- he was a gambler, smuggler, card player, the Baron Administrator of Cloud City, and eventually a general in the Rebel Alliance. Lando is easily an icon in the <em>Star Wars</em> universe. However, earlier drafts of Lando would have produced a much different version of the character.</p><p>In <em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/the-empire-strikes-back/\">The Empire Strikes Back</a>,</em> George Lucas wanted to introduce a character from Han Solo's past to reveal more of the background of the sarcastic smuggler. He settled on a character named Lando Kadar. In one of the first story conferences for his sequel film, Lucas brought in his ideas for who Lando Kadar might be -- a trader on a Wookie planet, a James Bond-type character, or a clone from the Clone Wars.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/star-wars-darth-vader-qui-gon-obi-wan/\">Star Wars: Darth Vader Proves Why He Was Always BETTER Than Qui-Gon &#38; Obi-Wan</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/star-wars-han-lando.jpg\"/></figure><p>Lucas soon realized that his first idea -- Lando as a trader from a Wookie planet -- wasn't exactly what he was going for. He realized he wanted Lando to be somewhat of a contrast to <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/star-wars-times-han-solo-was-right-mistaken/\">Han Solo</a>. Han is more of an unpolished, crude, rough-and-tumble character, and Lucas wanted Lando to be more refined, slick, and charming. Here is where Lucas began to lean more towards the James Bond-esque version of Lando Kadar: perfect, suave, cunning, and oozing with swagger. Out of Lucas' three ideas, this seems to be the one that eventually stuck.</p><p>Lucas could have stopped there, but he instead took a hard turn. He decided Lando Kadar should be a clone who survived from the Clone Wars, and toyed with the idea of Lando <em>looking</em> human, but not quite <em>being</em> human. Lucas had a whole \"Lando the Clone\" backstory planned out. <a href=\"http://www.forcematerial.com/home/2016/10/24/the-calrissian-clone-connection\">Early scripts reveal</a> that clone Lando's great-grandfather wanted many sons, so he produced them using cells from his own body. His great-grandfather's sister did the same thing, producing daughters in the same manner. The film takes place many years after the Clone Wars and Lando says that there are not many of his kind left, so they try not to attract attention. He also states that he feels truly alone now that he has been exposed to the world and sees that not everyone is a clone.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/star-wars-theory-rey-luke-skywalker-aunt/\">Star Wars Theory: Rey Is Actually Luke Skywalker's... Aunt?!</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/spinoff/2016/08/lando-social.jpg\"/></figure><p>The idea of replacing Lando Calrissian with clone Lando Kadar is very interesting, and would have taken the series in quite a different direction. It would have introduced the history of the <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/star-wars-who-funded-clone-army-creation/\">Clone Wars</a> to the audience much earlier than the series eventually did, and the concept of clones would have been starkly different than what was eventually produced in the prequels. It's likely that Lucas wasn't ready to delve into the Clone Wars quite yet. It's also likely that he believed Lando would be more of a compelling character without the complicated clone backstory.</p><p>Eventually, Lucas eliminated the idea of Lando being a clone. Now, the <em>Star Wars</em> universe has its charming Lando Calrissian, Baron Administrator of Cloud City, complete with his fantastic cape and charm -- and devoid of any clone status.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/star-wars-rey-finn-poe-lego-disney/\">Star Wars: Rey, Finn and Poe Get the LEGO Treatment in Disney+ Holiday Special </a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 24 Aug 2020 13:45:17 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/lando.jpg","linkMd5":"0826afdba103322dd2e6f04d33c55b2f","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn36@2020_1/2020/08/24/21-43-12-102_555df6a26550b55d.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":89006,"destBytes":89006,"author":"Annaliese Yip","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/lando.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn36@2020_1/2020/08/24/21-43-12-102_555df6a26550b55d.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/star-wars-han-lando.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn35@2020_3/2020/08/24/21-43-26-131_77331f9d9b0c4594.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/spinoff/2016/08/lando-social.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn40@2020_1/2020/08/24/21-43-22-806_487b86d0f3985334.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598305389184},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","title":"First Snow Has a TOUGH Hidden Steam Achievement - Here's How to Unlock It","link":"https://www.cbr.com/steam-first-snow-hidden-achievement/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/First-Snow.png\"/></figure><p>On Tuesday, Salty Salty Studios released a new, free-to-play visual novel called <em>First Snow</em>. The <a href=\"http://cbr.com/tag/steam\">Steam</a> download has 10 available achievements that can be unlocked during gameplay, including a post-credits scene. One of these achievements, \"Freedom of Choice,\" is hidden well enough that multiple players have turned to the game's discussion area on Steam to ask about unlocking it. It's not hard to do, but it does require some extra legwork outside of the game proper.</p><p><em>First Snow</em> is a spinoff prequel to the visual novel <em>Twofold</em>. It chronicles Allison Merlo's freshman fall at college as she struggles to adjust to living away from her family, sharing household duties with her roommate, making friends and navigating her sexuality. When she meets artist Eileen Turner, Allison's life turns upside-down yet again.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">Related: <a href=\"http://cbr.com/digital-downloads-sparked-indie-games-rise/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">How Digital Downloads Sparked the Rise of Indie Games</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/First-Snow-painting.png\"/></figure><p>In addition to story-driven Steam achievements, <em>First Snow</em> also asks players to go on a bit of a hunt for its final task. Hidden achievements are often frustrating to unlock, because they involve hoops or bizarre decisions a player wouldn't otherwise make. However, for completionists especially, the feeling of accomplishment in finally earning these digital badges is immense.</p><p><em>First Snow</em> players who hope to collect all 10 Steam achievements will need to <a href=\"https://firstsnow.salty-salty-studios.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">visit the Salty Salty Studios website</a>. There, they can download the game's 18+ patch and follow the instructions to add the content to the Steam download. Once they relaunch the game, the title card will show a small + symbol to indicate success and the settings will have a checkbox for NSFW content.</p><p>To unlock the hidden \"Freedom of Choice\" achievement, players need to install the NSFW patch, then disable it in the game settings.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">Related: <a href=\"http://cbr.com/scott-pilgrim-games-enduring-appeal-explained/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Scott Pilgrim vs. The World: The Game's Enduring Appeal, Explained</a></span></p><p>According to the Salty Salty Studios site, the Steam version of <em>First Snow</em> has had the 18+ content removed due to the platform's content policies. Downloading the patch allows players who are of legal age in their jurisdictions to add it back in. However, there is some slight risk: The patch is provided without warranty.</p><p><em>First Snow</em> can be enjoyed with or without the NSFW content, though some players may feel the experience is incomplete without all of the game's intended imagery. That said, the game can also be downloaded <a href=\"https://firstsnow.salty-salty-studios.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">directly from Salty Salty Studios</a> and it's available on <a href=\"https://salty-salty-studios.itch.io/first-snow\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">itch.io</a>, which gives potential players plenty of options for acquiring and playing the visual novel.</p><p><em>First Snow</em> is available now.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">Keep Reading: <a href=\"http://cbr.com/catherine-full-body-not-on-earth/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Catherine: Full Body May Not Actually Take Place On Earth</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n
