              \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 24 Aug 2020 15:15:53 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/lord-of-the-rings-gollum-.jpg","linkMd5":"a47c1f2be6253ac4cf81929caf9900ad","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn28@2020_5/2020/08/24/21-43-10-454_f105d71285ff6984.webp","destWidth":1920,"destHeight":960,"sourceBytes":247186,"destBytes":247186,"author":"Sam Stone","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/lord-of-the-rings-gollum-.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn28@2020_5/2020/08/24/21-43-10-454_f105d71285ff6984.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598305389180},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","title":"Epic Avatar: The Last Airbender & Legend of Korra Fights NO ONE Has Seen","link":"https://www.cbr.com/video-avatar-last-airbender-legend-of-korra-fights/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Korra-Avatar-State.png\"/></figure><p><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/avatar-the-last-airbender\">Avatar: The Last Airbender</a> and its sequel, <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/the-legend-of-korra/\">The Legend of Korra</a>, featured some astoundingly powerful heroes and villains. However, due to the time gap between the series, there are a lot of fights that we just never got to see. In this new exclusive video, though, we're going to break down some of those potential fights and explain just what would happen.</p><p>We're starting off with Avatar Aang versus Avatar Korra. This is going to be a bit of a complicated fight to explain, as they have similar powers and are incredibly awesome. Aang starts out the series as a master Airbender, learning various other bending styles along the way. The drawback for Aang, though, is that he's young and doesn't get a ton of time to master every ability. Korra, on the other hand, excels at most styles of bending from a young age, even if she never becomes as proficient at Airbending as Aang. Korra, though, can Metalbend, which is a formidable skill. In the end, Korra would probably win, as she's both better trained and a much more fighting-oriented character.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/avatar-kyoshi-rangi-vs-korrasami-best-otp/\">Avatar: Kyoshi/Rangi Vs. Korrasami for Best OTP</a></span></p><p>Check out the video below for more fights no one has ever seen.</p><iframe width=\"480\" height=\"270\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/jCV_ykjtTKg?feature=oembed\" frameborder=\"0\" allow=\"accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture\" allowfullscreen></iframe><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/avatar-theory-spirits-responsible-for-animal-hybrids/\">Avatar Theory: The Spirits Are Responsible for the Animal Hybrids</a></span></p><p>While there have been no new animated series set in the Avatar universe since <em>The </em><em>Legend of Korra </em>concluded in 2014, Dark Horse Comics has published a number of graphic novels set after the conclusions of both <em>The Legend of Korra</em> and <em>Avatar: The Last Airbender</em>. Those comics further flesh out the world of those two series. There are also novels that further expand that world, the most recent of which is <em>The Shadow of Kyoshi</em>, which looks at the exploits of that titular Avatar.</p><p><em>Let us know what you think in the comments, and check out many other deep, thought-provoking videos on <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/user/comicbookresources\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">our YouTube channel</a>! Don't forget to subscribe and click that bell for notifications of brand new content, posted every day!</em></p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING:<a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/avatar-is-aang-monk-anymore/\">Avatar: Is Aang Even A Monk Anymore?</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 24 Aug 2020 21:30:49 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Korra-Avatar-State.png","linkMd5":"2d14e124518e86119590c189cbcb5d3a","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn100@2020_3/2020/08/24/21-43-10-563_cb17d52167f2a9e2.webp","destWidth":1280,"destHeight":640,"sourceBytes":262360,"destBytes":262360,"author":"Liam Nolan","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Korra-Avatar-State.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn100@2020_3/2020/08/24/21-43-10-563_cb17d52167f2a9e2.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598305389172},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","title":"Dog's Life Is Perfect for Gamers Eagerly Awaiting Stray | CBR","link":"https://www.cbr.com/dogs-life-perfect-gamers-awaiting-stray/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/dogs-life.jpg\"/></figure><p>The upcoming PlayStation 5 game <em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/stray/\">Stray</a></em> puts players in the shoes (or paws) of a daring stray cat who wanders around a futuristic city full of neon lights and anthropomorphic robots. With Stray's release date still some time away, many eager gamers are looking for something to curb their appetite for adventurous animal games. A lesser-known PlayStation 2 title, <em>Dog's Life,</em> might be the perfect game to tide video game fans over.</p><p><em>Dog's Life</em> is an unconventional game full of adventure, mystery and humor. It follows a jovial dog named Jake as he ventures out to save his crush Daisy, who has been picked up by the local dog catchers. Jake must explore different the open world to find clues of Daisy's whereabouts. Upon his search, Jake uncovers a conniving plot that puts all the local dogs in jeopardy.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">Related: </span><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/high-score-jerry-lawson-channel-f-cartridge-console/\">How Jerry Lawson's Forgotten Channel F Console Changed Video Games Forever</a></p><figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/dogs-life-2.jpg\"/></figure><p><em>Dog's Life</em> takes place across three different towns, starting in Jake's rural hometown of Clarksville. Eventually, players move to a ski resort called Lake Miniwahwah and an urban metropolis known as Boom City. Every location is vastly different, though not incredibly detailed. The everchanging scenery keeps things fresh and prevents the game from growing stale, providing plenty of things to do to keep players occupied.</p><p>Most of <em>Dog's Life</em> gameplay is exploring the open world to collect different smells, which unlock a variety of minigames. The game's most unique attribute is its Smellovision feature, which players will need to activate to find different scents scattered across each town. The smells are color coated and unlock different things depending on their color and location. One scent might unlock a race, while another unlocks a tug-o-war minigame. If players complete a minigame successfully, they'll receive a bone that will increase Jakes's stats. Bones are key collectibles in <em>Dog's Life</em> and are vital to the game's progression.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">Related: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/apple-epic-games-fortnite-lawsuit-no-exception/\">Apple Responds to Epic Games' Fortnite/App Store Lawsuit: 'We Won't Make an Exception'</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/dogs-life-gameplay.jpg\"/></figure><p>Although <em>Dog's Life</em> can be enjoyed at any age, its obvious the developer created the game with younger audiences in mind. <em>Dog's Life</em> is very light-hearted and full of childish humor, including its fair share of fart jokes and other immature gags. <em>Dog's Life</em> is much more mellow than most modern games as well, offering a laid back and relaxing experience as players traverse the mellow landscape searching for scents and collectibles. <em>Dog's Life</em> is one of those games to wind down to after a long day at work. Its gentle and effervescent nature makes it one of the more tranquil games to come out of the sixth console generation.</p><p><em>Dog's Life</em> is a very original game that is often overlooked by many gamers. While it's not the most polished game in the world, it offers a fresh gaming experience that gamers of all ages can enjoy. It is an extremely relaxing game where players can have simplistic fun and get away from all the troubles in the world. <em>Dog's Life</em> is the perfect game to tide fans over until Stray's highly anticipated release.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/pokemon-go-unova-week-bonus-content/\">Pokémon GO: Everything Happening In Unova Week</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 24 Aug 2020 20:15:17 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/dogs-life.jpg","linkMd5":"69f47723702cd9b90a0aefb5d47262eb","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn27@2020_1/2020/08/24/21-43-09-332_5169fcdab40fb8ab.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":70442,"destBytes":70442,"author":"Zack Millsap","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/dogs-life.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn27@2020_1/2020/08/24/21-43-09-332_5169fcdab40fb8ab.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/dogs-life-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn71@2020_2/2020/08/24/21-43-21-157_101ed6ad598c5335.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/dogs-life-gameplay.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn11@2020_4/2020/08/24/21-43-31-697_500b750e4ffe720d.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598305389171},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","title":"Batman: Clownhunter Is Basically Gotham City’s Punisher | CBR","link":"https://www.cbr.com/batman-clownhunter-gotham-city-punisher/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Punisher-Clownhunter.jpg\"/></figure><p><em><strong>WARNING: The following article contains spoilers for</strong> </em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/batman/\"><strong>Batman</strong></a><em><strong> #97, by James Tynion IV, Jorge Jimenez, Tomeu Morey and Clayton Cowles, available now.</strong></em></p><p>The new character known only as Clownhunter debuted in <em>Batman</em> #96. He is a young Gotham citizen who has had just about enough of the Joker attacking the people of his city. Now that the Clown Prince of Crime's followers are running rampant throughout the city streets, the young man whose real identity remains a secret, for now, has cobbled up together his own costume to go on the hunt for clowns.</p><p>At the start of the <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/joker-war/\">Joker War</a>, this new vigilante went out on his first patrol. We saw him <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/batman-clownhunter-debut/\">claim the life of his first clown-mask wearing thug</a>. thus Clownhunter lived up to his name. Now, he's getting busier and busier. As Gotham plunges deeper into a nightmarish war, the character continues his mission to kill as many clowns as he possibly can in <em>Batman</em> #97.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/batman-why-bruce-wayne-essential/\">Batman Just Proved Why Bruce Wayne Is Still Essential</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Clownhunter-Joker-War.jpg\"/></figure><p>At the start of <em>Batman</em> #97, Punchline and her goons are loading up a shipment of chemicals that will be used to mass-produce a batch of her new version of Joker's Laughing Gas. She instructs them to take the shipment to Ace Chemical, but one of the clowns tells her this is a bad idea considering it's open season on the clowns down in the Narrows -- where Ace Chemicals is located.</p><p>When Punchline asks why the clowns are so scared to go there, she is informed that twelve of them were killed yesterday alone — and, they were all taken out by the same person: Clownhunter.</p><p>Indeed, the young vigilante has stepped up his game already. In the Narrows, we see that he's no longer just using his Batarang-adorned baseball bat to kill his victims. No, he proves to be a resourceful (and brutal) hunter when he uses a fire hydrant and a transformer to short circuit one of the Batmobiles the clowns are driving around in. With no power, the clowns are trapped in the vehicle. Clownhunter uses gasoline and a match to burn his victims alive.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/batman-96-joker-war-harley-quinn-return/\">Joker War: [SPOILER] Is Back - and Ready to Help Batman</a></span></p><p>Later, Clownhunter attacks one of the trucks transporting Punchline's chemicals. He takes the shipment out with a calculated explosion that takes out even more of the clowns, leaving only one of them burned half to death to tell Punchline what happened.</p><p>Clownhunter may have been active for a relatively short period of time, but he's already racked up an impressive body count. He's got a brutal reputation, and the clowns are scared of him. What's more, it looks like he's just getting started, which means things could get a whole lot worse — and much bloodier — for the clowns.</p><p>When the Joker gets wind of Clownhunter later in the issue, he's actually happy. Sure, he's angry that his men are getting killed, but he thinks it's delightful that something is changing in Gotham City. All the members of the Bat-Family follow the Dark Knight's no-kill policy; it's what sets them apart from other vigilantes. But Clownhunter doesn't share this rule. He's declared war on the clowns, and he's hunting them down without mercy.</p><p>Essentially, he's become Gotham's very own Punisher. And right now, that may just be what the city needs.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/batman-joker-war-blackest-night/\">Batman: Joker War Is Building Gotham's Blackest Night</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 24 Aug 2020 04:30:03 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Punisher-Clownhunter.jpg","linkMd5":"3d8bd9e46431a1219331410dd6ddcbfd","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn63@2020_4/2020/08/24/21-43-09-394_f2d0ea1e1bc285d7.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":206125,"destBytes":173834,"author":"Ian Cardona","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Punisher-Clownhunter.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn63@2020_4/2020/08/24/21-43-09-394_f2d0ea1e1bc285d7.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Clownhunter-Joker-War.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn75@2020_3/2020/08/24/21-43-32-232_d87c3c3cd1a175cc.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598305389185},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","title":"The Hulk Survived the End of the World Thanks to Marvel's WEIRDEST Villain","link":"https://www.cbr.com/maestro-future-hulk-villain-modok/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Maestro-1.jpg\"/></figure><p><strong><em>WARNING: The following contains major spoilers for <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/maestro/\">Maestro</a> #1, by Peter David, German Peralta, Jesus Aburtov, Dale Keown, Jason Keith and VC's Ariana Maher, on sale now.</em></strong></p><p>Marvel is in the midst of offering a new origin story for one of <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/hulk/\">Hulk</a>'s greatest villains, the future alternate version of the Hulk known as Maestro. While that villain famously took over a fallen, post-apocalyptic version of the Marvel Universe, this series vows to show how a familiar Bruce Banner could fall so far. And with its first issue, <em>Maestro</em> reveals the surprising role that M.O.D.O.K. played in the villain's devolution.</p><p>The issue starts with what looks like the most well-balanced and content Hulk we've ever seen. He has his brains, is married with children and happily works alongside the Avengers. Even Wolverine asks Hulk what could possibly go wrong in this world. However, it's clear from the start that something is off, despite the scenes of apparent domestic bliss.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a class=\"bc-title-link\" title=\"Maestro: Every Major Version of Marvel's Future Hulk, Explained\" href=\"https://www.cbr.com/maestro-every-version-marvel-future-hulk-explained/\">Maestro: Every Major Version Of Marvel's Future Hulk, Explained</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Hulk-family.jpg\"/></figure><p>After a few pages, this world begins to glitch, and it's revealed that this was all a computer simulator meant to keep Hulk content while the entire world burned around him. The mastermind behind this was none other than M.O.D.O.K. In an interesting turn, M.O.D.O.K.s motive here isn't nefarious. In fact, in keeping Hulk trapped in the simulation, he is trying to save the world.</p><p>The cybernetic M.O.D.O.K., working with A.I.M., was trying to keep Hulk underground until it was safe to go to the surface world again. Hulk wasn't the only superhuman being kept in suspended animation, as Vapor and Abomination were also hooked into the system to keep them content until it was time to bring them out. Thanks to a computer glitch, Hulk came out of the simulation earlier than intended.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a class=\"bc-title-link\" title=\"Maestro: One of the Most Dangerous Artifacts in the Marvel Universe Returns\" href=\"https://www.cbr.com/maestro-one-of-the-most-dangerous-artifacts-in-the-marvel-universe-returns/\">Maestro: One Of The Most Dangerous Artifacts In The Marvel Universe Returns</a></span></p><p>The plan was simple for the mind of M.O.D.O.K. According to the long-time villain, he just wanted to rebuild the world after the humans destroyed it. M.O.D.O.K. explained World War III took place, and nuclear weapons decimated most of the world. Those who survived tried to rebuild, but a new human-led group known as the Black Scythe arrived and decided humanity was supposed to stay dead. They unleashed chemical warfare on anyone left alive.</p><figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/MODOK.jpg\"/></figure><p>M.O.D.O.K. saved certain people, including Hulk, that he felt could revive the world when the time was right. According to M.O.D.O.K., he and A,I,M, took Hulk and several others when the first missiles began to fall to help ensure their survival. And instead of saving more traditional heroes, they only saved those like the Hulk, characters who were strong enough to help save the world by any means necessary. However, even M.O.D.O.K.'s circuitry is beginning to fail, and he had forgotten Hulk was down there.</p><p>Now, Hulk is free, and he realizes that the ideals of heroes were always wrong. Superheroes were so preoccupied with villains and world-ending plots that they were completely blindsided by the most likely outcome: humanity destroying itself through war and strife. M.O.D.O.K. knew that a unique mind was needed to bring the world back from devastation, and those minds belonged to people like the Hulk. However, the Hulk has no interest in rebuilding the world that was, and he's already started down the isolationist path towards becoming the Maestro.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a class=\"bc-title-link\" title=\"Hulk: How the Avenger REALLY Became Immortal\" href=\"https://www.cbr.com/hulk-how-avengers-became-immortal/\">Hulk: How The Avenger REALLY Became Immortal</a></span></p><p><!-- Used for easily cloning the properly namespaced rect --></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 24 Aug 2020 17:20:08 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Maestro-1.jpg","linkMd5":"9f658ea74277f672384cb92b038f43b7","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn83@2020_3/2020/08/24/21-43-11-580_5a5407de1d7fb42f.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":132386,"destBytes":132386,"author":"Shawn S. Lealos","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Maestro-1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn83@2020_3/2020/08/24/21-43-11-580_5a5407de1d7fb42f.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Hulk-family.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn27@2020_2/2020/08/24/21-43-25-198_343cd53b09dad7cb.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/MODOK.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn3@2020_3/2020/08/24/21-43-28-344_7e1677324be0f40e.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598305389176},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","title":"D&D Beyond Vs. Roll20: Which One Should You Use for Your Campaign?","link":"https://www.cbr.com/dd-beyond-vs-roll20-explained/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/dnd-beyond-roll-20.jpg\"/></figure><p><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/dungeons-dragons/\"><em>Dungeons &#38; Dragons</em></a> has seen a resurgence in recent years thanks to the success of the current Fifth Edition and the rise of actual play shows like <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/critical-role/\"><em>Critical Role</em></a>. New players are trying the RPG for the first time, and the game has never been more accessible. This is due in large part to the development of online tools which make running and playing <em>D&#38;D</em> much simpler. Two of the most popular services available are <em>D&#38;D Beyond</em> and <em>Roll20</em>.</p><p>Both serve different functions (with some overlap) and can be used in tandem, but a gaming group may only need to use one over the other. Here's a breakdown of both to help determine which best serves your group's needs.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">Related: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dungeons-dragons-importance-of-the-pantheon/\">Dungeons &#38; Dragons: The Importance of the Pantheon</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/DND-Beyond-Logo.jpg\"/></figure><p>This is Wizards of the Coast's official online service for <em>D&#38;D</em>. It serves as a repository for all of Fifth Edition and primarily functions as a way to easily create and store characters online, as it does all the math for you. It also allows you to search for a specific rule through the compendium rather than flipping through a dozen books. It allows DMs to create campaigns, which players can join with their generated characters, and lets the DM store preplanned encounters for upcoming sessions. Recently, <em>D&#38;D Beyond</em> has added a digital dice rolling function, which is a great tool for new players who don’t feel like investing money in physical dice yet.</p><p>Access to material beyond the basic rules, sourcebooks and adventures must be purchased through the site. Books are sold in bundles or à la carte, giving members the flexibility to pick and choose what material they need. <em>D&#38;D Beyond</em> also has tools for incorporating and sharing homebrew creations with the community and maintains an active forum.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">Related: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dungeons-dragons-5e-how-to-run-a-dark-souls-themed-campaign/\">Dungeons &#38; Dragons 5e: How to Run a Dark Souls-Themed Campaign</a></span></p><p><em>D&#38;D Beyond</em> has three tiers of service plans to suit an individual's needs. To start, there is the Free Tier -- the best option for new players who just want to see what <em>D&#38;D</em> is about. The Free Tier grants members access to the basic rules and the ability to create and join campaigns. Free Tier is limited to six character slots, eight encounter slots and does contain ads.</p><p>Next is the Hero Tier, which is recommended for players who have committed to <em>D&#38;D</em> and are frequent players. Hero Tier costs $25.99 yearly or $2.99 monthly. With it, all ads are removed and players have unlimited character and encounter slots. In addition, Hero Tier grants early access to new tools that get added to the ever-expanding service.</p><p>Finally, there is the Master Tier, which is recommended only for DMs and absolute <em>D&#38;D</em> die-hards. It costs $54.99 yearly or $5.99 monthly. It provides all the same privileges as Hero Tier with one powerful exception -- content sharing. Master Tier subscribers may share any purchased marketplace content for up to five campaigns, with a twelve player cap on each. In plain terms, this means one person with a Master Tier account can share access to all of their purchased materials with up to sixty people. This is a fantastic option and allows even Free Tier members a chance to see the full depth of <em>D&#38;D</em>.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dungeons-dragons-mythic-odysseys-theros-pantheon/\">D&#38;D: Who Are the Gods in the Pantheon of Theros?</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Roll20-Logo.jpg\"/></figure><p><em>Roll20</em> is a different beast. Primarily, it is a Virtual Tabletop (VTT for short), and while it's not the only one out there, but it is the most prominent. A VTT allows for a <em>D&#38;D</em> game to be played completely online. It's main function is to serve as an online game map, replacing the miniatures and grid paper with tokens and rendered maps. But <em>Roll20</em> also provides integrated audio and video chat functions in an attempt to provide as comprehensive an experience as possible.</p><p>Like <em>D&#38;D Beyond</em>, <em>Roll20</em> only grants free access to the basic rules, and any additional sourcebooks or adventures must be purchased separately. The marketplace also sells material not made by Wizards of the Coast. Content creators can upload their own tokens, map tiles, pre-written adventures and more for members to purchase. <em>Roll20</em> also has a \"Looking For Group\" service to help players and DMs find new people to play with.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">Related: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dd-fan-created-combat-wheelchair-inclusivity/\">D&#38;D: Fan-Created Combat Wheelchair Establishes Baseline Inclusivity</a></span></p><p><em>Roll20</em> is also comprised of three subscription tiers. The Free Tier contains advertisements, 100 MB upload storage, a 2 limit on LFG listings and the ability to share purchased content with one campaign of up to five players. It's the best option for new players but is not recommended for DMs due to its limited access to <em>Roll20</em>'s more advanced features.</p><p>The Plus Tier costs $49.99 yearly or $4.16 monthly. At this level, subscribers are granted 3 GB of storage, no ads, the ability to transfer characters between campaigns and unlimited LFG listings. In addition, the Plus Tier allows compendium sharing across three campaigns of up to ten players. Most importantly, it grants access to <em>Roll20</em>'s powerful dynamic lighting system, which allows DMs to create map boundaries and immersive lighting effects.</p><p><em>Roll20</em>'s Pro Tier is recommended for hardcore DMs and content creators for <em>Roll20</em>'s marketplace. It costs $99.99 yearly or $8.33 monthly. Storage is increased to 6 GB, compendium sharing is enabled for five campaigns of up to fifteen people and Pro members' LFG postings are highlighted. The main bonus for the Pro account is the ability to create custom character sheet templates, gain access to community-supported API tools and features as well as the Dev Server, where <em>Roll20</em>'s new features are available for testing.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">Related: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dd-incorporate-one-shots-into-campaigns/\">D&#38;D: How to Incorporate One-Shots Into Extended Campaigns</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/DnD-Easier-to-Make-Characters.jpg\"/></figure><p><em>D&#38;D Beyond</em> and <em>Roll20</em> are both powerful, comprehensive tools, but they are not the same. If your group is looking for an accessible online encyclopedia and repository for their characters then <em>D&#38;D Beyond</em> is the right service for you. However, if your group is looking to play completely online, <em>Roll20</em> is the better choice since, unlike <em>Beyond</em>, it is primarily a virtual replacement for maps and miniatures. <em>D&#38;D Beyond</em> has a friendlier interface in regards to finding and sorting through the multitude of supplements, but it cannot serve as a replacement tabletop.</p><p>Of course, <em>D&#38;D Beyond</em> and <em>Roll20</em> are not mutually exclusive. Many online groups use both, with <em>Roll20</em> doing its main job as a virtual tabletop and <em>D&#38;D Beyond</em> serving as a more comprehensive way to lookup rules. In fact, there is a third-party extension called <em>Beyond20</em> that allows the two services to interact. With <em>Beyond20</em>, a player can click on an attack or skill on their <em>Beyond</em> character sheet and have it roll on <em>Roll20</em>'s tabletop. The <em>Beyond20</em> extension is a boon for DMs, as it quickly allows them to add in new monsters without having to set up a new character sheet or tokens. No matter which route a group goes, <em>D&#38;D Beyond</em> and <em>Roll20</em> both offer invaluable services that make <em>D&#38;D</em> easier than ever before.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dungeons-dragons-my-little-pony-campaign/\">Dungeons &#38; Dragons: How to Create a My Little Pony Campaign</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 24 Aug 2020 18:15:34 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/dnd-beyond-roll-20.jpg","linkMd5":"e2ddeb62b04f7b2712e019cebbab436d","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn96@2020_2/2020/08/24/21-43-11-670_23ddd81dd9e92593.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":144088,"destBytes":144088,"author":"Ari David","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/dnd-beyond-roll-20.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn96@2020_2/2020/08/24/21-43-11-670_23ddd81dd9e92593.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/DND-Beyond-Logo.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn79@2020_4/2020/08/24/21-43-26-595_fee5ae9d0b43de3f.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Roll20-Logo.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn32@2020_3/2020/08/24/21-43-27-911_798a7d076a8be09a.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/DnD-Easier-to-Make-Characters.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn100@2020_5/2020/08/24/21-43-24-952_667ea1f02fcc36d9.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598305389184},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","title":"DC: 10 Pieces Of Gorilla Grodd Fan Art That Make Us Go Bananas","link":"https://www.cbr.com/gorilla-grodd-best-fan-art-dc-comics/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/gorilla-grodd-art.jpg\"/></figure><p>Gorilla Grodd is arguably the Flash's most iconic villain. His <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/best-worst-apes-in-comics-ranked/\">bizarre and strangely coherent ideology for ape supremacy</a> is a recurring theme in the many stories he is involved in, rendering him  a welcome relic of the past where more outrageous villain concepts were embraced.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/marvel-carnage-vs-avengers-win-lose/\">Avengers: 5 Members Carnage Can Defeat (&#38; 5 He'd Lose To)</a></span></p><p>He swings into battle with more than just the physical striking power of a fully developed gorilla. His mind is his greatest tool, utilized to create weapons and hypnotize his opponents into doing his bidding. Thanks to these distinctive qualities, many fans have attributed art to him, honoring the villain in all of his simian glory.</p>\n                        <h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">10 </span>Cyber Monkey</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/ENHANCE.jpg' /></figure><p>Gorilla Grodd is more than a supervillain; he is a creature of science, citing his intellectual superiority as reason to transform humanity into apes. <a href=\"https://www.deviantart.com/phil-cho/art/Gorilla-Grodd-Earth-27-commission-634071091\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Phil-cho</a> demonstrates this affinity through their artwork, outfitting DC's most menacing beast with a full set of cybernetic augmentations.</p><p>The most noticeable feature is his eyepiece, a green mechanic iris contrasting his blood-red ordinary pupil. Given how much metal is strewn about his body, it makes one wonder what of the ape is left after these drastic changes. Intriguingly, <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/justice-league-cyborgs-most-powerful-weapons/\">his armor application is reminiscent of Teen Titan's Cyborg</a>.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">9 </span>Mad World</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/mad-world.jpg' /></figure><p><a href=\"https://www.deviantart.com/vinhluanluu/art/Gorilla-Grodd-576506382\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Vinhluanluu</a> brilliantly depicts Gorilla Grodd's insatiable thirst for conquest in this piece. With a blood-red background, he looms over an unsuspecting Central City, doubtlessly fantasizing about its destruction and how he might arrange it.</p><p>It also reflects the fact that Grodd's idealistic world does exist elsewhere, in the form of Gorilla City. As its namesake implies, it is a model for what he wishes to bring upon to the rest of the world — a literal planet of the apes. Should the Justice League fail to thwart him, he would doubtlessly succeed.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">8 </span>Bow Before Grodd</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/grodd-3.jpg' /></figure><p>The talented <a href=\"https://www.deviantart.com/admirawijaya/art/Gorilla-Grodd-84304550\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">AdmiraWijaya</a> reminds fans that while Grodd's criminal mind is a tremendous asset, it is perfectly complemented by his physical brawn. In this image, he seizes the Flash by the throat, dangling him over the edge of a building and roaring triumphantly.</p><p>It is reminiscent of King Kong, a less intelligent primate that Grodd would likely attempt to distance himself from. Nonetheless, as much as he may posture otherwise, the villain cannot suppress his bestial nature forever, especially in the heat of battle. His ferocity is as much of a blessing as it is a curse.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">7 </span>Smug Simian Smile</h2><figure><img src='' /></figure><p>Justinwasson cleverly contrasts a black-and-white color scheme with the vibrant golden helmet his Grodd is currently experimenting with. The device is no ordinary trinket; through it, he is able to hone his mind-control abilities, dominating the willpower of the Flash.</p><p>Grodd's mind control was even nearly enough to overcome Lex Luthor's vast intellect. If Superman's arch-nemesis hadn't come prepared with his own countermeasures, the Legion of Doom would be in the Gorilla's broad and capable hands. Such an outcome would redefine the series and give fans a finale significantly different than Darkseid's return.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">6 </span>Grim Gorilla Grit</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/determination.jpg' /></figure><p><a href=\"https://www.reddit.com/r/FlashTV/comments/5wdub2/gorilla_grodd_fanart_that_i_made/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">TheKubist</a> presents a Grodd that is often unseen: one deep in contemplative thought. It is another side of the character that is often underappreciated since whatever screentime he has is usually attributed to his machinations.</p><p>Abandoning many traditional comic conventions, Kubist portrays an authentic Grodd, one that could plausibly run rampant in our world. The realism conveyed in this artwork makes it more compelling, successfully bringing us to appreciate the character's visceral grace and power. Without the Flash to protect us, <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/gorillas-monkeys-apes-in-comics/\">Grodd's existence would evince dire, apelike consequences</a>.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">5 </span>Game On</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/flash-vs-grodd-1.jpg' /></figure><p><a href=\"https://www.deviantart.com/dan-the-artguy/art/theFlash-v-Gorilla-Grodd-680931434\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Dan-the-artguy</a> wittily synthesizes his pop culture knowledge to complete this piece. This scene between the Flash and Gorilla Grodd may seem familiar, and rightfully so. It is an homage to Mario's rivalry with Donkey Kong, one where he jumps barrels and climbs ladders to defeat the monster and save the girl.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/justice-league-villains-vs-avengers-who-would-win/\">5 Justice League Villains That Could Beat The Avengers (&#38; 5 The Avengers Could Beat)</a></span></p><p>Though this piece may be somewhat cheeky, it is a welcome return to Gorilla Grodd's origins as an entertaining character. As many heinous atrocities as he can claim responsibility for, a talking monkey will always remain a novelty villain to some degree.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">4 </span>Feral Rage</h2><figure><img src='' /></figure><p>Lunattic calls attention to Gorilla Grodd's savagery, one he may indulge in in numerous encounters with his heroic adversaries. Abandoning any notions of intellectual superiority, this ape has a single focus in mind: the demise of those who would obstruct his goals.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dc-flash-villain-tactics-abilities-stolen/\">The Flash: 10 Things He Learned &#38; Stole From His Villains</a></span></p><p>Judging by the skulls behind him, this Grodd has succeeded in his brutish mission to some extent. As flashy and dramatic as many heroes' antics might be, they still suffer from human mortality. A few well-connected punches would be all Grodd needs to defeat most of the Justice League.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">3 </span>Mind Over Monkey</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/mind-gorilla.jpg' /></figure><p><a href=\"https://www.deviantart.com/timlevins/art/Justice-League-vs-Grodd-cover-721347928\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">TimLevins</a> portrays a Grodd that has accomplished the impossible; through cunning and intelligence, he has managed to turn most of the Justice League into apes. Firestorm, Hawkman, and Wonder Woman screech and lumber about inconsolably, with only Green Lantern and Vixen shielded from his sinister schemes.</p><p>It's worth mentioning that this Gorilla Grodd stylistically borrows from 2004's <em>Justice League Unlimited.  </em>In this series, Grodd would play a proactive role, asserting himself as the main antagonist in several episodes and jockeying for power within the Legion of Doom.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">2 </span>Run, Barry!</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/run-barry.jpg' /></figure><p><a href=\"https://www.deviantart.com/cartoonartworks/art/The-Flash-vs-Gorilla-Grodd-772147550\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">CartoonArtworks</a> realizes the Flash's considerable disadvantages when going against his most famous rival. Flash does not have Grodd's intelligence, durability, or strength, instead relying primarily on speed and  creativity to outmaneuver his primate opponent.</p><p>In this image, he narrowly avoids being pounded into the concrete by the vengeful villain. The force of the blow is powerful enough to crack the road, entailing Grodd's unparalleled physical might. Our hero notices how close the blow was to connecting, unsettling him amidst their melee. Were it not for Barry's wonderful agility, Central City would quickly devolve into Grodd's newest playground and experimental laboratory.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">1 </span>Total Domination</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/total-domination.jpg' /></figure><p>In the past, Gorilla Grodd has successfully transformed his opponents into monkeys only to later be defeated in their newest maligned forms. In this sketch by <a href=\"https://www.deviantart.com/stonegate/art/Gorilla-Grodd-Wins-JLApe-208412191\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Stonegate, </a>we glean a dark future where no such victory can exist.</p><p>Standing atop the broken carcasses of the Flash, Batman, Wonder Woman, and even Superman himself, Grodd beats his chest, howling his triumph and ensuring it is known by all. His dreams have finally become a reality, and those who stood in his way have been permanently put down by his hand.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">NEXT: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/justice-league-watchtower-facts-trivia/\">Justice League: 10 Secret About The Watchtower Every Fan Should Know</a></span></p>\n                        \n 05:43:09","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","title":"The Batman's Violent Beatdown, 'I'm Vengeance' Scene Recreated... in LEGO","link":"https://www.cbr.com/the-batman-im-vengeance-lego-recreation/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/the-batman-new-header.png\"/></figure><p>One of the standout scenes from <em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/the-batman/\">The Batman</a></em>'s first official trailer has gotten a LEGO makeover.</p><p>The scene in question features a gang of thugs facing Robert Pattinson's Batman. \"Who the hell are you supposed to be?\" one asks. In response, the Dark Knight delivers a fierce beatdown and growls, \"I'm vengeance.\" Filmmaker Forrest Whaley posted his recreation on Twitter, with the simple title of \"VENGEANCE.\"</p><iframe width=\"320\" height=\"320\" frameborder=\"0\" src=\"https://twitter.com/forrestfire101/status/1297574600948084736\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/the-batman-eternals-barry-keoghan-cast-report/\">Eternals' Barry Keoghan Reportedly Boards Matt Reeves' The Batman</a></span></p><p>Whaley is no stranger to animating LEGO films or DC characters. He's worked in the animation department for various DC/LEGO projects, including <em>The LEGO Batman and Superman Movie</em> and <em>LEGO Batman: Jokers Team-Up!</em> He also served as an animator on the stop-motion superhero satire <em>SuperMansion</em>.</p><p><em>The Batman </em>features Robert Pattinson's Caped Crusader tracking down a string of grisly murders, which puts him into conflict with The Riddler. Director Matt Reeves revealed the first trailer at DC FanDome and spoke about his \"very human, very flawed\" version of the Dark Knight. The film will resume production in the United Kingdom in September after being shuttered due to the coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic.</p><p>Directed by Matt Reeves and written by Reeves and Mattson Tomlin, <em>The Batman</em> stars Robert Pattinson as Bruce Wayne/Batman, Andy Serkis as Alfred Pennyworth, Jeffrey Wright as James Gordon, Zoë Kravitz as Selina Kyle/Catwoman, Colin Farrell as Oswald Cobblepot/The Penguin, Paul Dano as Edward Nashton/The Riddler, John Turturro as Carmine Falcone and Peter Sarsgaard as District Attorney Gil Colson. The film arrives in theaters Oct. 1, 2021.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/twilight-official-twitter-robert-pattinson-batman-approval/\">Twilight's Official Twitter Account Gives Robert Pattinson's Batman the Seal of Approval</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 24 Aug 2020 19:37:19 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/the-batman-new-header.png","linkMd5":"2288532a32b1e48e489f9753c2c32096","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn67@2020_4/2020/08/24/21-43-09-338_dd4b0a9a2c201e8e.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":352820,"destBytes":352820,"author":"Collier Jennings","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/the-batman-new-header.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn67@2020_4/2020/08/24/21-43-09-338_dd4b0a9a2c201e8e.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598305389172},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","title":"Lovecraft Country Reveals Its Characters' Greatest Fears | CBR","link":"https://www.cbr.com/lovecraft-country-episode-2-reveals-characters-greatest-fears/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/lovecraft-country-header-1.jpg\"/></figure><p><em><strong>WARNING: The following contains major spoilers for <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/lovecraft-country/\">Lovecraft Country</a> Season 1, Episode 2, \"Whitey's on the Moon,\" which aired Sunday on HBO.</strong></em></p><p>While a resilient group, enduring both systemic racism rampant in 1950s America and the monstrous horrors of Ardham, Massachusetts, Atticus Freeman and his friends are not without their own deep-seated fears. Atticus, his uncle George and their friend Letitia Lewis' respective anxieties are made real in the latest episode of <em>Lovecraft Country</em> when the trio is held captive by the sinister Sons of Adam, visibly shaking them to their core.</p><p>After barely surviving a night filled with <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/lovecraft-country-historical-roots-scariest-scene/\">racist sheriffs and ravenous vampires</a> in the New England woods, Atticus and the others were welcomed into a palatial estate, which is the last known whereabouts of Atticus' missing father, Montrose Freeman. While Atticus remained wary of the <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/lovecraft-country-introduces-cult/\">mysterious group</a> running the estate, Letitia and George quickly settled into their new digs, with the former finding a full wardrobe tailored to her size while the latter marveled over bookcases stocked with his favorite texts. Sure enough, Atticus realizes this is all just an elaborate trap and that his missing father is being used as bait.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/lovecraft-country-outdone-stranger-things-one-way/\">Lovecraft Country Has Already Outdone Stranger Things in One Huge Way</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Jonathan-Majors-1.jpg\"/></figure><p>Atticus learns that the organization running the mansion is a religious cult known as the Sons of Adam, who use dark magic to keep Letitia and George docile while preparing Atticus for a mystical ritual related to his true bloodline. While Christina Braithwaite, daughter of the cult's leader Samuel Braithwaite, agrees to remove the spells inhibiting Letitia and George's memories and cognition, the three are confined to their bedrooms while preparations for the ritual continue. And while one spell has been lifted from the captive guests, they soon discover that they have been subjected to an even more insidious form of dark magic.</p><p>Leti is greeted by a vision of Atticus and confides in him that her entire life she has been plagued with insecurities and abandonment issues stemming from her mother leaving her as a child after the death of her stepfather. In the moment of vulnerability, Leti kisses Atticus, unaware that the image of her friend is just a magically induced hallucination. Over in his bedroom, Atticus has problems of his own, as he's attacked by a young North Korean woman wielding a knife. After the skirmish, Atticus is revealed to be deeply haunted by his actions during the Korean War, with the woman seemingly someone he killed while in the military. George's vision is more peaceful, reunited with his deceased wife Dora. Instead of being unnerved, George realizes the vision isn't real and joins her for one last dance.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/lovecraft-country-series-premiere-shoggoth-explainer/\">Lovecraft Country: What are the Shoggoth, the Series’ First Monsters?</a></span></p><p>While the characters eventually come to their senses and are released from their respective bedrooms, the hallucinations offer an interesting glimpse into each of the their psyches that will likely inform their decisions as the season progresses. And with the trio under constant observation by the Sons of Adam, the sinister cult now knows what makes each of its captives tick mentally, making the secret organization even more dangerous than before. Each of them has their own heart of darkness, and thanks to the dark magic of the Sons of Adam, Atticus and friends just confronted each of their own demons head-on.</p><p><em>Starring Jonathan Majors, Jurnee Smollett, Aunjanue Ellis, Abbey Lee, Jada Harris, Wunmi Mosaku and Michael K. Williams, Lovecraft Country airs Sundays at 9 p.m. ET/PT on HBO.</em></p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/lovecraft-country-dejah-thoris-team-up/\">Lovecraft Country Features a Surprise Team-Up With a Major John Carter Character</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 24 Aug 2020 03:45:14 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/lovecraft-country-header-1.jpg","linkMd5":"05dafcad46501f7e72c8ec2d6946f762","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn51@2020_2/2020/08/24/21-43-09-388_6e00dbea879a8079.webp","destWidth":1920,"destHeight":960,"sourceBytes":191472,"destBytes":191472,"author":"Sam Stone","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/lovecraft-country-header-1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn51@2020_2/2020/08/24/21-43-09-388_6e00dbea879a8079.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Jonathan-Majors-1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn40@2020_2/2020/08/24/21-43-28-863_d725a8c1dda3f646.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598305389186},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","title":"Seven Deadly Sins: 5 Ways Merlin Is The Best Supporting Character (& 5 It's Diane)","link":"https://www.cbr.com/seven-deadly-sins-merlin-vs-diane-best-supporting-character-meliodas-arthur-elizabeth/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/merlin-diane.jpg\"/></figure><p>Merlin and Diane are two of <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/seven-deadly-sins-meliodas-memes-funny/\">Meliodas</a>'s closest allies and among his most faithful companions on<a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/seven-deadly-sins/\"> <em>The </em><em>Seven Deadly Sins</em></a>. The future Queen of Giants was the first <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/seven-deadly-sins-zodiac/\">Sin</a> to rejoin him on his quest to reassemble the group, while the sorceress has been at his side for thousands of years, even befriending older incarnations of Elizabeth.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/seven-deadly-sins-best-elaine-fan-artwork/\">Seven Deadly Sins: 10 Pieces Of Elaine Fan Art That Are Simply Adorable</a></span></p><p>Each woman brings different qualities to the group, whether by merit or personality, which greatly enriches it. To accurately assess which is better, we must analyze facts and instances in which they both have had an opportunity to shine. Through comparing the two, we find which of them is a better supporting character.</p>\n                        <h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">10 </span>Diane - Surviving A Rigged Test</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/drole-diane-Cropped.jpg' /></figure><p>When <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/seven-deadly-sins-commandments-power-ranked/\">Gloxinia and Drole</a> devised a test by which to weigh the merits of King and Diane, the only way out was to avoid making the same decision their historic counterpart did without knowing what that choice might have been. Simultaneously, if either dies in the re-enactment, so too would they die in the waking world.</p><p>When Zeldris defeated Diane and gave her the same choice Drole had, there seemed to be no plausible solution. Accordingly, she created her own, fleeing the battle and avoiding the taboo of \"cowardice\" prevalent in the giant race.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">9 </span>Merlin - Loyalty To Arthur</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/arthur-merlin-Cropped.jpg' /></figure><p>The destined savior of humanity, Merlin's allegiance to King Arthur and Camelot is especially relevant. She is willing to put aside <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/seven-deadly-sins-anime-pairins-fans-wanted-actually-got/\">Escanor's affection</a> for it, even risking her own life to save him by appearing in the midst of the Demon Realm's four most savage warriors (one of which was able to defeat her and the rest of the Sins by himself).</p><p>Merlin's desire to cultivate Arthur's potential not only demonstrates a concern for kingdoms beyond Liones, it shows she has the foresight and can understand what the boy is capable of in the right hands.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">8 </span>Diane - Saving Elizabeth</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/elizabeth-Cropped.jpg' /></figure><p>Despite being shrunken to the size of a doll, Diane nevertheless showed incredible courage in the face of danger. Determined to rid Meliodas of his<a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/the-seven-deadly-sins-couples-work-dont-work/\"> relationship</a> with Elizabeth, Chandler rushed her and attempted to land a blow that would have claimed her life. However, the tiny giant used \"Heavy Metal,\" rendering her durable enough to take the brunt of the impact.</p><p>Diane would also assume a more aggressive role in the fight, charging the man who shrunk her and relentlessly pummeling him with her fists. Though this would ultimately not be enough, it proves her courage all the same.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">7 </span>Merlin - Perfect Cube</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/merlin-cube-Cropped.jpg' /></figure><p>Merlin's \"Perfect Cube\" provides an invaluable defense for the Sins, one which is able to shield less durable people or concentrate a fight in a certain area without obliterating everything around it.</p><p>This was utilized against Galand to protect the Sins' weaker members, with Ban and Meliodas while satisfying their grudge match, and later between <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/seven-deadly-sins-meliodas-perfect-protagonist-escanor/\">Meliodas and Escanor</a>, who together would muster enough force to crack the ground beneath their feet. Were it not for this utility, the group would face many more unnecessary dangers.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">6 </span>Diane - Forgiving Gowther</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/gowther-Cropped.jpg' /></figure><p>Unable to correctly process his emotions for fear of suffering the pain of loss once again, Gowther did not understand the intimacy Diane and King shared. As a consequence, he would banish the giant's memories soon after, resetting the relationship between her and her fairy companion once again.</p><p>After reliving the past through Drole's eyes, Diane was able to understand what he had been through. Instead of holding a grudge, she knew that he needed companionship rather than retribution, putting aside the <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/seven-deadly-sins-gowther-traitor-vs-hero/\">grievous wrong</a> he had dealt to her and offering to be his friend instead.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">5 </span>Merlin - Magical Items</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/merlin-items-Cropped.jpg' /></figure><p>Merlin offers more than direct offensive and defensive utilities to the Sins ~ she supports them through a plethora of magical items, ones which help her friends blend in during daily life.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/seven-deadly-sins-best-ban-fan-artwork/\">Seven Deadly Sins: 10 Pieces Of Ban Fan Art That Leave Us Greedy For More</a></span></p><p>Examples include Escanor's glasses, which are able to contain his terrifying power even during the day, and Diane's size manipulation. The latter is particularly useful when she wants to join the group in activities her size would otherwise make impossible, such as tending to a wounded ally or participating in the fighting festival.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">4 </span>Diane - Redefining Giant Identity</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/diane-and-matrona-Cropped.jpg' /></figure><p>Unlike Merlin, Diane is not a paragon of her people. Her values of empathy, kindness, and a willingness to retreat when necessary starkly contrast the giant's rigid philosophy of tireless battle until they meet their demise.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/seven-deadly-sins-hawk-trivia/\">The Seven Deadly Sins: 10 Things You Didn't Know About Hawk</a></span></p><p>After a battle in which Matrona was poisoned by treacherous Holy Knights, she lingered on the brink of death. Only one person was able to help her; her future partner, Zalpa. He was a savage that Diane had spared in a previous fight. Were it not for her mercy, Matrona would have perished.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">3 </span>Merlin - Defeating Grayroad</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/grayroad-Cropped.jpg' /></figure><p>Grayroad's commandment of pacifism made her a nearly impossible opponent to destroy. She had all of the durable of the other nine demons, though anyone who dared to strike her would rapidly age and wither.</p><p>The only person to circumvent this was Merlin, and she was effectively immortal. Because there was no limit to the years she would live, she could not wither by the demon's spell. Additionally, the blessings of the goddess and demon races protected her from it, making her arguably the only person who could have defeated the demon (save Ban).</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">2 </span>Diane - Growth</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/diane-potential-Cropped.jpg' /></figure><p>Diane's growth is one more than physical. Over the duration of the series, she has overcome her enviousness of Meliodas (as she had previously desired to be with him), her insecurity as a \"lesser\" giant, and even the many obstacles which had separated her and King from being together.</p><p>Just as importantly, her power has also seen a dramatic increase, first from receiving her Gideon and next from the lessons of Drole. This contrasts Merlin's personality and skills, which have remained mostly static throughout the story.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">1 </span>Merlin - Outsmarting The Two Strongest Powers In The Universe</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/demon-king-Cropped.jpg' /></figure><p>The daughter of wizards and a child prodigy, Merlin's skills attracted the notice of the Supreme Deity and Demon King, the rulers of the angel and demon races respectively. Interested in recruiting her to their cause, each offered her gifts to tremendously enhance her power.</p><p>Instead of being swayed in either direction, she simply took both gifts for herself. Though this would lead to the destruction of her homeland, she nonetheless lived to tell the tale, avoiding the wrath of gods and their servants for millennia to come.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">NEXT: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/seven-deadly-sins-elaine-problems-logic/\">Seven Deadly Sins: 10 Things That Make No Sense About Elaine</a></span></p>\n press/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/demon-king-Cropped.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn60@2020_1/2020/08/24/21-43-29-794_7e8857eaf56e8512.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598305389174},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","title":"The God of High School Just Lured Mori Into a Deadly Trap | CBR","link":"https://www.cbr.com/the-god-of-high-school-episode-8-lured-mori-deadly-trap/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/God-of-High-School-Mujin-Episode-8-header.png\"/></figure><p><em><strong>WARNING: The following contains spoilers for Season 1, Episode 8 of </strong></em><strong><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/god-of-high-school/\">The God of High School</a><em>, \"close/friend,\" now streaming on Crunchyroll.</em></strong></p><p><em>The God of High School</em>'s latest episode is full of emotional highs and lows for its main hero, Jin Mori. Always the type to wear his heart on his sleeve, Mori can't hide a sudden bout of melancholy from his friends, Mira and Daewi, who mistake his mood for a lack of faith in their abilities as a team to make it the end of the national tournament. By the episode's end, Mori's spirits are lifted with a surprise birthday party, which is Mira and Daewi attempt to bring him out of his funk; however, the following morning brings the worst present ever: a ransom note for his missing grandpa.</p><p>Given all that has happened so far leading up to this cliffhanger, we know exactly who the culprits are, and what their game is.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">Related: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/crunchyroll-launches-the-god-of-high-school-streetwear-collection/\">Crunchyroll Launches Eye-Popping God Of High School Streetwear Collection</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/God-of-High-School-Mira-Daewi-birthday.png\"/></figure><p>Unbeknownst to Mira and Daewi, Mori recently received news from tournament boss, Park Mujin, that Mori's grandpa, Jin Taejin, is likely dead. Mujin's team, while out looking for Taejin, discovered the site of the huge explosion at which he fought the Nox cultists. There was enough of the older man's blood left behind to presume he didn't make it out alive. Naturally, this information is what sends Mori into a depressive tailspin in Episode 8 -- which is only made <em>worse </em>by the fact that it's his birthday. His grandpa seemingly left him to fight the \"bad guys\" when he was just six-years-old, and all Mori has left of him is a photo of the two of them together. Now, just turning 17, Mori stares at the picture and wonders if the possibility of Taejin ever returning as promised is gone forever.</p><p>Meanwhile, Mujin and Nox are declaring all-out war on each other. Nox has already dealt heavy blows to the powerful Mujin: assassinating announcer Sim Bongsa; attempting to <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/the-god-of-high-schools-q-pushes-past-his-limit-in-exclusive-episode-7-clip/\">kill Commissioner Q at his home</a> and imbedding a mole right under Mujin's nose. What Nox doesn't know is that they actually failed to kill Bongsa's family as planned -- thanks to Commissioner's P's Marionette charyeok -- and that <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/god-of-high-school-episode-6-mujin-nox-mistake-traitor/\">Mujin is now well-aware of the traitor</a>. At a meeting with his staff, he instructs them to remove their limiters and strike the turncoat at full-force, as well as stop Nox from ruining the God of High School tournament. \"We must obtain the Key that will bring down God at any cost.\"</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">Related: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/the-god-of-high-school-epside-6-jugok-unstoppable-monster-nationals/\">The God Of High School: An Unstoppable Monster Tears Through Nationals</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/God-of-High-School-Jin-Taejin.png\"/></figure><p>Nox's mysterious leader, at the same, addresses their acolytes with a similar speech. \"People who have forgotten God’s greatness and corrupted our world are attempting power that rivals that of God himself. Stop them, and do what you must to destroy the Key that threatens God!\" As each of them namedrops the \"Key,\" the anime cuts to Mori, hard at work training, making it obvious that Mori is, at the very least, a potential holder of this title. That also puts a target squarely on his back for Nox.</p><p>The day after Mori's birthday, he receives an anonymous letter with a map and photo of his grandpa's beaten and tied-up body inside. The good part is that Mujin might be wrong about Taejin being likely dead, but it also confirms that Mori is next on Nox's hit list. Luring him away from the tournament to rescue his grandpa kills two birds with one stone: disrupting Mujin's tournament by removing a frontrunner while, at the same time, destroying the thing that the sinister group views as an anti-God weapon. Whether or nor Mori is smart enough to recognize how obvious the trap is is irrelevant -- he's lead by his feelings, and will probably do whatever it takes to recover his only family.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/the-god-of-high-school-episode-6-dragon-ball-mori-goku/\">The God Of High School Makes Its Dragon Ball Connection Unmistakable</a> Collins","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/God-of-High-School-Mujin-Episode-8-header.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn99@2020_6/2020/08/24/21-43-11-688_31fd3a2b2cd25d57.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/God-of-High-School-Mira-Daewi-birthday.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn31@2020_6/2020/08/24/21-43-26-097_39a266103aab32a6.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/God-of-High-School-Jin-Taejin.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn55@2020_1/2020/08/24/21-43-24-607_21e5a398243aa064.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598305389180},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","title":"Justice League: Watchmen's Patrick Wilson Responds to Zack Snyder's Song Choice for HBO Max Trailer","link":"https://www.cbr.com/justice-league-watchmen-patrick-wilson-responds-hallelujah-song-choice-zack-snyder/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2018/07/aquaman-orm.jpg\"/></figure><p>Actor Patrick Wilson had a clever response to the song used in the <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/zack-snyder-justice-league-trailer-darkseid-shocking-death/\">new trailer</a> for Zack Snyder's director's cut of <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/justice-league-film/\">Justice League</a>.</p><p>The trailer for <em>Zack Snyder's Justice League</em> <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/justice-league-snyder-cut-trailer-music-watchmen-hallelujah/\">uses the song</a> \"Hallelujah\" by Leonard Cohen. Fans will recall that the exact same song was featured in another DC film of Snyder's: 2009's Watchmen, which stared Wilson as Dan Dreiberg, aka Nite Owl II. As such, Wilson took to <a href=\"https://twitter.com/patrickwilson73/status/1297387990801625088?s=20\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Twitter</a> to comment on the <em>Justice League</em> trailer, writing, \"I know that song,\" followed by an owl emoji.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/watch-zack-snyders-justice-league-dc-fandome-panel-is-now-streaming-on-youtube/\">WATCH: Zack Snyder’s Justice League DC FanDome Panel Is Now Streaming on YouTube</a></span></p><iframe width=\"320\" height=\"320\" frameborder=\"0\" src=\"https://twitter.com/patrickwilson73/status/1297387990801625088\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe><p>\"Hallelujah\" was played in Watchmen over the sex scene between Wilson's Nite Owl and Malin Åkerman's Silk Spectre II -- a controversial scene, which some have described as being gratuitous. In it, Wilson's character finally overcomes the impotence he was struggling with up to that point.</p><p>More recently, Wilson starred in yet another DC film, <em>Aquaman</em>, as King Orm, aka Ocean Master. Wilson and director James Wan were on hand at DC FanDome to <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dc-fandome-aquaman-panel/\">discuss what fans can expect</a> from the movie's anticipated sequel, which is scheduled to arrive in theaters on Dec. 16, 2022.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/zack-snyder-cut-hbo-max-justice-league-four-episodes/\">Zack Snyder Reveals HBO Max Will Release Justice League as Four Episodes</a></span></p><p>Justice League stars Ben Affleck as Batman, Gal Gadot as Wonder Woman, Henry Cavill as Superman, Amy Adams as Lois Lane, Jason Momoa as Aquaman, Ezra Miller as The Flash, Ray Fisher as Cyborg, Jeremy Irons as Alfred Pennyworth, Diane Lane as Martha Kent, Ciarán Hinds as Steppenwolf, Jesse Eisenberg as Lex Luthor and J.K. Simmons as Commissioner Gordon. Zack Snyder's Justice League will premiere exclusively on HBO Max in 2021.</p><p>(via <a href=\"https://comicbook.com/movies/news/watchmen-patrick-wilson-snyder-cut-song-shoutout-twitter/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">ComicBook.com</a>)</p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 24 Aug 2020 13:40:44 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2018/07/aquaman-orm.jpg","linkMd5":"abde0a2315256152a86dd07291dfe9ab","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn75@2020_3/2020/08/24/21-43-10-858_9de97820fa6aa597.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":38752,"destBytes":38752,"author":"Andrew Cavalluzzi","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2018/07/aquaman-orm.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn75@2020_3/2020/08/24/21-43-10-858_9de97820fa6aa597.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598305389184},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","title":"LOOK: Previews for Every DC Comic Arriving Tuesday, Aug. 25 | CBR","link":"https://www.cbr.com/look-previews-for-every-dc-comic-arriving-tuesday-aug-25/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/BTJ-Cv1-CMYK-PMS802.jpg\"/></figure><p>It's here.</p><p>After being teased all the way back at the beginning of <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/dc-comics/\">DC Comics</a>' Rebirth relaunch, the debut issue of the Black Label title <em>Batman: Three Jokers</em> finally hits comic shops this Tuesday, Aug. 25. And it's only one of no fewer than 19 new comics the Burbank-based publisher is putting out this week.</p><p>Several superhero books under DC's main banner have new issues out this week as well, including <em>Action Comics</em>, <em>Detective Comics</em>, <em>Batgirl</em>, <em>Batman Beyond</em>, <em>Batman/Superman</em>, <em>Justice League Dark</em>, <em>Red Hood: Outlaw</em>, <em>Suicide Squad</em>, <em>Teen Titans Annual</em>, <em>The Flash</em> and <em>Wonder Woman</em>, not to mention the star-studded <em>Legion of Super-Heroes</em> #8. Under the Wonder Comics imprint, there's also the fifth and penultimate issue of <em>Amethyst</em>.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/milestone-returns-static-shock-graphic-novel/\">Milestone Returns in Early 2021, Led By Static Shock Graphic Novel &#38; Digital Comic</a></span></p><p><em>Three Jokers</em> also isn't the only Black Label title hitting shelves on Tuesday. In fact, the imprint is home to two finales this week: <em>The Question: The Deaths of Vic Sage</em> #4 and Hill House Comics' <em>Plunge</em> #6. Meanwhile, the Sandman Universe has two new issues out this week in the form of <em>Books of Magic</em> #22 and <em>John Constantine: Hellblazer</em> #9. Finally, <em>The Last God</em> continues with issue #8.</p><p>You can see all of the books releasing this Tuesday below, with links to the previews that will show you what's to come from DC Comics.</p><p><ol><li><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/action-comics-1024/\"><i>Action Comics</i> #1024</a></li><li><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/amethyst-5/\"><em>Amethyst</em> #5</a></li><li><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/batgirl-48-2/\"><em>Batgirl</em> #48</a></li><li><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/batman-beyond-46/\"><em>Batman Beyond</em> #46</a></li><li><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/batmansuperman-11-2/\"><em>Batman/Superman</em> #11</a></li><li><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/batman-three-jokers-1/\"><em>Batman: Three Jokers</em> #1</a></li><li><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/books-of-magic-22/\"><em>Books of Magic</em> #22</a></li><li><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/detective-comics-1026/\"><em>Detective Comics</em> #1026</a></li><li><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/john-constantine-hellblazer-9/\"><em>John Constantine: Hellblazer</em> #9</a></li><li><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/justice-league-dark-25-2/\"><em>Justice League Dark</em> #25</a></li><li><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/legion-of-super-heroes-8-2/\"><em>Legion of Super-Heroes</em> #8</a></li><li><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/plunge-6/\"><em>Plunge</em> #6</a></li><li><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/red-hood-outlaw-48/\"><em>Red Hood: Outlaw</em> #48</a></li><li><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/suicide-squad-8-3/\"><em>Suicide Squad</em> #8</a></li><li><a
