#4</a></li><li><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/wonder-woman-761/\"><em>Wonder Woman</em> #761</a></li></ol></p><p>Be sure to check back next week for new previews of your favorite DC comics releasing on Tuesday, Sept. 1.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/john-ridley-dc-project-batman-person-of-color/\">John Ridley Reveals New DC Project - '47% Chance This Batman is a Person of Color'</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 24 Aug 2020 03:27:49 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/BTJ-Cv1-CMYK-PMS802.jpg","linkMd5":"832dafdb90debeadcf3140a14e787bfb","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn47@2020_1/2020/08/24/21-43-11-295_acbe359d3e945df9.webp","destWidth":1500,"destHeight":750,"sourceBytes":205200,"destBytes":205200,"author":"Noah Dominguez","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/BTJ-Cv1-CMYK-PMS802.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn47@2020_1/2020/08/24/21-43-11-295_acbe359d3e945df9.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598305389186},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","title":"Fairy Tail: 5 Characters Gray Fullbuster Would Team Up With (& 5 He'd Rather Not)","link":"https://www.cbr.com/fairy-tail-gray-fullbuster-characters-he-would-team-up-vs-not-juvia-lockstar-natsu-dragneel-panther-lily/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/gray-would-and-wouldnt-team-up-with-feature.jpg\"/></figure><p><em>The show <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/fairy-tail/\">Fairy Tail</a> </em>is a high fantasy animated series where the nation of Fiore is home to hundreds of official wizard guilds, and the wizards of these guilds will send their agents to complete missions in exchange for payment from the client. It's a solid system, and the Fairy Tail guild is one of the best in the business.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/fairy-tail-ways-lucy-proper-hero-ways-cool-villain/\">Fairy Tail: 5 Ways Lucy is a Proper Hero (&#38; 5 Ways She'd be a Cool Villain)</a></span></p><p>Fairy Tail boasts many prominent wizards, and that includes a certain <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/fairy-tail-facts-trivia-gray-fullbuster/\">Gray Fullbuster</a>, an ice wizard who's potent on offense and defense. He could use a partner when going on dangerous missions, and based on his personality, fighting style and more, he has certain needs for a partner. Some <em>Fairy Tail </em>characters are good partners for him, and others aren't.</p>\n                        <h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">10 </span>Team Up With: Juvia Lockser</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/juvia-happy-1.jpg' /></figure><p><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/fairy-tail-juvia-lockser-facts-trivia/\">Juvia</a> may be obnoxiously attached to Gray, but she means well, and more importantly, she is ready and willing to fight by Gray's side no matter the danger. She is a water wizard, and a powerful one, too. She can help Gray fight any foe out there.</p><p>In particular, Gray and Juvia have proven that they can perform unity magic, allowing them to meld their magic powers and launch devastating attacks on their enemies. That's quite useful, and it's worth Juvia's silly antics while trekking to the mission site.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">9 </span>Reject: Natsu Dragneel</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/11/natsu-2-1.jpg' /></figure><p>Gray and <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/fairy-tail-things-true-fans-know-natsu/\">Natsu</a> <em>can </em>fight well together, but if Gray is choosing a partner from his many guildmates, he can afford to be picky. Natsu tends to get on Gray's nerves and vice versa, and if Erza isn't around to restrain them, they'll just butt head and lose sight of the mission.</p><p>Gray knows that, so he'd rather keep Natsu off the team so he can focus on the job (and allow Natsu to focus on his own work). Besides, <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/fairy-tail-anime-better-fighter-natsu-dragneel-gray-fullbuster/\">fire and ice are an awkward combination</a> at times, and Gray has different ideas on how to complete a mission than Natsu does.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">8 </span>Team Up With: Panther Lily</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/10/Panther-lily-Cropped.jpg' /></figure><p>Panther Lily is an Exceed native to Edolas, and joined Fairy Tail when he made friends with <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/fairy-tail-ways-gajeel-redfox-best-character-overrated/\">Gajeel</a> (whom he once fought). Panther Lily doesn't cast spells, but his strength and swordplay are formidable. Gray can use that.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/fairy-tail-anime-villains-erza-beat-fight/\">Fairy Tail: 10 Anime Villains Erza Could Take Down</a></span></p><p>In battle, Gray can reinforce Panther Lily with his magic, such as coating Panther Lily with ice armor or using ice walls to protect Panther Lily's flank. In addition, this Exceed's personality and handling of a mission are definitely on the same page as Gray's.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">7 </span>Reject: Minerva Orland</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/minerva-sad.jpg' /></figure><p>Minerva belongs to the Sabertooth guild, and she is quite a powerful wizard in her own right. She can use magic that teleports people and magic spells around, and she can also use advanced martial arts up close. She's powerful from any range.</p><p>However, Gray barely even knows her, and like other Fairy Tail wizards, he relies on the strength of friendship and trust to complete a mission. For a high-stakes mission, he won't assume the risks associated with bringing along a distant associate.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">6 </span>Team Up With: Lucy Heartfilia</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/lucy-smart.jpg' /></figure><p><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/fairy-tail-lucy-facts-fans-know/\">Lucy Heartfilia</a> joined the Fairy Tail guild and had Natsu and Happy to welcome her, and she has proven her worth since then. Lucy's durability and stamina are low, but she is a creative and insightful wizard who can think her way out of many tight situations.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/fairy-tail-lisanna-unknown-facts/\">Fairy Tail: 10 Things You Didn't Know About Lisanna</a></span></p><p>Gray could really use a smart wizard like Lucy on the team, and Lucy's Celestial magic makes her quite flexible, too. Gemini can create body doubles to fool the enemy while Aquarius can make water and Taurus acts as a melee brawler.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">5 </span>Reject: Evergreen</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/evergreen-fairy-tail.jpg' /></figure><p>Evergreen is one of the three minions of <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/fairy-tail-laxus-facts/\">Laxus Dreyar</a>, and her loyalty to Laxus is stronger than her loyalty to the Fairy Tail name. In combat, Evergreen can launch ranged attacks, and her eye magic allows her to turn enemies to stone, like a gorgon of Greek myth.</p><p>These abilities don't necessarily mesh well with Gray's magic, however, and like Bickslow and Freed, Evergreen's sheer power falls well short of Gray's. And, of course, there's the factor that Evergreen would much rather work with Laxus than with Gray.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">4 </span>Team Up With: Kagura Mikazuchi</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/kagura.jpg' /></figure><p><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/fairy-tail-kagura-little-known-facts-grand-magic-games/\">Kagura</a> belongs to the all-female Mermaid Heel guild, and she is by a mile the most powerful wizard under that banner. Kagura is a swordfighter on par with <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/fairy-tail-erza-facts-trivia-info/\">Erza</a>, and in some cases, her technique actually surpasses Erza's own. She also uses gravity magic.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/fairy-tail-the-10-most-powerful-women-in-the-series-ranked/\">Fairy Tail: The 10 Most Powerful Women in the Series, Ranked</a></span></p><p>Gray would be delighted to have such a powerhouse teammate for a mission if Fairy Tail and Mermaid heel ever launched a joint operation. Kagura's serious, focused personality and fighting style would also be to Gray's liking.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">3 </span>Reject: Millianna</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/millianna.jpg' /></figure><p>Millianna also belongs to Mermaid Heel, and she once fought for Jellal and his Tower of Heaven project. She is an agile melee fighter who uses cat-like techniques in battle, including claws and a long, tail-like tube that can capture enemies.</p><p>Ultimately, though, Millianna's power level is too far below Gray's, and her silly personality wouldn't work well with Gray's more serious disposition. Instead, Millianna would have a better time with Natsu or Lucy on a mission.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">2 </span>Team Up With: Sting Eucliffe</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Sting-09.jpg' /></figure><p><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/fairy-tail-unknown-facts-sting-eucliffe/\">Sting</a> is one of the two dragon slayers of the Sabertooth guild, the other being Rogue. They work best together in a light/shadow combo, but either of them could work with Natsu or Gray during a mission. Or, if Sting teamed up with Gray, he'd simply bring Rogue along.</p><p>Sting and Rogue are ferocious but fight with a purpose, and they are tenacious and loyal in combat. Gray will definitely like that, and these dragon slayers are on par with Gray's own combat skills. They'd make for a fine team.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">1 </span>Reject: Kain Hikaru</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/kain-hikaru.jpg' /></figure><p>Kain Hikaru is a rather sadistic fellow, and sure enough, he is a member of a dark guild. In this case, Grimoire Heart. He's among the weakest members, but he does have unique magic that's centered around a voodoo doll named Mr. Cursey.</p><p>If Kain takes his enemies by surprise, he can really get the edge on them, but this isn't how Gray fights, and Gray would find Kain's methods distasteful and dishonorable. Kain's goofy and slightly arrogant personality would also rub Gray the wrong way.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">NEXT: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/anime-like-fairy-tail/\">15 Anime to Watch If You Love Fairy Tail</a></span></p>\n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 24 Aug 2020 18:30:52 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/gray-would-and-wouldnt-team-up-with-feature.jpg","linkMd5":"8a04a131e33781b007a9591f8771f1aa","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn43@2020_1/2020/08/24/21-43-10-480_bd20f332f76a8493.webp","destWidth":1800,"destHeight":900,"sourceBytes":85240,"destBytes":85240,"author":"Louis hikaru.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn11@2020_5/2020/08/24/21-43-30-217_28d6f7e0c469ee80.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598305389173},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","title":"X-Men: Has Marvel's New Illuminati Already Infiltrated Krakoa?","link":"https://www.cbr.com/x-men-marvel-illuminati-selene-krakoa/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Selene.jpg\"/></figure><p><em><strong>WARNING: The following contains spoilers for </strong></em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/empyre\"><strong>Empyre: X-Men</strong></a><em><strong> #2, by Gerry Duggan, Ben Percy, Leah Williams, Lucas Werneck, Nolan Woodard and VC's Clayton Cowles, on sale now.</strong></em></p><p>The Power Elite are quickly becoming one of the most dangerous groups in the Marvel Universe. With the <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/red-skull/\">Red Skull</a> leading the team, they have taken over power in various areas of the world and are already in conflict with <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/captain-america/\">Captain America</a>.</p><p>One of the group's members, Phil Coulson already has his foot in the government and controls <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/marvel-squadron-supreme-underrated-classic/\">the Squadron Supreme</a> that has already butted heads with the Avengers. The Power Elite helped <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/daredevil-20-matt-murdock-wilson-fisk-typhoid-mary-help-hells-kitchen-battle/\">Wilson Fisk become Mayor of New York City</a>, and they may have already established secure footing on the <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/x-men/\">X-Men</a>'s island nation of Krakoa through the mutant Selene.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a class=\"bc-title-link\" title=\"Power Elite: Marvel's Secret Illuminati, Explained\" href=\"https://www.cbr.com/power-elite-secret-illuminati/\">Power Elite: Marvel's Secret Illuminati, Explained</a></span></p><p>One of the Elite's core members, Selene appears to have some measure of influence with the X-Men. Selene was first welcomed to the island in Jonathan Hickman and Pepe Larraz's <em>House of X </em>#5 along with a host of other villains and has since seemed to seamlessly integrate into the mutant society.</p><p>This was made apparent most recently in Gerry Duggan, Ben Percy, Leah Williams, and Lucas Werneck's <em>Empyre: X-Men</em> #2, where <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/x-men-omega-level-back-up-team/\">Selene shows up from Krakoa with a horde of mutant psychics</a> to help Magik and the X-Men in battle. However, the psychic mutant has also been seen in current issues of <em>Captain America </em>working as an active member of the Elite.</p><figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/X-Men-Empyre-Psychic-Team.jpg\"/></figure><p>As a psychic with a villainous history, it's doubtful whether or not Xavier or Marvel's other mutants trust Selene in any real capacity. While she's kept her villainous activities confined to the pages of <em>Captain America </em>so far, there's a possibility that she could be secretly serving the interests of the Power Elite on Krakoa.</p><p>While the island nation is open to all mutants, Xavier already has a pretense to deal with Selene more permanently.</p><p>When the Quiet Council of Krakoa created the laws governing the mutant residents of the island, they made not killing humans one of the core rules on the island. Despite that -- and accommodations to ensure that her vampiric needs are met -- Selene has broken that second rule in the pages of <em>Captain America</em>, where the psychic vampire has been feeding on the souls of men.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/necrosha-x-men-undead-battle/\">Necrosha: The X-Men's Horrific Battle With the Undead, Explained</a></span></p><p>Professor X said all mutants must abide by the laws of the mutant society. With that said, he also made it abundantly clear what the punishment for breaking these rules would be when he banished Sabretooth to the unseen depths of the island. If Selene is using her powers to kill outside of Krakoa, the Quiet Council is mandated to take action, yet no steps have been made to curtail the mutant's activities.</p><p>Unless Xavier or another Quiet Council member is secretly a member of the Power Elite too, the lack of action against the mutant vampire is puzzling. And until action is taken against her, Selene will continue to pose a secret threat to Krakoa.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/red-skull-uses-xaviers-brain-for-evil-uncanny-avengers/\">Red Skull Uses Xavier’s Brain For Evil (and Lunch) In Uncanny Avengers</a></span></p><p><!-- Used for easily cloning the properly namespaced rect --></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 24 Aug 2020 13:20:38 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Selene.jpg","linkMd5":"ade44c2aaf2e93da9d0393d79f416c99","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn16@2020_4/2020/08/24/21-43-10-410_196b937a2099e956.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":181574,"destBytes":181574,"author":"Shawn S. Lealos","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Selene.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn16@2020_4/2020/08/24/21-43-10-410_196b937a2099e956.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/X-Men-Empyre-Psychic-Team.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn79@2020_3/2020/08/24/21-43-32-303_46ca2fac273e0673.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598305389184},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","title":"Captain Marvel's Cosmic Avengers Show How POWERFUL They Really Are","link":"https://www.cbr.com/captain-marvel-cosmic-avengers-power/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/captain-marvel-2.jpg\"/></figure><p><em><strong>WARNING: The following contains spoilers for </strong></em><strong><a href=\"http://cbr.com/tag/captain-marvel\">Captain Marvel</a></strong><em><strong> #19 by Kelly Thompson, Cory Smith, Adriano Di Benedetto, Tamra Bonvillain and VC's Clayton Cowles, on sale now.</strong></em></p><p>Amidst the <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/empyre/\">Empyre</a> event, Carol Danvers was given a new role by Hulkling, the new Emperor of the Kree/Skrull Alliance. After being given Ronan the Accuser's hammer, the Universal Weapon, Carol was named the new Kree Supreme Accuser. Her first mission was to travel to a planet that was once home to a city where both Kree and Skrulls lived in peace and harmony. However, the city was completely destroyed, and there were no survivors. Carol was sent to find the warrior responsible for this terrible act, and dispose of them.</p><p>However, when she got there, she discovered that the suspect was <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/captain-marvel-sister-innocent-empyre/\">a half-sister</a> she never knew she had. Laurie-Ell was clearly innocent, which prompted Carol to hide her on Earth while she searched for the truth. To make matters worse, the Universal Weapon in her grasp proved to have an influence on her. Therefore, to make certain she could remain under constant watch, she asked Doctor Strange to split the cosmic hammer into four.</p><p>With this, Captain Marvel assembled her own team of <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/captain-marvel-new-team-cosmic-avengers/\">Avengers</a> comprised of War Machine, Hazmat, and Spider-Woman -- and every one of them has their own glowing green hammer. And now, <em>Captain Marvel</em> #20 shows us how powerful these Accusing Avengers really are.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/empyre-fallout-fantastic-four-ramifications-marvel-universe-dan-slott/\">Fantastic Four's Empyre Epilogue Has Major Ramifications For The Marvel Universe</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Captain-Marvel-20-Hazmat.jpg\"/></figure><p><em>Captain Marvel</em> #20 may be an <em>Empyre</em> tie-in book, but it has very little to do with the actual Cotati invasion taking place in the main event series. Instead, for the bulk of the issue, Carol takes her new crew of Avengers to space, where she hopes to clear her sister's name by finding out the real culprit behind the destruction of the Kree/Skrull city of K'in-al. Luckily, Carol already has another suspect in mind in the form of Walter Lawson, aka Wastrel.</p><p>Walter was recently imprisoned by the Kree, and Captain Marvel ran into him in the previous issue of the series. There, Lawson told her he was working through his prison sentence with community service, but that turned out to be a lie. In <em>Captain Marvel</em> #20, Carol and her team return to K'in-al to find the villain.</p><p>And once they arrive, it isn't long before they are attacked by Wastrel's lethal inventions. Wastrel has made a name for himself by designing terrible weapons and he is up to his old tricks again: Carol, Rhodey, Jennifer, and Jessica are all attacked by giant robots armed with alien weaponry.</p><p>These robots are incredibly dangerous, but they give the superheroes a chance to cut loose and test out their new abilities as Accusers. Each of them combines their powers with those of their replicas of the Universal Weapon, and the results are nothing short of astonishing. With these powers, War Machine, Spider-Woman, and Hazmat all dispose of their respective attackers with relative ease.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RE</span><span class=\"related-single\">LATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/empyre-condemns-an-avenger-to-his-dark-destiny/\">Empyre Condemns An Avenger To His DARK Destiny</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Captain-Marvel-20-new-Carol-Corps.jpg\"/></figure><p>What's more, once all four robots are down, Wastrel unveils his very own mech, a giant robotic suit adorned with metallic tentacles. Unfortunately for him, all four Accusers join forces against him and, with their Universal Weapons, they defeat him rapidly and with great efficiency.</p><p>Right now, Carol's cosmic Avengers may be the most powerful superheroes in the Marvel Universe. We don't know how long they will keep their splintered versions of the Universal Weapon but, if they keep them long enough, they might be able to take on all of the Cotati by themselves.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/empyre-cotati-recruit-shanna-she-devil-man-thing/\">Avengers: Marvel's Alien Empyre Recruits A Major Marvel POWERHOUSE</a></span></p><p><!-- Used for easily cloning the properly namespaced rect --></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 24 Aug 2020 21:20:24 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/captain-marvel-2.jpg","linkMd5":"423775fb15fbf7073e876972ea95bba3","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn32@2020_4/2020/08/24/21-43-11-322_0f59f2c1c9b88666.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":202900,"destBytes":162360,"author":"Ian Cardona","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/captain-marvel-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn32@2020_4/2020/08/24/21-43-11-322_0f59f2c1c9b88666.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Captain-Marvel-20-Hazmat.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn39@2020_3/2020/08/24/21-43-21-119_a02fbcc091baa31a.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Captain-Marvel-20-new-Carol-Corps.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn12@2020_1/2020/08/24/21-43-23-428_1a6a521488c55184.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598305389168},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","title":"A Major Batman Villain Got Called Out for Why They're REALLY a Monster","link":"https://www.cbr.com/batman-killer-croc-monster/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Batman-feature-Detective-Comics.jpg\"/></figure><p><em><strong>WARNING: The following contains spoilers for \"Monster,\" a story in </strong></em><strong><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/batman-gotham-nights\">Batman: Gotham Nights</a> #14<i>, by Frank Tieri, Tyler Kirkham, Arif Prianto and Tom Napolitano, on sale now.</i></strong></p><p><em>Batman: Gotham Nights</em> isn't just about the Dark Knight flying high on the city's rooftops with his sidekicks fighting crime. The digital-first series has featured some unique stories <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/batman-gotham-nights-joker-best-business-partner/\">with the Joker</a>, as well as insight <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/batman-gotham-nights-harveny-dent-wasted-two-face-cure/\">into Two-Face's past</a> that add depth to the rogues the Caped Crusader often fights.</p><p>In Issue #15, though, it gets a bit more personal as Killer Croc gets called out for his sins. While you can feel sympathy for how he's been treated, you can't help but agree with the person who scolds him for who he's become.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/batman-gotham-nights-best-love-detective/\">Batman: Gotham Nights Confirms the Dark Knight Is the Best... Love Detective?!</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/croc-2.jpg\"/></figure><p>Killer Croc, or Waylon Jones. debuted in the '80s in <em>Detective Comics</em> and has become a key member of the Batman universe, especially in <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/batman-killer-croc-animated-series-mutant-crocodile/\">cartoons</a> and was featured in the <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/suicide-squad-cast-james-gunn-birthday-video/\"><em>Suicide Squad</em> </a>movie. Created by Gerry Conway, Don Newton and Gene Colan, he's been fashioned as a metahuman with a reptilian skin disorder that gives him super-strength and rigid exterior, which makes him a straight-up crocodile on the outside. This issue addresses his past in a sideshow years ago where he was one of the main attractions who suffered abuse for his looks.</p><p>When we see Croc in the present, he is attempting to hold up a Gotham bank. As he orders the guards to fetch the money, he accosts the manager, Julie. When she calls him by name, his memory's jogged to when he was in the cage and her dad was actually the show's promoter. \"Gator Boy\" was his nickname, and everyone bullied him except for Julie who fends one of them off. She didn't hold her dad's views and felt sorry for Waylon, treating him like a person, not a creature. She always inquired how he was doing on the inside and helped him feel more human.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/batman-gotham-nights-almost-destroys-gordon/\">Batman: Gotham Nights Almost Destroys Jim Gordon With the Perfect Crime</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/croc-3.jpg\"/></figure><p>But when they parted ways -- he escaped after she and her dad left the circus -- Croc never got back in contact with her. He tried to find Julie, but she knew he was lost when she saw the news about him being a criminal. It's why she pierces his skin with some shots of the truth when he tries to emotionally connect with her after finding her during a robbery. While she admits that she did care for him, he ultimately proved her wrong and everyone else right. He had the opportunity time after time to walk away from this life of crime but he chose to remain in it, hunting score after score.</p><p>Now presented with the monster before her, Julie doesn't hold the same compassion she had for the person Croc was. To her, the boy she knew is dead, and it's why she tells him he really has become the monster everyone said he would be. Croc's heartbroken as he realizes that what she said is true. Although she'll never understand what he went through before and after meeting, her but Croc really had ample chances to turn a new leaf, instead opting to remain a criminal.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/batman-best-dad-damian-wayne/\">Batman: Gotham Nights Turned Bruce Wayne from the Worst Dad to the Best</a></span></p><p><!-- Used for allowfullscreen></iframe><p>The synopsis for Ridley Scott's <em>Raised by Wolves</em> can be found below.</p><blockquote><p>From executive producer Ridley Scott, Raised by Wolves centers on two androids tasked with raising human children on a mysterious virgin planet. The highly-anticipated series premiere will debut on September 3rd on HBO Max. Scott directed the first two episodes of the 10-episode series, marking his television series directorial debut for American audiences.</p></blockquote><p>Produced by Ridley Scott's Scott Free Productions with Scott, writer and creator Aaron Guzikowski, David W. Zucker (<em>The Man in the High Castle</em>), Jordan Sheehan (<em>The Terror</em>), Adam Kolbrenner (<em>Prisoners</em>) and Mark Huffam (<em>The Martian</em>) serving as executive producers, <em>Raised by Wolves</em> stars Amanda Collin, Abubakar Salim, Winta McGrath, Niamh Algar, Jordan Loughran, Matias Varela, Felix Jamieson, Ethan Hazzard, Aasiya Shah, Ivy Wong and Travis Fimmel. The series premieres Sept. 3. on HBO Max.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/the-batman-hbo-max-series-year-one-prequel-matt-reeves/\">The Batman HBO Max Series Is A Year One Prequel To Matt Reeves' Film</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 24 Aug 2020 18:15:57 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/raised-by-wolves-header.png","linkMd5":"bfbcf1a4604d72cf4b7273d75ba802fb","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn76@2020_1/2020/08/24/21-43-09-425_34899e69c623f78d.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":198322,"destBytes":198322,"author":"Tim Adams","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/raised-by-wolves-header.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn76@2020_1/2020/08/24/21-43-09-425_34899e69c623f78d.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598305389175},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","title":"One Piece: 5 Things That Show Wano Is Already The Best Arc (& 5 Things It Needs To Do Better)","link":"https://www.cbr.com/one-piece-wano-best-arc-improve/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/One-Piece-5-Things-That-Show-Wano-Is-Already-The-Best-Arc-5-Things-It-Needs-To-Do-Better-featured-image.jpg\"/></figure><p>The Wano Country arc is quite easily the biggest <em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/one-piece/\">One Piece</a></em> arc to date and it is one part of the story that fans have been waiting for.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/one-piece-highest-bounties/\">One Piece: The 10 Highest Bounties Ever</a></span></p><p><em>One Piece</em> finally entered the <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/one-piece-wano-little-known-trivia/\">Wano Country arc </a>around two years ago and since then, fans have got the experience some of the very best stuff from Oda. This arc has lived up to all the expectations and can very well be considered as the best in the series already, however, there are also certain aspects that need to be improved in order for it to be the undisputed King of <em>One Piece</em> arcs.</p>\n                        <h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">10 </span>The Best: Build-up</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/11/Trafalgar-Law-Punk-Hazard.jpg' /></figure><p>The Wano Country arc was first teased back during the Thriller Bark arc, which dates back to over a decade ago. The proper buildup for this arc started with Punk Hazard, where the Straw Hat Pirates met with <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/one-piece-5-strongest-samurai-in-wano-5-weakest/\">Samurai of Wano</a> Kin'emon and Momonosuke.</p><p>The Strawhat and Heart alliance was formed during this arc as well, and Kaido was identified as the target. When it comes to build-up, no <em>One Piece</em> arc even comes close to what the fans have witnessed with Wano.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">9 </span>Needs To Do Better: Fights</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Featured-Characters-Can-Beat-Page-One.jpg' /></figure><p>If there's one thing that the Wano Country arc has been lacking in so far, it's the fights. Over the course of three acts, fans have only got to witness some skirmishes in the arc which, while good, could've been expanded upon a little further.</p><p>In terms of fights, the Wano Country arc needs to step up. However, the majority of them will come with the Onigashima War and that's why most fans aren't bothered.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">8 </span>The Best: Luffy Vs Two Yonko</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Big-Mom-and-Kaido.jpg' /></figure><p>Luffy and the Straw Hat Pirates are up against not just Kaido but also Big Mom. This is, undoubtedly, the biggest war in <em>One Piece</em> so far that the fans will witness. Furthermore, Luffy is central to it.</p><p>The Summit War was massive as well, however, Luffy was hardly a threat back then and he couldn't protect those close to him because he was weak. This time, things are very different.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">7 </span>Needs To Do Better: Straw Hat Screentime</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Zoro-Wano.jpg' /></figure><p>The Straw Hat Pirates have barely ever been seen working together, especially after the time-skip of <em>One Piece</em>. The crew has split up multiple times because of how massive it has gotten and for Oda, doing all of them justice in this one arc is quite a challenge.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/one-piece-plot-holes-broke-grand-line-logic/\">One Piece: 10 Plot Holes That Broke The World's Logic</a></span></p><p>So far, things have been going smoothly, however, it still isn't quite like Enies Lobby yet, where every Straw Hat got to shine properly.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">6 </span>The Best: Oden's Flashback</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Oden.jpg' /></figure><p>Eiichiro Oda delivered what could be called the best flashback in the entirety of <em>One Piece</em> in Oden's story. Not only did this give fans information on Wano Country and how it operated long ago but it also gave everyone a glimpse of the Rocks Pirates, Whitebeard, Roger, and most importantly, the Final Island, Laugh Tale.</p><p>Oden's battle with Kaido was remarkable and the Legendary Hour was nothing short of mind-blowing. Everything about Wano Country and its history stands out as the best in <em>One Piece</em> so far.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">5 </span>Needs To Do Better: Orochi's Death</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Orochis-one-piece.jpg' /></figure><p>Kurozumi Orochi took over the reins to Wano Country back when Oden was journeying the seas with Roger. He pulled the country into an era of darkness which has been described as \"Long Winter\" by the author of the story.</p><p>Recently, Orochi was killed off by Kaido; however, some believe that those who wanted to avenge Oden should've done the deed. Of course, all hope isn't lost yet as Orochi could very well have survived. If true, then Kin'emon, Hiyori, Zoro, and everyone else who deserves to kill him have the chance to do so again.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">4 </span>The Best: War</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/wano-kuri-one-piece.jpg' /></figure><p><em>One Piece's</em> biggest war to date in the Great Pirate Era was the Summit War that took place shortly before the time-skip. However, as Trafalgar Law put it in Punk Hazard, that war was just the beginning, and a new era with an unstoppable swell is coming.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/one-piece-strongest-female-characters/\">10 Strongest Female Characters In One Piece</a></span></p><p>The war of Wano will, undoubtedly, be the biggest in the story to date. It will also set the foundation for the Great War that is to come very soon after it.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">3 </span>Needs To Do Better: Expand The War</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/luffy-marineford-one-piece.jpg' /></figure><p>Marineford was, without any question, an incredible arc. However, an argument can be made that the clashes that everyone got to witness during this arc could have been handled better and expanded upon.</p><p>Simply put, Marineford was a bit of a mess where no fight got any proper attention. With Wano, fans hope that Oda doesn't do something similar, especially since <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/one-piece-wano-better-marineford/\">the scale of this war is even bigger than Marineford</a>.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">2 </span>The Best: Hint The One Piece</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/one-piece-poneglyph-robin-1.jpg' /></figure><p>As has been confirmed before, the end to the Wano Country arc will give the fans <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/well-thought-out-fan-theories-meaning-location-one-piece-ridiculous/\">a hint about what the One Piece treasure is</a>. The treasure will, of course, not be revealed until Luffy reaches Laugh Tale, however, it will certainly be hinted once the Wano Country arc ends.</p><p>With that in mind, Wano is, unquestionably, going to end as one of the greatest arcs in the entire story, if not the greatest.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">1 </span>Needs To Do Better: Killing Off The Villain</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/kaido-in-one-piece.jpg' /></figure><p>Eiichiro Oda doesn't like to kill off his characters. However, he does it when it is absolutely necessary. With Kaido, it feels like his death is needed <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/one-piece-top-strongest-characters-wano-country-ranked-strength/\">because he is the strongest</a> and thus needs a challenge.</p><p>Although <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/one-piece-5-characters-who-could-die-in-wano-5-who-will-live/\">how Kaido will die</a> isn't known yet, fans hope that it is something that rivals <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/one-piece-top-strongest-characters-marineford-ranked-power/\">Whitebeard's death from Marineford</a> and maybe even surpasses that. Only then can Wano be called the best arc of <em>One Piece</em>.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">NEXT: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/one-piece-fan-theories-true/\">10 One Piece Fan Theories That Turned Out To Be True</a></span></p>\n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 24 Aug 2020 14:30:19 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/One-Piece-5-Things-That-Show-Wano-Is-Already-The-Best-Arc-5-Things-It-Needs-To-Do-Better-featured-image.jpg","linkMd5":"2aaf6473f64ac2f75b840d64bd44f856","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn31@2020_4/2020/08/24/21-43-09-387_90df0f45903496f7.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":78656,"destBytes":78656,"author":"Rei Penber","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/One-Piece-5-Things-That-Show-Wano-Is-Already-The-Best-Arc-5-Things-It-Needs-To-Do-Better-featured-image.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn31@2020_4/2020/08/24/21-43-09-387_90df0f45903496f7.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/11/Trafalgar-Law-Punk-Hazard.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn72@2020_3/2020/08/24/21-43-28-131_fe61e5464ceb7fea.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Featured-Characters-Can-Beat-Page-One.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn83@2020_3/2020/08/24/21-43-21-142_57737986c7e5f303.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Big-Mom-and-Kaido.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn12@2020_2/2020/08/24/21-43-25-894_f783c8f127df8e2f.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Zoro-Wano.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn60@2020_2/2020/08/24/21-43-22-198_66e88ca5134c3ae0.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Oden.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn24@2020_6/2020/08/24/21-43-26-830_9e7d90b2006ccf69.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Orochis-one-piece.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn55@2020_5/2020/08/24/21-43-25-564_5eeb498daa9514d2.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/wano-kuri-one-piece.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn99@2020_1/2020/08/24/21-43-22-446_741f797b8933ce30.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/luffy-marineford-one-piece.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn99@2020_3/2020/08/24/21-43-21-223_bf84f9ff4cd06b59.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/one-piece-poneglyph-robin-1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn91@2020_2/2020/08/24/21-43-30-106_83b75dc16e1c8364.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/kaido-in-one-piece.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn92@2020_4/2020/08/24/21-43-32-452_46fff99b2872a04b.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598305389182},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","title":"Wonder Woman 1984 Composer Hans Zimmer Debuts First Track From the Score: Themyscira","link":"https://www.cbr.com/wonder-woman-1984-hans-zimmer-themyscira-track/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/wonder-woman-walpaper-1.jpg\"/></figure><p>Hans Zimmer has revealed the first track from his <em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/wonder-woman-2/\">Wonder Woman 1984</a> </em>soundtrack.</p><p>The track is titled \"Themyscira\" after the paradise island where the Amazons reside. \"'Themyscira' is out now!\" Zimmer tweeted, posting a link to the score. The track can also be found on WaterTower Music's official YouTube channel.</p><iframe width=\"320\" height=\"320\" frameborder=\"0\" src=\"https://twitter.com/HansZimmer/status/1297371893066919937\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe><iframe width=\"480\" height=\"270\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/BlhLQzV1uPg?feature=oembed\" frameborder=\"0\" allow=\"accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture\" allowfullscreen></iframe><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/wonder-woman-1984-dc-fandome-trailer-breakdown-analysis/\">Wonder Woman 1984: The Biggest Moments From the DC FanDome Trailer</a></span></p><p>Zimmer is no stranger to scoring superhero films, having contributed music to Christopher Nolan's <em>Dark Knight</em> trilogy as well as <em>Man of Steel</em> and <em>Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice</em>. His \"Themiscyra\" track features the now-iconic Wonder Woman cello cue, as well as ethereal music that one would associate with paradise.</p><p><em>Wonder Woman 1984</em> will see Diana reunited with Steve Trevor as she battles the twin threats of billionaire Max Lord and her friend Barbara Minerva, <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/look-wonder-woman-1984-unveils-cheetah/\">who will become the feral Cheetah</a>. A new trailer debuted during the <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/wonder-woman-1984-dc-fandome-trailer-breakdown-analysis/\">opening panel of DC FanDome</a>, which shows a young Diana participating in the Amazonian version of the Olympics.</p><blockquote><p>As an archaeologist, Diana who works at the Smithsonian Museum, is a Wonder Woman who has extraordinary superpowers, said to be the strongest hero in the world. In 1984, Wonder Woman is in desperate deadly danger in face of an enormous conspiracy of the businessman Max, who sings loudly to fulfill people's desires, and a mysterious foe, Cheetah. Can Wonder Woman stop the world’s collapse alone?</p></blockquote><p>Directed and co-written by Patty Jenkins, <em>Wonder Woman 1984</em> stars Gal Gadot, Chris Pine, Kristen Wiig, Pedro Pascal and Natasha Rothwell. The film arrives in theaters Oct. 2.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/wonder-woman-1984-director-film-theaters/\">Wonder Woman 1984 Director Believes the Film Should Be Seen in Theaters</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 24 Aug 2020 18:24:09 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/wonder-woman-walpaper-1.jpg","linkMd5":"0f9d7fd5c9c5666f744eda0833d13321","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn55@2020_3/2020/08/24/21-43-11-454_b142a42e58108f6f.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":256456,"destBytes":217614,"author":"Collier Jennings","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/wonder-woman-walpaper-1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn55@2020_3/2020/08/24/21-43-11-454_b142a42e58108f6f.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598305389174},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","title":"Cardi B Cosplays as Barb Wire in Instagram Photoshoot | CBR","link":"https://www.cbr.com/cardi-b-cosplays-barb-wire-pamela-anderson/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/cardi-b-barb-wire.jpg\"/></figure><p><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/cardi-b/\">Cardi B</a> channeled <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/barb-wire/\">Barb Wire</a>, the iconic bounty hunter made famous by Pamela Anderson, in a new photoshoot.</p><p>Posted on Instagram last week, the images show the \"WAP\" rapper rocking a platinum blonde wig, a black catsuit and knee-high leather stiletto boots. In each shot, Cardi is posing with a handgun, her long red nail set proving to be a perfect complement to the red backdrop.</p><iframe width=\"320\" height=\"320\" frameborder=\"0\" src=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/CEDCgvdA4CH/?utm_source=ig_embed\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/cardi-b-poison-ivy-perfect-costume/\">Cardi B's Poison Ivy Costume is Absolute Perfection</a></span></p><p>Cardi captioned the images with the phrases \"Give it to Bardi\" and \"BARDI ANDERSON.\" In a separate tweet, she compared herself to Anderson's character by responding to a side-by-side comparison of the two posted by a fan, writing, \"duh.\" Cardi dropped the sexy photos a day after her and Megan Thee Stallion's \"WAP\" debuted at No. 1 on the <a href=\"https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/hip-hop/9436623/cardi-b-channels-barb-wire-photos\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Billboard Hot 100 chart</a>.</p><p>Anderson portrayed the titular character in the 1996 film <em>Barb Wire</em>, which follows a sexy nightclub owner who moonlights as a mercenary in Steel Harbor, one of the last free zones in the now fascist United States. The critically panned film was based on <span class=\"st\"> the Dark Horse comic book series of the same name </span>and was nominated for several Golden Raspberry Awards.</p><p>While there's no word of Cardi B starring in a <em>Barb Wire</em> reboot, she will appear in the next <em>Fast and Furious </em>film when it debuts next year.</p><p>Directed by Justin Lin, <em>F9</em> stars Vin Diesel, John Cena, Michelle Rodriguez, Tyrese Gibson, Chris \"Ludacris\" Bridges, Jordana Brewster, Nathalie Emmanuel and Sung Kang, with Helen Mirren, Charlize Theron and Cardi B. The film arrives in theaters April 2, 2021.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: Aliens: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/marvel-dark-horse-aliens-omnibus-vol-1-april-2021/\">Dark Horse's Original Comics Collected in New Marvel Omnibus</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 24 Aug 2020 18:55:36 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/cardi-b-barb-wire.jpg","linkMd5":"7086cb71cf2c165344a299b738b29672","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn92@2020_3/2020/08/24/21-43-09-334_130f938f89cca93b.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":72358,"destBytes":72358,"author":"Keegan Prosser","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/cardi-b-barb-wire.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn92@2020_3/2020/08/24/21-43-09-334_130f938f89cca93b.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598305389173},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","title":"The Office: Which 'Last Airbender' Element Each Main Character Would Bend ","link":"https://www.cbr.com/the-office-last-airbender-element-main-character-would-bend/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/the-office-the-last-airbender.jpg\"/></figure><p>In many ways, <em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/the-office/\">The Office </a></em>and <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/avatar-the-last-airbender/\">Avatar: The Last Airbender </a>have very little in common. First of all, their audiences are very different, and they are even in completely different genres. However, just like how fans enjoy sorting characters from other stories into Hogwarts Houses, it can be a fun thought exercise to treat bending elements in a similar way.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/avatar-last-airbender-waterbending-guide-facts/\">Avatar: 10 Things Fans Should Know About Waterbending</a></span></p><p>So, we’ve created a list of the main characters from <em>The Office</em> and match them with what element they would bend based on their personality and temperament.</p>\n                        <h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">9 </span>Darryl Philbin: Fire</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Craig-Robinson-as-Darryl-Philbin-on-The-Office-1.jpg' /></figure><p>The element of fire in <em>Airbender</em> is one that is often really misunderstood as always being an aggressive or scary thing. However, this isn’t the case at all. Just like in astrology, fire benders can have all kinds of personality traits, but they are characterized by an overall passion and drive for life.</p><p>This is why Darryl matches best with fire because he is one of the most ambitious and driven characters on the show.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">8 </span>Holly Flax: Water</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Holly-Flax-The-Office.jpg' /></figure><p>Holly Flax isn’t always a main character in the show, but she is a very influential one. She matches best with the element of water because while she has a rather lighthearted side like an air bender and a practical side like an earth bender, she is overall fairly emotionally based and goes with the flow.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://screenrant.com/the-office-jim-pam-good-relationship-toxic/\">The Office: 10 Characters More Obnoxious Than Michael Scott</a></span></p><p>This doesn’t mean she is weak at all, and she’s in fact rather in touch with her emotions in a healthy way.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">7 </span>Ryan Howard: Air</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Ryan-howard-as-ceo.jpg' /></figure><p>In <em>Airbender</em>, air bending is often associated with some of the best and most morally upstanding characters, but the element of air isn’t always used by people with calm personalities.</p><p><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/avatar-the-last-airbender-air-temples-secrets-trivia/\">Air is an element often associated with intellect</a>, but it can also be associated with the inability to decide and flightiness. This is why Ryan is an air bender as he’s one of the most fickle characters from the series.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">6 </span>Karen Filippelli: Earth</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/15-Karen-The-Office.jpg' /></figure><p>Karen Filippelli has many great traits that <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/avatar-last-airbender-earthbending-trivia/\">earth benders</a> and earth zodiac signs have. For one thing, she is overall very stable and practical, but this doesn’t make her boring.</p><p>She can be rather stubborn and stands up for herself which are two admirable traits that earth benders are known for. She also is much more grounded and reasonable than many of the other characters on the show.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">5 </span>Jan Levinson: Fire</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Melora-Hardin-as-Jan-Levinson-on-The-Office.jpg' /></figure><p>While Darryl might be a great example of the positive aspects of a fire bender, Jan is an example of many of the worst. She is rather self-absorbed and erratic, and she leads with her emotions and anger in a way that is unhealthy.</p><p>She can also be extremely blunt to the point of being rude, and she doesn’t have a lot of self-control.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">4 </span>Angela Martin: Non-bender</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/3-angela-the-office.jpg' /></figure><p>Angela definitely wouldn’t be a bender at all because she’s someone who would hate to have anything abnormal or special about her. For example, if she was in the Harry Potter world, she’d definitely be a Muggle.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/avatar-last-airbender-day-black-sun-fights-best/\">Avatar: The Last Airbender – The 10 Best “Day Of The Black Sun” Fights</a></span></p><p>Angela is a very judgemental, uptight, and overall boring person, and she definitely wouldn’t want anything to do with a connection to nature or being able to do something unique.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">3 </span>Dwight Schrute: Fire</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Dwight-Schrute-Remained-The-Most-Consistent-Character-Cropped.jpg' /></figure><p>Dwight is another character who makes the most sense as a fire sign although it’s easy to imagine him watching <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/avatar-last-airbender-comics-best-worst-things/\"><em>Avatar: The Last Airbender</em></a> and wanting to be the avatar. He combines many of the good traits of fire bending such as ambition and passion as well as some of the bad traits such as being quick to anger and too blunt at times.</p><p>He isn’t grounded enough or compassionate enough to be an earth or water bender, so fire makes the most sense.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">2 </span>Pam Beesly: Water</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/The-Office-Pam-Beasley-Halpert.jpg' /></figure><p>Pam Beesly is a perfect example of the lament of water because she’s compassionate, emotional, and overall calm.</p><p>However, just like with many water benders, despite being associated with a gentle, flowing element, she’s not weak. Water can be extremely powerful, and it’s often an element that is underestimated.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">1 </span>Jim Halpert: Earth</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Jim-Halpert-in-The-Office-the-job-opportunity-.jpg' /></figure><p>Jim Halpert would be a good fit with <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/avatar-the-last-airbender-metalbending-facts-trivia/\">earth bending</a> given his personality. While he has a fun, goofy side, he’s not particularly emotional or particularly passionate.</p><p>However, he is mostly practical and can really stick to things and work hard when he puts his mind to something. His steady nature and willingness to not give up make him best with the element of earth.</p><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Michael-Scott-The-Office-Cropped.jpg' /></figure><p>Micahel Scott can be difficult to connect with an element because he’s often out of touch with his own personality and self. While he does have some traits of a water bender, he makes the most sense with certain air traits.</p><p>He’s a bit capricious and unstable at times which are some of the negative traits associated with air, but he also is great at being upbeat in a way that matches best with air bending.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">NEXT: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/avatar-last-airbender-cave-two-lovers-trivia/\">Avatar: The Last Airbender – 10 Things You Didn’t Know About The Cave Of Two Lovers</a></span></p>\n
