+0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/the-office-the-last-airbender.jpg","linkMd5":"7c9e15b7abf41f0aaf98cbc05232c095","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn76@2020_5/2020/08/24/21-43-11-567_d3318ffab4b8380c.webp","destWidth":1710,"destHeight":900,"sourceBytes":165868,"destBytes":165868,"author":"Amanda Steele","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/the-office-the-last-airbender.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn76@2020_5/2020/08/24/21-43-11-567_d3318ffab4b8380c.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Craig-Robinson-as-Darryl-Philbin-on-The-Office-1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn75@2020_1/2020/08/24/21-43-30-672_72c07263246b3748.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Holly-Flax-The-Office.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn75@2020_5/2020/08/24/21-43-21-152_b596cb8e35ee6ec7.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Ryan-howard-as-ceo.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn79@2020_1/2020/08/24/21-43-29-947_088c809aaac23e06.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/15-Karen-The-Office.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn27@2020_2/2020/08/24/21-43-30-162_97d4ae860a04d27c.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Melora-Hardin-as-Jan-Levinson-on-The-Office.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn67@2020_6/2020/08/24/21-43-31-278_44815dc10329d423.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/3-angela-the-office.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn44@2020_2/2020/08/24/21-43-22-769_6d98500c1512c215.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Dwight-Schrute-Remained-The-Most-Consistent-Character-Cropped.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn35@2020_6/2020/08/24/21-43-28-557_032d60e4010406a7.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/The-Office-Pam-Beasley-Halpert.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn28@2020_5/2020/08/24/21-43-27-751_fed5d13380581c92.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Jim-Halpert-in-The-Office-the-job-opportunity-.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn19@2020_6/2020/08/24/21-43-32-665_5dbc0ae54acf8d87.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Michael-Scott-The-Office-Cropped.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn55@2020_1/2020/08/24/21-43-30-653_35d7b380593dbe13.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598305389171},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","title":"Superman: Man of Tomorrow's Director Explains the Film's Animation Art Style","link":"https://www.cbr.com/superman-man-of-tomorrows-director-new-art-animation-style/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/superman-man-of-tomorrow-header.png\"/></figure><p>As DC Comics' flagship superhero, Superman has experienced many different animated adaptations in his over 80 years of existence, with the latest incarnation taking flight in the new DC original animated movie <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/superman-man-of-tomorrow/\"><em>Superman: Man of Tomorrow</em></a>. And in addition to his origin being retold, this version of the Man of Steel has also undergone a distinct change in art style compared to previous animated outings.</p><p>The characters of <em>Man of Tomorrow</em> are visibly accentuated by bolder, heavier line worker, that makes them pop a bit more from the backgrounds, and the overall light and color palette for Metropolis is noticeably brighter and more vibrant than in the recently concluded DC Animated Movie Universe.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/batman-long-halloween-two-part-animated-film-confirmed/\">Batman: The Long Halloween - Two-Part Animated Film Adaptation Confirmed</a></span></p><p>According to director Chris Palmer, this change in style was inspired by the animated series that came before the film, as well as the comic books themselves.</p><p>\"I think it definitely evokes the original Superman animated series. It's kind of in the building blocks of Metropolis itself that this could be 25, 3o years in the future where while there's a lot of things you know, there's little points of departure like, 'Oh, I hope the world could be like that!'\" Palmer tells CBR. \"For the line art, it was to try something new, just definitely give a big stamp on it that this is a different world from the previous films. It was trying different things, like line weights. People have said it evokes more of a comic book kind of feel, and I don't think they're wrong.\"</p><figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/SMOT-Still-75-5f166e12f2e5e8.93496478.jpg\"/></figure><p>Prior to directing <em>Man of Tomorrow</em>, Palmer has had an extensive career as an animator and director, including helming several seasons of the acclaimed Netflix original animated series <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/voltron-legendary-defender/\"><em>Voltron: Legendary Defender</em></a>. It was this experience which helped inform some of the more ambitious set pieces in <em>Man of Tomorrow</em>, as Clark Kent settles into his superhero destiny.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/man-of-tomorrow-clip-supermans-first-costume/\">Superman: Man of Tomorrow Clip Reveals Clark Kent's First Costume</a></span></p><p>\"I'm definitely no stranger to action. [<em>Laughs</em>] There's definitely some big-scale stuff in Act III of <em>Man of Tomorrow</em>. <em>Voltron</em> definitely had these characters that giant lions and giant spaceships, scale was always a huge part of that show,\" Palmer observed. \"And there's definitely parts of that that weave into this film, where you put the camera, how do you show how big of a threat something is.\"</p><p>Directed by Chris Palmer, <em>Superman: Man of Tomorrow</em> stars Darren Criss as Clark Kent/Superman, Zachary Quinto as Lex Luthor, Alexandra Daddario as Lois Lane, Ryan Hurst as Lobo, Brett Dalton as Rudy Jones/Parasite, Ike Aamadi as Martian Manhunter, Neil Flynn as Jonathan Kent and Bellamy Young as Martha Kent. The film is available now on digital HD and on Blu-ray and 4K UHD on Sept. 8.</p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 24 Aug 2020 16:25:33 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/superman-man-of-tomorrow-header.png","linkMd5":"813980ac048b721becffabcdaf1207b0","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn15@2020_3/2020/08/24/21-43-10-963_f0f48ff76753d7a5.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":283082,"destBytes":283082,"author":"Sam Stone","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/superman-man-of-tomorrow-header.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn15@2020_3/2020/08/24/21-43-10-963_f0f48ff76753d7a5.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/SMOT-Still-75-5f166e12f2e5e8.93496478.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn11@2020_4/2020/08/24/21-43-32-599_fa438df114b38c79.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598305389178},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","title":"Toilet-bound Hanako-kun: 10 Facts You Didn't Know About Kou Minamoto","link":"https://www.cbr.com/toilet-bound-hanako-kun-kou-minamoto-little-known-facts/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Featured-Image-Kou-Minamoto-Toilet-Bound-Hanako-kun.jpg\"/></figure><p>Kou Minamoto is the lovable doofus of <em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/toilet-bound-hanako-kun/\">Toilet-bound Hanako-kun</a></em> and one of the deuteragonists in the series, second only to Nene Yashiro. At first, acting as a slight antagonist as he arrived at Kamome Academy to dispel of Hanako, he instead became friends with him and Nene.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a class=\"bc-title-link\" title=\"Toilet-Bound Hanako-kun: Which Character Are You Based On Your MBTI®?\" href=\"https://www.cbr.com/toilet-bound-hanako-kun-character-based-myers-briggs-mbti/\">Toilet-Bound Hanako-Kun: Which Character Are You Based On Your MBTI®?</a></span></p><p>While he attends the Middle School division of <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/fantasy-manga-reclaiming-toilets/\">Kamome Academy</a> and is the only middle schooler that is a main cast member besides Mitsuba Sousuke, he frequents the toilet and the High School division to hang out with Hanako and Nene. Here are ten facts fans may not know about Kou Minamoto.</p>\n                        <h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">10 </span>His Type Of Girl</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Kou-Minamoto-Lovestruck-Toilet-Bound-Hanako-kun.jpg' /></figure><p>Kou is a middle school student, albeit one year away from high school, that is perhaps one of the <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/shonen-anime-couples-most-wanted-made-no-sense/\">purest characters</a> in <em>Toilet-bound Hanako-kun. </em>In the notes of Volume 4<em>, </em>there are details and trivia about the character.</p><p>Within it, it states that Kou's preferred <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/best-worst-anime-couples-2000s/\">romantic interest</a> would need to have a cute smile. This can explain the first encounter between him and Nene.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">9 </span>He Is A Great Cook</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Kou-Minamoto-And-Nene-Yashiro-Baking-Toilet-Bound-Hanako-kun.jpg' /></figure><p>It turns out that aside from his appearance that would suggest otherwise, Kou is <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/cooking-themed-anime-watch-skip/\">a great cook</a>. He can also make donuts from scratch, which is quite a feat. This is because his older brother Teru is horrid at housework, so it is left to him most of the time.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a class=\"bc-title-link\" title=\"Which Toilet-Bound Hanako-Kun Character Are You Based On Your Zodiac Sign?\" href=\"https://www.cbr.com/which-toilet-bound-hanako-kun-character-based-zodiac-sign/\">Which Toilet-Bound Hanako-Kun Character Are You Based On Your Zodiac Sign?</a></span></p><p>His domestic skills can be seen in the episode he and Nene make donuts for <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/toilet-bound-hanako-kun-character-based-myers-briggs-mbti/\">Hanako</a>, as it is his favorite snack.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">8 </span>He Dotes On His Sister</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Kou-And-Tiara-Toilet-bound-Hanako-kun.jpg' /></figure><p>Although the anime did not delve into Kou's backstory or a lot of the other characters, it did mention that he had a younger sister. While Teru is the oldest, Kou is the middle child, with the youngest being his 5-year-old sister Tiara.</p><p>Despite the fact that his younger sister has even more spiritual power than Teru at her young ageーand perhaps even Kouーhe is said to dote on her a lot.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">7 </span>He Can Do Housework</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Kou-Minamoto-Toilet-Bound-Hanako-kun-5.jpg' /></figure><p>Aside from being a great cook, as well as baker, Kou takes care of most of the housework as well. He cooks, cleans, and is very caring for those he loves, including his family.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a class=\"bc-title-link\" title=\"Toilet-Bound Hanako-Kun: 5 Ways It's Different From The Manga (&#38; 5 Ways It's The Same)\" href=\"https://www.cbr.com/toilet-bound-hanako-kun-5-ways-its-different-from-the-manga-5-ways-its-the-same/\">Toilet-Bound Hanako-Kun: 5 Ways It's Different From The Manga (&#38; 5 Ways It's The Same)</a></span></p><p>While most would mistake Kou as a delinquent because of his brash attitude, one thing is for sureーhe sure can clean.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">6 </span>He Wears An Omamori</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Kou-Minamoto-Toilet-Bound-Hanako-kun.jpg' /></figure><p>An omamori is a Japanese amulet that is commonly sold at Shinto shrines and Buddhist temples that is meant to provide one with luck and protection. For some reason, Kou wears one in his right ear with the word \"traffic\" on it.</p><p>While there is no reason given for this, he perhaps wears this to protect himself from getting into any accidents. He is even called <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/one-piece-creator-why-crew-members-no-nicknames/\">\"Hella-Lam, Traffice-Safety Earing Boy\"</a> by <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/toilet-bound-hanako-kun-mysteries-secrets/\">Mitsuba</a> because of the odd words on it.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">5 </span>He Has Some Spiritual Power</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Kou-Minamoto-Toilet-Bound-Hanako-kun-4.jpg' /></figure><p>As a member of the Minamoto Clan, a generation-long family of exorcists, Kou has enough spiritual power to exorcise supernaturals. While he cannot exorcise Hanako because of how strong he is, that does not mean he cannot exorcise other supernaturals.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a class=\"bc-title-link\" title=\"Toilet-Bound Hanako-Kun: 10 Facts You Didn't Know About Nene Yashiro\" href=\"https://www.cbr.com/toilet-bound-hanako-kun-nene-yashiro-facts-trivia/\">Toilet-Bound Hanako-Kun: 10 Facts You Didn't Know About Nene Yashiro</a></span></p><p>Kou can use his staff, called Raiteijou, to turn his spiritual energy into lightning. The one downside is that he does not understand how to completely use it, which in turn electrocutes him every time he utilizes this power.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">4 </span>He Has A Crush On Nene At First</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Kou-Minamoto-And-Nene-Yashiro-Flowers-Toilet-Bound-Hanako-kun.jpg' /></figure><p>Kou's preferred type of girl is someone who has a cute smile, and Nene's bright one shot right through his heart the moment he met herーliterally.</p><p>When Kou was going to exorcise Hanako and Nene appeared, he was momentarily distracted from his goal. Even afterward, he acted awkwardly around her, although he acts normal now.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">3 </span>His Favorite Snack Is Sweet Potato Jelly</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Kou-Minamoto-And-Hanako-kun-Toilet-Bound-Hanako-kun.jpg' /></figure><p>Every character in <em>Toilet-bound Hanako-kun</em> has a favorite snack, from Hanako loving donuts to Nene loving strawberry-filled rice cakes. In this case, Kou's favorite snack is none other than sweet potato jelly.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a class=\"bc-title-link\" title=\"Toilet-Bound Hanako-kun: 10 Memes That Are Too Funny\" href=\"https://www.cbr.com/toilet-bound-hanako-kun-memes/\">Toilet-Bound Hanako-Kun: 10 Memes That Are Too Funny</a></span></p><p>It only takes 20 minutes to whip up if making the sweet treat from scratch, and as Kou is shown to be a great cook and baker, he has probably made it for himself.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">2 </span>He Does Not Believe All Supernaturals Are Evil</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Kou-Minamoto-Toilet-Bound-Hanako-kun-3.jpg' /></figure><p>Kou is from the Minamoto Clan, which believes all supernaturals are evil. Even the innocent-appearing Mokke are deemed as creatures that deserve to be treated horridly, as Teru often bullies them.</p><p>However, after meeting Hanako and speaking with him, Kou does not hold the belief that all of them are horrid, evil creatures as he was taught.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">1 </span>He Was Tasked To Destroy All Seven Mysteries</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Kou-Minamoto-And-His-Sealed-Staff-Toilet-Bound-Hanako-kun.jpg' /></figure><p>As Kou's older brother who is a seasoned exorcist, Teru is the oldest of the siblings and the one who tasked Kou with exorcising Hanako.  Teru loves both his little brother and younger sister, but he is quite sadistic when it comes to exorcising supernaturals.</p><p>Although Kou still has not done his job when it comes to erasing Hanako, it is nonetheless still a mission he must carry out eventually.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">NEXT: <a class=\"bc-title-link\" title=\"Toilet-bound Hanako-kun: 10 Facts You Didn't Know About Hanako\" href=\"https://www.cbr.com/toilet-bound-hanako-kun-hanako-facts/\">Toilet-Bound Hanako-Kun: 10 Facts You Didn't Know About Hanako</a></span></p>\n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 24 Aug 2020 16:30:31 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Featured-Image-Kou-Minamoto-Toilet-Bound-Hanako-kun.jpg","linkMd5":"cd7b2a7999f29e1c7d9be4349e8b71c2","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn60@2020_6/2020/08/24/21-43-09-339_4fb8d62fa209a639.webp","destWidth":1710,"destHeight":900,"sourceBytes":93138,"destBytes":93138,"author":"Brianna Albert","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Featured-Image-Kou-Minamoto-Toilet-Bound-Hanako-kun.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn60@2020_6/2020/08/24/21-43-09-339_4fb8d62fa209a639.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Kou-Minamoto-Lovestruck-Toilet-Bound-Hanako-kun.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn51@2020_1/2020/08/24/21-43-30-624_7dae40db75d59cbc.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Kou-Minamoto-And-Nene-Yashiro-Baking-Toilet-Bound-Hanako-kun.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn84@2020_1/2020/08/24/21-43-29-189_7860b58fa116e771.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Kou-And-Tiara-Toilet-bound-Hanako-kun.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn92@2020_3/2020/08/24/21-43-29-107_1abea7f208a57a31.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Kou-Minamoto-Toilet-Bound-Hanako-kun-5.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn27@2020_1/2020/08/24/21-43-28-537_14dd697d21847dbb.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Kou-Minamoto-Toilet-Bound-Hanako-kun.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn56@2020_6/2020/08/24/21-43-21-137_5e99cbb091974dd0.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Kou-Minamoto-Toilet-Bound-Hanako-kun-4.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn15@2020_2/2020/08/24/21-43-29-326_397ddbf583247579.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Kou-Minamoto-And-Nene-Yashiro-Flowers-Toilet-Bound-Hanako-kun.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn47@2020_5/2020/08/24/21-43-32-148_8a92aab1633daf48.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Kou-Minamoto-And-Hanako-kun-Toilet-Bound-Hanako-kun.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn75@2020_5/2020/08/24/21-43-23-891_dd255ad97b5d48e7.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Kou-Minamoto-Toilet-Bound-Hanako-kun-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn88@2020_2/2020/08/24/21-43-26-768_294dc07ed99abad6.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Kou-Minamoto-And-His-Sealed-Staff-Toilet-Bound-Hanako-kun.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn87@2020_5/2020/08/24/21-43-28-197_feda38dec0f491de.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598305389178},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","title":"Wonder Woman's New Foe Just STOLE Her Powers | CBR","link":"https://www.cbr.com/wonder-woman-power-stealing-foe/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/wonder-woman.jpg\"/></figure><p><strong>WARNING: The following contains spoilers for \"Powers,\" a story in <em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/wonder-woman/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Wonder Woman</a>: Agent of Peace</em> #11 by Jimmy Palmiotti, Amanda Conner, Daniel Sampere, Travis Lanham, and HI-FI, on sale now.</strong></p><p>The ability to steal another superhuman's powers is common in comics but even more so in the DC and Marvel Universes. While Wonder Woman has traditionally lacked this trope in her rogues' gallery, one new villain was just introduced who can steal even the Amazon's powers.</p><p>Named Julian Red, the would-be crook turns what seems like a failed robbery into the steal of a lifetime as she steals some of Wonder Woman's powers in <em>Wonder Woman: Agent of Peace </em>#11.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dc-national-sisters-day-olivier-coipel-wonder-woman-nubia-art/\">DC Celebrates National Sisters Day With Olivier Coipel's Wonder Woman/Nubia Art</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/julian-red-wonder-woman.jpg\"/></figure><p>The issue begins with Wonder Woman under siege from a villain with seemingly even more power than her, before it's revealed that she actually has Wonder Woman's powers. Diana recounts how her ordeal began, starting with her stopping the heist of a local jewelry store. The store is held up by a gang of robbers led by Julian Red, who manages to obtain a mysterious ruby from the store's safe. Wonder Woman arrives and makes quick work of the robbery, but is too late to keep Red away from the ruby. Giving herself over willingly, Red says an incantation while holding the gem before touching Wonder Woman.</p><p>Diana thinks nothing of it, seeing Red off to the police and the courts before researching more about the artifact itself. Named the Alicut Star Ruby, it apparently came into being in ancient Egypt and quickly became the subject of incredibly violent bouts for acquisition. Vied for by the Egyptians, Persians and even during World War II, the gem can apparently grant its bearer the power of its opponents, perhaps even draining them dry. This works just as well on magical metahumans, as Wonder Woman discovers that not only has the newly empowered Red escaped from prison but that her own powers are fading.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/wonder_woman_loves_anime/\">Wonder Woman Loves Anime - And She's Not Alone</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/wonder-woman-julian-red.jpg\"/></figure><p>Julian Red revels in her new powers, using her flight and superhuman senses to hunt down Wonder Woman. Red apparently has a vendetta against all those in the world that have wronged her in some way and wishes to first take it out on Wonder Woman by siphoning the rest of her powers. Wonder Woman tries to put some distance between them to keep this from happening, traveling through the sewers into the zoo. With only her bracelets and armor to protect her, Wonder Woman is otherwise helpless against Red, who now has almost all of her demigoddess powers.</p><p>One underlooked ability of Wonder Woman's, the power to talk to wildlife, is still in Diana's possession, however. Having taken the Alicut Star Ruby off of Red's person, Diana tosses it toward two now-loose panthers. Red scoffs and attempts to misuse Wonder Woman's powers to command the cats to kill her, but to no avail. Having read of the ruby's powers, especially pertaining to its cat patron, Diana then realizes that both the gem and the panthers will sense the evil in Red's heart. This causes Wonder Woman's powers to instantly return to her, dropping the depowered and helpless Red. Wonder Woman promptly has the panthers attack her but asks them to let her live.</p><p>Wonder Woman discusses with the detective who apprehends Red that Julian apparently had a hard life. Having been ostracized both in work and in her personal life, she eventually withdrew from society before turning to crime to acquire literal and figurative power. Having all of her powers back, Diana requests that the villainess be psychologically rehabilitated before destroying the gem in a volcano. It's unknown how the ruby transferred Wonder Woman's god-given powers to Red, but it certainly won't be doing it again.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/jinny-hex-crush-on-wonder-woman/\">A Young Justice Hero Has a Crush on Wonder Woman</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 24 Aug 2020 20:20:54 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/wonder-woman.jpg","linkMd5":"54db27f9e9ecefc88fcb3854ecfcfa4c","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn56@2020_2/2020/08/24/21-43-09-345_4dadf6bcf3c626b1.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":166010,"destBytes":166010,"author":"Timothy Donohoo","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/wonder-woman.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn56@2020_2/2020/08/24/21-43-09-345_4dadf6bcf3c626b1.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/julian-red-wonder-woman.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn51@2020_5/2020/08/24/21-43-27-167_471949a630aecc86.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/wonder-woman-julian-red.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn60@2020_6/2020/08/24/21-43-26-340_2ead3feace4a66ba.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598305389171},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","title":"The Vampire Diaries: Who Is Damon & Stefan's Mother, Lily? | CBR","link":"https://www.cbr.com/the-vampire-diaries-who-is-lily/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/The-Vampire-Diaries.jpg\"/></figure><p><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/the-vampire-diaries/\"><em>The Vampire Diaries</em></a> mentioned Lily Salvatore, mother of Damon and Stefan, only in passing until Season 6. While she presumably died at some point in 1858, it was discovered that she was alive; however this wasn't good news for the Salvatore brothers, who were left dealing with the ramifications of this revelation. With this revelation, let's look back at how she went from gentle mother to a \"new\" woman with a \"family\" of her own.</p><figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/The-Vampire-Diaries-Lily-Salvatore.jpg\"/></figure><p>Born as Lilian on February 27, 1820, she married Giuseppe Salvatore, who was a cheating, abusive husband. Once, during Thanksgiving 1851, she tried to run away to New York with her sons and bought the tickets with the money she stole from Giuseppe, who beat Lily for trying to take his sons. He threatened she would never see her kids again if she made another attempt to runaway. In 1858, she suffered from tuberculosis and was sent to a hospital by Giuseppe, but Damon and Stefan weren't allowed to talk to her.</p><figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/The-Vampire-Diaries-Lily-Salvatore-k.jpg\"/></figure><p>In the hospital, a vampire gave her their blood, turning her. While she did return to Mystic Falls to see her sons, Stefan's pulse triggered her bloodlust, so she left so before hurting her kids. Lily proceeded to go on a killing spree across Europe, with a death count of more than 3,000 people.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/legacies-damon-salvatore-elena-gilbert-stefanie/\">Legacies Should Introduce Damon Salvatore and Elena Gilbert's Daughter</a></span></p><p>She soon met former members of the Gemini Coven, who had been cast out since they were siphoners, meaning they could only use magic after they drained it from someone else. While she eventually met young Valerie and Oscar, she would soon meet Mary Louise, Nora and Beau. During her killing rounds, she also met and fell in love with Julian, a charming vampire.</p><p>In 1863, she sent Julian and Valerie to check in on Stefan, but Valerie and Stefan fell in love, and Valerie got pregnant. Julian knew having a grandchild would tear Lily away from her new \"family,\" so he beat Valerie till she miscarried. Valerie later committed suicide, unable to refute Julian's story that he found her beaten on the road. However, she died with Lily’s blood in her system, so she woke up as the first Heretic, a witch-vampire hybrid.</p><p>Later, Lily transformed the remaining five witches, with whom she planned to kill the Gemini Coven. While Julian was killed, his soul trapped in the Phoenix stone by vampire huntress Rayna Cruz, the coven sent the remaining vampires to the Prison World, where they were stuck in 1903 forever without any source of blood. Lily's family decided to give up their rations to keep Lily alive while they died.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/vampire-diaries-lj-smith-forbidden-game-best-book/\">The Vampire Diaries: L.J. Smith's BEST Book Is Cabin in the Woods Meets Labyrinth</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/The-Vampire-Diaries-Stefan-Lili.jpg\"/></figure><p>While trying to flee from Kai in the Prison World, Bonnie Bennett encountered Lily before escaping to Mystic Falls via a spell. On returning, she showed Damon a recording of Lily. Later, when Damon ran out of ways to turn on Stefan’s humanity in Season 6, he and Bonnie rescued Lily, tricking her into thinking that they would come back for her companions.</p><p>Coached by Damon, she managed to convince Stefan that she tried to come back for them but was imprisoned by the Gemini Coven. Her admission pushed Stefan to turn on his humanity, but when Damon and Bonnie went back on their promise of rescuing her companions, she lost her composure. This lead to her murdering many, attacking Bonnie and Elena and sparing Joe, who was pregnant.</p><p>She was later overpowered by Damon and Stefan and imprisoned; however, Kai rescued her and brought her family back from the Prison World. For their protection, she brokered a deal with Stefan. This meant Mystic Falls was vacated and given to her and her family so they could feed on anyone who crossed the town’s borders.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/vampire-diaries-why-elena-thinks-she-met-stefan-first/\">The Vampire Diaries: Why Elena Thinks She Met Stefan First (When Really It Was Damon)</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/The-Vampire-Diaries-Lily-Julian.jpg\"/></figure><p>While she had a strained relationship with Damon, especially after learning she prompted Kai to cast a sleeping spell on Elena, Lily bonded with Stefan. This bond was tested when she resurrected Julian via the Phoenix stone, so Stefan learned he killed his unborn child.</p><p>He tried killing Julian, but the older vampire was stronger and extremely manipulative. Julian convinced Lily to link their life forces, so her sons wouldn't kill him. Although Stefan told Lily what Julian did to Valerie, his true character came through when he got in a sword fight with Enzo, despite knowing every wound inflicted on him would harm her as well. His superfluous claim that he loved her reminded Lily of the abusive Giuseppe, allowing her to see Julian for the monster he really was.</p><p>She joined forces with her sons to convince her family to help kill Julian; however, Mary Louise helped Julian hold Damon and Valerie captive, forcing Lily to stake herself in hopes of killing Julian. This backfired because Mary Louise severed the link between them. Julian ran away while Lily started to die. Everyone said tearful goodbyes, but Damon refused to accept her apology. Lily was laid to rest near the Salvatore family plot.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/the-vampire-diaries-how-damon-stefan-became-vampires/\">The Vampire Diaries: How Damon and Stefan Became Vampires</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 24 Aug 2020 11:45:23 05:43:09","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","title":"Lovecraft Country: Atticus Reunites With [Spoiler] but at a Great Cost","link":"https://www.cbr.com/lovecraft-country-episode-2-atticus-reunite-montrose-kills-off-george/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Lovecraft-Country-Motion-Poster.jpg\"/></figure><p><em><strong>WARNING: The following contains major spoilers for <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/lovecraft-country/\">Lovecraft Country</a> Season 1, Episode 2, \"Whitey's on the Moon,\" which aired Sunday on HBO.</strong></em></p><p>HBO's new horror series <em>Lovecraft Country</em> began with main characters Atticus Freeman, his uncle George and their friend Letitia Lewis leaving Chicago to search for Montrose Freeman. Montrose -- who is Atticus' estranged father -- disappeared quite some time ago, yet a letter indicated that he was located in the sleepy New England town of Ardham, Massachusetts. After enduring <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/lovecraft-country-historical-roots-scariest-scene/\">racist sheriffs and monstrous vampires</a>, the trio reached their destination. In the latest episode of <em>Lovecraft Country</em>, they locate Montrose, but suffer a heartbreaking loss during their rescue attempt.</p><p>After Atticus and his party are <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/lovecraft-country-introduces-cult/\">welcomed into an eerie and unsettling palatial estate</a>, the young Korean War veteran realizes they were lured there, with Montrose serving as bait. Permitted to visit the nearby town under the condition that they return in time for dinner, Atticus and George notice a large stone tower. George observes its foundations and realizes there's an underground sub-basement, which is the most likely location of Montrose. However, before the trio can investigate further, they are warded off by a racist woman with a pair of guard dogs and escorted back to the estate by Christina Braithwaite, the daughter of Samuel Braithwaite, owner of the mansion and leader of its religious cult the Sons of Adam.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/lovecraft-country-outdone-stranger-things-one-way/\">Lovecraft Country Has Already Outdone Stranger Things in One Huge Way</a></span></p><p>After being confined to their respective bedrooms by magical barriers and tormented with visions of their worst fears by dark magic, Atticus and the others coordinate an escape after George discovers a secret passage in his room. Venturing back to the imposing stone tower, the trio break into the sub-basement and discover it does indeed house a cell. Montrose, though, has already used a secret tunnel to escape. Montrose soon meets up with the group, reuniting with his family. However, magic prevents the group from leaving Ardham for good, and Samuel shoots Letitia and George to coerce Atticus into participating in an ancient ritual led by the cult.</p><figure><img src=\"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Courtney-B-1.jpg\"/></figure><p>After Atticus complies with Samuel's demands, the cult leader heals Leti with the promise to do the same for George should the ritual prove successful. As Montrose and Leti tend to the gravely wounded man, Atticus is used by the Sons of Adam to open a portal to the biblical paradise of Eden, with the young man's secret bloodline used to fuel the ceremony. The ritual backfires, killing many of the cultists, including Samuel. The estate also implodes, though Atticus and the others are able to make a desperate escape. Still, this frantic flight causes George's wounds to worsen, and he succumbs to his injuries, leaving the others to mourn for him.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/lovecraft-country-series-premiere-shoggoth-explainer/\">Lovecraft Country: What are the Shoggoth, the Series’ First Monsters?</a></span></p><p>From the outset, it was clear that George played a paternal role in Atticus' life, giving his nephew his deep love in literature and counsel that his distant father was never capable of. George's death has already visibly left both Atticus and Montrose grief-stricken and sure to haunt them as the series continues. As the trio sets out for their return to Chicago, the death could either bring the father and son closer together than they had ever been or estrange them further.</p><p><em>Starring Jonathan Majors, Jurnee Smollett, Aunjanue Ellis, Abbey Lee, Jada Harris, Wunmi Mosaku and Michael K. Williams, Lovecraft Country airs Sundays at 9 p.m. ET/PT on HBO.</em></p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/lovecraft-country-dejah-thoris-team-up/\">Lovecraft There's a connection between the company who made the components of the bomb and Daisuke's family -- they just have to figure out what it is. However, if it looks like even the millionaire detective has run into a brick wall, how can they solve this case?</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/millionaire-detective-daisukes-unlimited-balance-gets-limited/\">Millionaire Detective: Daisuke's 'Unlimited' Balance Gets...Limited?</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/millionaire-detective-haru-ep-6.jpg\"/></figure><p>Because the suspect, Ricardo, died during the investigation process, the Modern Crimes team undergo an inquiry by the justice department. Chosuke's colleague tells him that an odd green seagrape substance that is being used as classified military technology may be what's being used to cause both the wireless and wire interferences. Chosuke's friend warns him not to get in too deep.</p><p>During dinner, Chosuke tells Haru that he wants to solve a cold case related to Mizuo before he retires and asks Haru if he wants to help. Suddenly, her car speeds up t0 120km/h without any way to slow down. Careening into a parking lot, her car slams into a passerby. Daisuke is close behind and arrests her for reckless driving and killing the passerby. As she gets into his car to be taken to the police station, Daisuke switches off the gadget so the illusion in her windshield disappears.</p><p>He seizes the opportunity to interrogate her about the bomb. Daisuke tells him to stay out of it. It's interesting that this is in the same locations Haru once said that someone like Daisuke shouldn't be a cop, and yet he's in a <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/millionaire-detective-episode-3-strong-partnership/\">completely different place</a> now, having worked with Daisuke for some time and realizing he's not as bad as he seems.</p><p>Meanwhile, the director tells Chosuke to retire quietly and not meddle anymore, but Chosuke tells Haru that exposing Imura's secrets is justice. Chosuke lies to Imura that her lawyer is there and takes her to another room devoid of surveillance cameras. He almost successfully blackmails her into talking using photos of her son doing drugs. She gives up and asks to call her boss before talking.</p><p>Satisfied, Chosuke leaves the room to see Haru waiting and tells him the only way for justice to prevail is to get your hands dirty. Haru tells him that he can't accept this underhanded way of doing it. Frustration boiling over, Chosuke explodes on Haru, but Haru lets Imura out.</p><figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/millionaire-detective-haru-director.jpg\"/></figure><p>Imura and her lawyer leave and are about to leave in her car when she notices something wrong with the battery. The car starts smoking and the door is locked. A few seconds later, the car explodes and bursts into flames, <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/spirit-photographer-saburo-kono-shonen-jump-manga/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">killing</a> the two inside. Chosuke finds Daisuke on the rooftop smoking a cigar.</p><p>Haru confronts the director of the Modern Crimes department, demanding to know why Chosuke is doing this. With a grim face, the director opens Chosuke's locker and reveals a wooden panel written \"Sayuri Kambe Murder Case/Investigation Headquarters.\" It's unclear who orchestrated the explosion.
