Leung","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/millionaire-detective-chosuke-ep-6.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn24@2020_6/2020/08/24/21-43-11-172_61f3c690b728771b.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/millionaire-detective-haru-ep-6.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn4@2020_5/2020/08/24/21-43-30-889_f488e82d58eb57e8.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/millionaire-detective-haru-daisuke-staircase.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn24@2020_6/2020/08/24/21-43-24-383_e24a06340917ea27.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/millionaire-detective-haru-chosuke.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn32@2020_2/2020/08/24/21-43-24-564_5eb3805163dfc5d7.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/millionaire-detective-haru-director.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn39@2020_6/2020/08/24/21-43-26-220_436d2bd4a5a81cfa.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598305389176},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","title":"Dungeons & Dragons Announces Tasha's Cauldron of Everything Sourcebook","link":"https://www.cbr.com/dungeons-dragons-tashas-cauldron-everything-sourcebook/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/dnd-press-tasha-cover-header.png\"/></figure><p>Wizards of the Coast has announced a new <em><a href=\"http://cbr.com/tag/dungeons-and-dragons\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Dungeons &#38; Dragons</a></em> sourcebook, <em>Tasha's Cauldron of Everything</em>. The book features main cover art by Magali Villeneuve and a retailer-exclusive alt-cover by Wylie Beckert. Both feature magic users who tease the new witchcraft options presented in the book.</p><p>In addition to featuring the fan-favorite artificer class that was first introduced in the Eberron campaign setting in <em>D&#38;D</em> 3.5, <em>Tasha's Cauldron of Everything</em> introduces new class features and subclasses. Additionally, the book presents new spells for player characters and monsters, new magic items -- including magic tattoos and mighty artifacts -- and new feats.</p><p>The content presented in this sourcebook is based on over a year of playtest feedback from <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dungeons-dragons-player-agency/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">gamers in the <em>D&#38;D</em> community</a>.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">Related: <a href=\"http://cbr.com/dungeons-dragons-two-new-subclasses/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Dungeons &#38; Dragons Unearths Two Spooky Subclasses</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/dnd-press-tasha-cover.png\"/></figure><p><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dungeons-dragons-dealing-with-chaotic-disruptive-players/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Dungeon Masters</a> get new tools, as well, including expanded rules for sidekicks and supernatural environments. <em>Tasha's Cauldron</em> also offers puzzles that can be incorporated into any campaign.</p><p>“The special witchcraft of <em>Tasha’s Cauldron of Everything</em> is the freedom it gives you to personalize your <em>D&#38;D</em> character in new ways,” said lead designer and principal rules designer of <em>D&#38;D</em>, Jeremy Crawford. “<em>D&#38;D</em> adventurers are exceptional, and this book gives you the tools to make them and their story even more extraordinary.”</p><p><em>Dungeons &#38; Dragons: Tasha's Cauldron of Everything</em> is slated for release on Nov. 17. Players can get an early sneak peek at the book's contents during D&#38;D Celebration 2020, which takes place Sept. 18-20. See the full press release below.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">Related: <a href=\"http://cbr.com/dungeons-dragons-mythic-odysseys-theros-pantheon/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">D&#38;D: Who Are the Gods in the Pantheon of Theros?</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/dnd-press-tasha-altcover.png\"/></figure><p><em>Tasha’s Cauldron of Everything Overflows With New Rules, Subclasses and Storytelling Options for Dungeons &#38; Dragons</em></p><p><em>Thousands of playtesters contributed to the massive rules update</em></p><p><em>D&#38;D Celebration invites fans to join the largest virtual D&#38;D game ever</em></p><p><em>RENTON, WA – August 24, 2020 – What wonderful witchery is this? Dungeons &#38; Dragons presents a magical mixture of new rules options and subclasses for the world’s greatest roleplaying game with <strong>Tasha’s Cauldron of Everything</strong>. The contents of <strong>Tasha’s Cauldron of Everything</strong> will be available on November 17, 2020, with a cover by Magali Villeneuve and an alt-cover by Wylie Beckert only available through local game stores. Pre-orders are available now, and fans will get a chance to preview some of the new subclasses and more at D&#38;D Celebration, an online gaming event open to fans all over the world, taking place September 18-20.</em></p><p><em>Following in the footsteps of Xanathar’s Guide to Everything and incorporating more than a year of playtest feedback from the D&#38;D community, <strong>Tasha’s Cauldron of Everything</strong> introduces class features and subclasses which add flavorful options to the character classes players already enjoy. The artificer class, a fan favorite, also appears in the book, as do group patrons who can help mold the characters’ story and a customization option that lets you shape your character’s origin.</em></p><p><em>“The special witchcraft of <strong>Tasha’s Cauldron of Everything</strong> is the freedom it gives you to personalize your D&#38;D character in new ways,” said Jeremy Crawford, the book’s lead designer and the principal rules designer of Dungeons &#38; Dragons. “D&#38;D adventurers are exceptional, and this book gives you the tools to make them and their story even more extraordinary.”</em></p><p><em>This witch’s brew wouldn’t be complete without new feats, new spells for both player characters and monsters and new magic items, including magic tattoos and mighty artifacts. The book also contains new tools for Dungeon Masters, such as expanded rules for creating and playing sidekicks and rules for venturing into various supernatural environments. The book closes with a plethora of puzzles perfect for any campaign, ensuring there’s something to please every adventurer’s appetite.</em></p><p><em>A select bite-size menu of features from <strong>Tasha’s Cauldron’s of Everything</strong> are being presented by the #DnD community today so look for more news from Tanya DePass of “Rivals of Waterdeep,” Sam De Leve of “A Darkened Wish,” Viva La Dirt League and more!</em></p><p><em>On Sept 18-20, D&#38;D Celebration features tons of online D&#38;D gameplay so fans all over the world can gather together, roll some dice and slay frost giants to celebrate the launch of Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden. The largest virtual D&#38;D game ever played is scheduled for Saturday, September 19 with more than a thousand concurrent players participating in an epic adventure administered by D&#38;D Adventurers League all with the same meta goal to defend Icewind Dale. With panels featuring D&#38;D game designers discussing the future of D&#38;D, community-led panels and streamed live game play from luminaries in the global D&#38;D community, every fan has something to celebrate at D&#38;D Celebration 2020. All proceeds from tickets for D&#38;D Adventurers League play will go to support Extra Life benefiting Children’s Miracle Network Hospitals.</em></p><p><em>Look for more details on D&#38;D Celebration <a href=\"http://dndcelebration2020.com\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">here</a> and sign up to play a D&#38;D Adventurers League game <a href=\"http://yawningportal.dnd.com\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">here</a>. </em></p><p><em>For more information on D&#38;D, <strong>Tasha’s Cauldron of Everything</strong>, Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden, and D&#38;D Celebration, visit <a href=\"http://dungeonsanddragons.com\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">dungeonsanddragons.com</a>.</em></p><p><span class=\"next-single\">Keep Reading: <a href=\"http://cbr.com/dd-beyond-vs-roll20-explained/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">D&#38;D Beyond Vs. Roll20: Which One Should You Use for Your Campaign?</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 24 Aug 2020 19:09:28 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/dnd-press-tasha-cover-header.png","linkMd5":"57210fe69b3bdc3ef51845ce70d3cb4a","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn16@2020_3/2020/08/24/21-43-09-445_f5994df6ecebbb8b.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":932432,"destBytes":932432,"author":"Samantha Puc","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/dnd-press-tasha-cover-header.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn16@2020_3/2020/08/24/21-43-09-445_f5994df6ecebbb8b.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/dnd-press-tasha-cover.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn11@2020_3/2020/08/24/21-43-22-204_5fa6cb39ab4468f0.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/dnd-press-tasha-altcover.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn51@2020_3/2020/08/24/21-43-22-367_0f2aa174e93a86d2.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598305389187},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","title":"Darkman: Sam Raimi Secretly Recut His Film, Replacing the Studio-Approved Version ","link":"https://www.cbr.com/darkman-sam-raimi-secretly-recut-film/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2018/01/darkman-liam-neeson.png\"/></figure><p>While Sam Raimi's 1990 film <em><a href=\"http://cbr.com/tag/darkman\">Darkman</a></em> marked his first foray into the superhero genre pre-<em>Spider-Man, </em>the film moviegoers got almost wasn't his vision. As it turns out, Raimi replaced Universal Pictures' cut of <em>Darkman</em> with his own at the last minute.</p><p>Universal wanted to edit <em>Darkman</em> without Raimi's involvement in an attempt to boost preview scores. However, producer Robert Tapert explained to <em><a href=\"https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/features/darkman-turns-30-liam-neeson-frances-mcdormand-and-more-remember-the-arduous-making-of-sam-raimis-influential-superhero-film\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">THR</a></em> that editor Bud S. Smith was hired to re-arrange Raimi's initial two-hour cut, which he agreed to do on the condition that he was given some space, editing the film while Raimi and Tapert were briefly away in Florida. This new 85-minute cut didn't work, though. \"We tested that, and it did not test as well as the longer version, which was Sam's cut,\" Tapert said. \"I think we went through four or five more test screenings, and each time the score got lower and lower, and we got more depressed.\"</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/raimi-spider-man-trilogy-different-story-villains/\">Raimi's Spider-Man Trilogy Originally Had a VERY Different Story, Villains</a></span></p><p><em>Darkman</em> composer Danny Elfman similarly described himself as \"pissed\" at Universal's decision, to the point that he \"threatened to take my name off the film and return my fee\" if Raimi's version wasn't restored. His main point of contention was the studio's desire to remove so many of <em>Darkman</em>'s weirder elements, as Elfman felt that \"This crazy stuff is what makes the film.\"</p><p>However, with Universal prepared to go forward with the Smith cut anyway, Raimi and Tapert chose to re-edit <em>Darkman</em> under two days without anyone's knowledge. From how Tapert described the decision, \"We were incredibly disheartened and dispirited. And Sam’s present editor, a guy by the name of Bob Murawski, said, 'There is a much better movie than what we are locking right now.' So, the decision was made that we would re-edit the movie. We spent 48 hours basically re-cutting the entire movie, restoring things we thought were important. We added nine minutes back in, things we really liked that the preview audiences would recoil from, but that was what it was meant to do. We locked it — and didn’t tell anybody.\"</p><p>Despite Universal's outrage, Raimi and Tapert's last-minute decision made it impossible to stop the film negatives from being prepared for critics. The final product was well-received and, thanks to a clever \"Who is Darkman?\" marketing campaign, the film opened at #1 at the box office.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/sam-raimis-superhero-film-darkman-standout/\">Sam Raimi's First Superhero Film, Darkman, STILL Stands Out</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 24 Aug 2020 14:59:37 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2018/01/darkman-liam-neeson.png","linkMd5":"cee7c99a6f893bb44799de5a29df9d8b","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn4@2020_4/2020/08/24/21-43-11-730_8d54686776b9da1b.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":676712,"destBytes":676712,"author":"Ben Wasserman","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2018/01/darkman-liam-neeson.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn4@2020_4/2020/08/24/21-43-11-730_8d54686776b9da1b.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598305389181},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","title":"DC: 10 Hilarious Lucifer Morningstar Memes True Fans Will Enjoy","link":"https://www.cbr.com/dc-lucifer-morningstar-memes-best/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Lucifer-memes-feature.jpg\"/></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Those who’ve read <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/every-volume-neil-gaimans-sandman-ranked/\">volumes of </a></span><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/every-volume-neil-gaimans-sandman-ranked/\"><i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The Sandman</span></i></a><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/every-volume-neil-gaimans-sandman-ranked/\"> comics </a>were the first made aware of the <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/dc/\">DC </a>character that is Lucifer Morningstar. However, he’s found his mainstream success thanks to the </span><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/lucifer/\"><i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Lucifer</span></i></a><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> TV series, which will see all of six seasons in its entirety. Naturally, with great fandom comes an equally great truckload of memes.</span></p><p style=\"text-align: left;\"><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/heroes-marvel-dc-comics-stole-each-other/\">5 Heroes Marvel Stole From DC (&#38; 5 DC Stole)</a></span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">As one would expect, most of them have to do with the TV series version, which is no surprise given its enduring and effortless charm, but that doesn't mean the comic book enthusiasts have slouched on contributing their own memes. But that's enough preamble - here are some of the most hilarious Lucifer Morningstar memes to grace the internet.</span></p>\n                        <h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">10 </span>The Greatest Army</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/lucifer-meme-lucifians.v1.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/crisis-infinite-earths-best-worst-cameos/\">cameo Lucifer had in </a></span><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/crisis-infinite-earths-best-worst-cameos/\"><i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Crisis on Infinite Earths</span></i></a><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> brought cheers of joy from the fanbase. <em>This </em>meme, however, puts together another crossover that would most definitely break the internet. What’s funny is that Lucifer wouldn’t really need a big, strong weapon or a conventional army.</span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Instead, he claims his legion of adoring fans are more than enough to contend with either Loki’s army or the Avengers’ Hulk. Even funnier is how this is a statement that one can even imagine Lucifer himself uttering. </span></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">9 </span>It Finally Worked On Chloe</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/lucifer-meme.v1.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Lucifer’s ability to make people admit their deepest desires can either be interpreted as<a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/lucifer-most-heroic-terrible-actions/\"> something heroic or even terrible</a>, but it’s never worked on Chloe. It’s not completely clear what her true desire is, although this meme makes a bold prediction.</span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">According to it, the thing Chloe wants the most is more Lucifer memes. Then again, it’s most likely that the creator of this meme has placed Chloe as the representation of all the </span><i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Lucifer </span></i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">fans, making it accurate since they do love these memes.</span></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">8 </span>The True Face Of The Devil</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/lucifer-meme.v1-1.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Most expect the devil to have a stare<a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/ghost-rider-most-powerful-spirits-vengeance-ranked/\"> like Ghost Rider exhibits in his many versions.</a> And while Lucifer does have his devil face, he generally uses the one that looks like a human. Considering all the Lucifer characters in media, it’s easy for a non-fan to be confused.</span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">To do away with this problem, this one borrows the all-too-classic Magneto meme. To this end, he asks the “real” Lucifer to show himself, rejecting the classic devil and the one from </span><i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Supernatural</span></i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">. </span></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">7 </span>Now That's An Understanding Fellow</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/lucifer-meme.v1-3.jpg' /></figure><p>Lucifer’s mannerisms seen in the TV series are derived from the comic book version, who is as suave as they come. This Lucifer keeps to himself and doesn’t feel the need to impose his will on anyone, regardless of his powers.</p><p><p style=\"text-align: left;\"><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/superman-mysteries-paid-off-well-didnt/\">Superman: 5 Mysteries That Paid Off Well (&#38; 5 That Didn't)</a></span></p></p><p>The funny thing is that he knows what humans are capable of, yet Lucifer is the least judgmental person ever. If any normal human knew the stuff Lucifer did, there’s no doubt they'd lack the devil's humility, strange as it is to say.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">6 </span>High Quality Like No Other</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/lucifer-meme-4k.v1.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Speaking of the real Lucifer, fans now consider the Tom Ellis version to be far and away the best one to have ever existed. This even includes the actual devil, meaning any other depiction of this being will always be considered inferior.</span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The person behind this meme has summarized this idea the best. As can be seen, the classic devil alongside a little girl barely qualifies as a 144p version of Lucifer, while the TV series version is glorious 4K quality by way of comparison.</span></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">5 </span>It's Always Daddy's Fault</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/lucifer-meme-1.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">God is confirmed to be among<a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dc-strongest-characters-multiverses/\"> the most powerful beings in the DC Universe</a> and is accepted to be the ultimate being in the TV series. Due to this, Lucifer figures that anything bad that happens to him has to be his father’s doing.</span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">This repetitive act of blaming God for every single thing is considered to be a recurring gag among fans, who now see it as a cute habit of Lucifer. So much so that even the fans have an inclination to pin the blame on God straight away even when there’s no evidence that he’s done anything at all.</span></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">4 </span>Get A Clue, Chloe</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/lucifer-meme.v1-2.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Even after she saw Lucifer and <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/lucifer-amenadiel-every-power/\">Amenadiel’s powers on display</a> (not to mention the many times that Lucifer outright told Chloe that he was the devil) she refused to believe him. When she finally did find out the truth, Chloe ended up looking a bit silly.</span></p><p><p style=\"text-align: left;\"><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/supergirl-vs-superman/\">Supergirl Vs. Superman: Who Is Stronger?</a></span></p></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Putting this in simple terms makes the situation look even funnier, seeing as Chloe didn’t have to decipher any clues since all she had to do was accept that Lucifer was telling the truth. The one behind this meme went a little further and put the ludicrousness of the situation in picture form.</span></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">3 </span>The Logic Of Humans</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/lucifer-meme.v1-4.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The unfortunate part about being the devil is the stereotype that comes along with it. Going by the personality that Lucifer has in </span><i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The Sandman</span></i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> series, he’s nothing like the idea of the conventional understanding of the devil in concept - evil and malicious.</span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Fans know this very well, as Lucifer’s known to only punish the people who make it to Hell. Seeing as only bad humans arrive in this realm, Lucifer’s never hurt anyone that's actually a decent person. It’s too bad, then, that the good people themselves see him as the bad guy.</span></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">2 </span>Classic Lucifer Mentality</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/lucifer-meme.v1-5.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Like many romances in TV shows and comics, such as <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/spider-man-mary-jane-peter-parker-gwen-stacy/\">Peter Parker and Mary Jane (or Gwen Stacy</a>), Lucifer and Chloe are known to jump through relatively ridiculous hoops. This usually comes in the form of Lucifer tarnishing his chances with her by doing something stupid.</span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">According to fans, his mentality can be summed up by what’s happening in this meme. As can be seen, Lucifer could easily take the route that gets him Chloe’s love, only for him to take a hard turn toward a surefire way of breaking both of their hearts.</span></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">1 </span>No Arguments Here</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/lucifer-meme.v1-6.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">One of the reasons why </span><i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Lucifer</span></i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> fans love the show so much is because certain things are possible only in this series. For instance, the fact that Lucifer can be seen reading a children’s book, which means the devil was trying to gain wisdom from material aimed at kids.</span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">There’s also the idea that the devil could run a nightclub. All this considered, it’s best not to argue with stuff in this series because the sheer entertainment value speaks for itself.</span></p><p><span class=\"next-single\">NEXT: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dcamu-dc-characters-sad-werent-part-cinematic-universe-glad-left-out/\">DCAMU: 5 DC Characters We're Sad Weren't A Part Of This Cinematic Universe (&#38; 5 We're Glad Were Left Out)</a></span></p>\n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 24 Aug 2020 20:30:29 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Lucifer-memes-feature.jpg","linkMd5":"5ad46d62dfcbd72a380107d8d18f83cc","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn47@2020_5/2020/08/24/21-43-10-508_e2718280147e72e2.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":96888,"destBytes":96888,"author":"Saim Cheeda","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Lucifer-memes-feature.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn47@2020_5/2020/08/24/21-43-10-508_e2718280147e72e2.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/lucifer-meme-lucifians.v1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn92@2020_1/2020/08/24/21-43-21-189_35e42d450d59d498.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/lucifer-meme.v1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn36@2020_5/2020/08/24/21-43-24-482_6405a460875cfb89.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/lucifer-meme.v1-1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn80@2020_1/2020/08/24/21-43-25-716_8eef2f3f6edba355.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/lucifer-meme.v1-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn15@2020_5/2020/08/24/21-43-24-358_6603510283de180f.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/lucifer-meme-4k.v1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn84@2020_1/2020/08/24/21-43-25-693_a7819e30af7d5dd0.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/lucifer-meme-1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn27@2020_5/2020/08/24/21-43-23-528_780b48d065ee9086.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/lucifer-meme.v1-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn12@2020_5/2020/08/24/21-43-25-079_e0d286e2e2088200.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/lucifer-meme.v1-4.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn15@2020_6/2020/08/24/21-43-23-471_d43ebfcc20f287c9.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/lucifer-meme.v1-5.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn52@2020_4/2020/08/24/21-43-29-613_624db6d2ab984083.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/lucifer-meme.v1-6.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn20@2020_4/2020/08/24/21-43-28-434_c0260e148a14d793.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598305389170},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","title":"The Flash's New Movie Costume Is Already a Huge Improvement | CBR","link":"https://www.cbr.com/the-flash-new-movie-costume-already-huge-improvement/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/flash-movie-new-costume-concept-header.jpg\"/></figure><p>Of the theatrical release of the film's many criticisms, one element of <em>Justice League </em>that was definitely disliked was the costume for the Flash. The Scarlet Speedster's iconic lithe, form-fitting red suit was reimagined as a bulky sort of plated armor, making him look like the <em>Injustice </em>Flash by way of Rob Liefeld. Rumors and mock-up suits suggested that the hero would be getting a second, more traditional costume, but this didn't come to pass in the movie that we got. Thankfully, <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/the-flash-film/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">The Flash</a> solo movie finally seems to be picking up steam again, bolstered by renewed momentum in the DCEU following the announcement of the Snyder Cut's release.</p><p>Though a trailer for <em>The Flash </em>is still far off, <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/the-flash-movie-new-suit-concept-art-dc-fandome/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">newly released concept art shows how the titular hero will appear in the movie</a>. The exact opposite of his costume in <em>Justice League, </em>this new costume is easily the Flash's best one yet.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/flash-warner-bros-embrace-dc-greatest-strength-multiverse/\">With The Flash, Warner Bros. Will Embrace DC's Greatest Strength: the Multiverse</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/flash-concept-art-2.jpg\"/></figure><p>The concept art shown for the character represents a new suit that he will wear in his long-awaited upcoming movie. The suit will apparently be created by Batman, who appears with him in the concept art. The suit is far more streamlined than the previous version, with the bulky and awkward armor plating gone completely. In its place is a lightweight jumpsuit that bears a far stronger resemblance to the hero's traditional look. It also has several lines and grooves throughout that fill with light that could potentially be Speed Force energy.</p><p>This look is likely in homage to the New 52 design for the character, which added numerous lightning-filled lines through the Flash's body. The suit has an almost rubbery texture to it, further making it feel like a comic book costume come to life. This suit will probably allow Barry to more easily control his speed without having to worry about the friction that caused him to use the bulky armored suit. The suit may also have some extra function related to the lightning being emitted by its wearer, though it's likely just a visual effect.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/the-flash-movie-new-costume-designed-which-batman/\">Batman Designed The Flash's New Movie Suit - But WHICH Batman?</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/the-flash-crisis-on-infinite-earths-600x389-Cropped-1.jpg\"/></figure><p>Though it's going to be given to him by some version of Batman, the Flash's new suit may also be inspired by the character's interaction with his TV series counterpart. The CW's landmark crossover event <em>Crisis on Infinite Earths </em>not only crossed its heroes with other unrelated DC television properties of the past and present but also featured a small but pivotal appearance from Ezra Miller's version of the character. The two versions of Barry remark at how similar yet different they are compared to each other. The DCEU Flash had apparently not even taken a superhero name yet and was impressed with the name of the Arrowverse version. He also notes how much more breathable and comfortable his counterpart's costume appears to be.</p><p>It's this encounter that could not only lead to DCEU Barry taking the name of the Flash but also his traversing the multiverse. <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/flash-flashpoint-film-michael-keaton-batman/\">Michael Keaton's Batman will appear in the film</a>, and it's possible that Barry will tell either him or the DCEU Batman about \"the other me\" to inspire one of them to create the suit. Regardless of which version of the Caped Crusader makes the suit, though, this is probably the best the Scarlet Speedster has ever looked outside of the comics.</p><p><em>Directed by Andy Muschietti with a script by Christina Hodson, The Flash stars Ezra Miller as Barry Allen. It is scheduled to arrive in theaters on June 3, 2022.</em></p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/flash-movie-michael-keaton-batman-concept-art/\">The Flash May Have Just Revealed the Look at Michael Keaton's Batman</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 24 Aug 2020 20:01:22 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/flash-movie-new-costume-concept-header.jpg","linkMd5":"38d5853222baad3a0d915d8cb6117214","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn12@2020_5/2020/08/24/21-43-10-321_3d930460be5e361a.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":50900,"destBytes":50900,"author":"Timothy Donohoo","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/flash-movie-new-costume-concept-header.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn12@2020_5/2020/08/24/21-43-10-321_3d930460be5e361a.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/flash-concept-art-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn44@2020_2/2020/08/24/21-43-31-165_249121bb92e482e8.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/the-flash-crisis-on-infinite-earths-600x389-Cropped-1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn60@2020_6/2020/08/24/21-43-28-752_b70356110e7357ba.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598305389172},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","title":"The Legend of Korra: Just How Old Is Avatar's Katara in the Sequel Series?","link":"https://www.cbr.com/the-legend-of-korra-just-how-old-is-avatars-katara-in-the-sequel-series/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Katara-The-Legend-of-Korra.jpg\"/></figure><p>Besides the title character, Katara is one of the most important characters of <em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/avatar-the-last-airbender/\">Avatar: The Last Airbender</a></em>. With her waterbending powers she accidentally discovered Avatar Aang in the iceberg and ended his century-long hibernation. She protected and guided Aang throughout the series, and the two fell in love by the show's moving ending. Katara accomplished all this at 14.</p><p>By the time of <em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/the-legend-of-korra/\">The Legend of Korra</a>,</em> Katara was the matriarch of the Southern Water Tribe, a master healer, widowed, a mother  and a grandmother. With the passing of Avatar Aang at age 66, Katara was a natural waterbending master for the next Avatar, who would be born into the Water Tribe. Sokka too had passed away, so she was the oldest living member of her family at 85 years old,<a href=\"https://avatar.fandom.com/wiki/Katara\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"> according to her character biography</a>.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/avatar-last-airbender-strongest-waterbending-feat/\">Avatar: What's The Strongest Waterbending Feat In The Series?</a></span></p><p>In over a half century between the end of the Hundred Year War and Aang's death, Katara and Team Avatar did a lot in rebuilding civilization.<em> </em>G<em>raphic</em> novels like <em>The Promise </em>and <em>The Search </em>showed they continued to go on epic adventures as they grew into adults. Furthermore, Katara raised Bumi, Kya and Tenzin, presumably training Kya to become a waterbender and healer, like herself.</p><figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Avatar-Aang-Katara-.png\"/></figure><p>When Aang passed away, it was Kya who returned to the Southern Water Tribe to take care of her mother. It was also during that time that Katara trained Avatar Korra how to waterbend and retired from combat, only using her powers to heal. Thus her role in <em>The Legend of Korra </em>series was small as she gladly passed the torch to Korra's generation.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/avatar-consistently-inconsistent-good-thing/\">The Avatar Is Consistently Inconsistent - And That's A Good Thing</a></span></p><p>Even though she does not appear often in the sequel series, Katara is still useful as one of the best healers in the world. She healed several rebels during the Water Tribe Civil War in <em>Book Two</em> and assisted in reconnection Jinora's spirit to her body.</p><p>One of the biggest tasks of her life was brought onto her by Avatar Korra after the insurrection of the Red Lotus. Korra was physically and mentally weakened by the experience, and Katara discovered mercury lead poisoning in her system. Although progress was slow and Korra was angered by her suffering, Katara's wisdom about finding meaning through trauma helped Korra along with her process. It took a couple of years, but Katara helped Korra regain her physical strength and put her on the path of being the Avatar again.</p><p>Even in her advanced age and during her retirement in <em>The Legend of Korra</em>, Katara still played a big role as the wise mentor who set the next generation on the right path.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/avatar-is-aang-monk-anymore/\">Avatar: Is Aang Even A Monk Anymore?</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 24 Aug 2020 10:45:28 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Katara-The-Legend-of-Korra.jpg","linkMd5":"f9f108f0e8e4c4a951c98caa58d4e323","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn4@2020_4/2020/08/24/21-43-09-331_5ef77eb61dade398.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":43874,"destBytes":43874,"author":"Michael McCarrick","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Katara-The-Legend-of-Korra.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn4@2020_4/2020/08/24/21-43-09-331_5ef77eb61dade398.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Avatar-Aang-Katara-.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn19@2020_5/2020/08/24/21-43-22-158_2d5dda3ffd805be9.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598305389185},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","title":"Green Lantern: Every Lantern Corps (& The Emotions That Fuel Them)","link":"https://www.cbr.com/green-lanter-corps-color-emotions-explained/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Lantern-Corps.jpg\"/></figure><p>Whether you are a Hal Jordan, Jon Stewart, or Kyle Rayner fan, everyone can agree that the <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/the-green-lantern/\">Green Lantern</a> is one of the most notable characters in DC Comics. A founding member of the Justice League, the Green Lantern (regardless of ringbearer) is a universally loved superhero and has been featured outside of the comics in live-action movies, cartoons, and video games.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/green-lantern-hal-jordan-unique-best-constructs/\">Green Lantern: 10 Coolest Constructs Hal Jordan Ever Made, Ranked</a></span></p><p>However, you may not know that the Green Lantern Corps is not the only Lantern Corps. There is an entire Emotional Spectrum that gives different color Lantern Corps their powers. Here are all ten Lantern Corps and the emotions that fuel their power rings.</p>\n                        <h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">10 </span>Green Lantern Corps: Will</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Green-Lantern-John-Stewart-e1597761447319.jpg' /></figure><p>The Green Lantern Corps is an intergalactic peacekeeping force created by the Guardians of the Universe to protect all 3600 sectors of the DC Universe. Green Lanterns are chosen for their strength of willpower and use their green power rings to create energy constructs from the power of their will and determination. Each member of the Green Lantern Corps is assigned a sector of the DC Universe that they are responsible for protecting from any and all threats.</p><p>Green Lantern Corps Oath: \"In brightest day, in blackest night, No evil shall escape my sight. Let those who worship evil's might, Beware my power -- Green Lantern's light!\"</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">9 </span>Sinestro Corps: Fear</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Yellow-Lantern-Sinestro-e1597761561140.jpg' /></figure><p>The Sinestro Corps or Yellow Lanterns are the enemies of the Green Lantern Corps. Founded by <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/green-lantern-hal-jordan-sinestro-comparison/\">Sinestro</a>, a former Green Lantern, Yellow Lanterns are chosen for their ability to instill great fear in others. Sinestro created the Yellow Lanterns to enforce his vision of order on the universe and oppose the Green Lantern Corps, whose methodology for keeping order he had never agreed with.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/reasons-dc-sinestro-corps-war-definitive-green-lantern-story-blackest-night-better/\">5 Reasons Why The Sinestro Corps War Is The Definitive Green Lantern Story (&#38; 5 Why It's Blackest Night)</a></span></p><p>Sinestro Corps Oath: “In blackest day, in brightest night, Beware your fears made into light. Let those who try to stop what's right, Burn like my power… Sinestro's might!”</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">8 </span>Red Lantern Corps: Rage</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Red-Lantern-Corps-Atrocitus-e1597761640799.jpg' /></figure><p>Another lantern corps and formidable enemy to the Green Lantern Corps are the Red Lanterns. The <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/red-lanterns-sinestro-corps-worst-things/\">Red Lantern Corps</a> is headed by Atrocitus, one of the Five Inversions who survived the massacre of Sector 666. The massacre of Sector 666 was caused by the Guardians of the Universe’s Manhunter androids, a previous peacekeeping force that had malfunctioned. Swearing revenge against the Guardians of the Universe, Atrocitus created the Red Lantern Corps. Fueled by rage, the Red Lanterns are hellbent on destroying the Green Lantern Corps.</p><p>Red Lantern Corps Oath: \"With blood and rage of crimson red, Ripped from a corpse so freshly dead, Together with our hellish hate, We’ll burn you all, that is your fate!\"</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">7 </span>Orange Lantern Corps: Avarice</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Larfleeze-Orange-Lantern-e1597761719428.jpg' /></figure><p>The Orange Lantern Corps is made up of a single Orange Lantern, <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/10-things-green-lantern-fans-need-to-know-about-larfleeze/\">Larfleeze</a>, who can summon an army of orange energy constructs of his defeated foes. Calling himself Agent Orange, Larfleeze is the sole wielder of the orange power of avarice, also known as greed. Larfleeze is an enemy of the Green Lantern Corps but he prefers to live in seclusion on the planet, Okaara, guarding the Orange Power Battery as he suffers from paranoia that anyone he encounters is only there to steal his power.</p><p>Orange Lantern Corps Oath: “What's mine is mine and mine and mine. And mine and mine and mine -- Not yours!\"</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">6 </span>Blue Lantern Corps: Hope</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Blue-Lantern-Saint-Walker-e1597761788215.jpg' /></figure><p>Allies to the Green Lantern Corps, the <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dc-comics-blue-lantern-facts-trivia-information/\">Blue Lantern Corps</a> were created by Ganthet and Sayd, former Guardians of the Universe, who were banished for their belief in the Blackest Night prophecy. Harnessing the Emotional Spectrum’s blue light of hope, the Blue Lantern Corps is primarily defensive, but can massively boost the power of Green Lanterns when they join in combat. Unlike the Green Lantern Corps, whose power rings seek out and choose a beholder based on their emotional strength and prowess, the newest member of <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/blue-lantern-corps-explained/\">the Blue Lantern Corps</a> is responsible for recruiting the next candidate for their monk-like order.</p><p>Blue Lantern Corps Oath: \"In fearful day, in raging night, with strong hearts full, our souls ignite. When all seems lost in the War of Light, look to the stars -- for hope burns bright!\"</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">5 </span>Indigo Tribe: Compassion</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Indigo-Lantern-Corps-Indigo1-e1597761877144.jpg' /></figure><p>The least understood by the various Lantern Corps, the Indigo Tribe are nomadic reformed criminals that have harnessed the power of compassion. Preferring to avoid intervention, the Indigo Tribe distances themselves from conflict unless the fate of the universe is in peril. However, the Indigo Tribe’s power is vast and can even negate the powers of the other colors of the Emotional Spectrum, including the Black Lanterns.</p><p>Indigo Tribe Oath (Indigo Tribe language is untranslatable by other beings): \"Tor lorek san, bor nakka mur, Natromo faan tornek wot ur. Ter Lantern ker lo Abin Sur, Taan lek lek nok--Formorrow Sur!”</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">4 </span>Star Sapphire Corps: Love</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/violet-lantern-star-sapphire-e1597761962630.jpg' /></figure><p>The Star Sapphire Corps is an all-female group of lanterns empowered by love. Originally, <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/green-lantern-star-sapphire-carol-ferris-trivia-facts/\">Carol Ferris</a> was the only Star Sapphire. At this time, the Zamarons gave Star Sapphire her strength through a violet crystal. However, the crystal was uncontrollable, causing the bearer to be guided by the darker impulsive side of love. Eventually, the Zamaron harnessed the violet energy within power rings and created the Star Sapphire Corps, turning foe to allies, and aligning themselves with the Green Lantern Corps.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/green-lantern-star-sapphire-ring-violet-lanterns-explained/\">The Star Sapphire Ring and the Violet Lanterns, Explained</a></span></p><p>Star Sapphire Corps Oath: \"For hearts long lost and full of fright, For those alone in blackest night. Accept our ring and join our fight, Love conquers all -- with violet light!\"</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">3 </span>Black Lantern Corps: Death</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Black-Lantern-Black-Hand-e1597762042832.jpg' /></figure><p>The Black Lantern Corps, void of color, is the enemy of all Lantern Corps across the Emotional Spectrum. Harnessing the power of death, the <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/black-lantern-corps-deadliest-members/\">Black Lantern Corps</a> is comprised of the reanimated corpses of both, heroes, and villains across the DC Universe. Led by Black Hand, the avatar of Nekron, Lord of the Unliving, the Black Lantern Corps is known to seek out and consume the heart of their loved ones to help empower Nekron for his assault on Earth.</p><p>Black Lantern Corps Oath: \"The Blackest Night falls from the skies, The darkness grows as all light dies. We crave your hearts and your demise, By my black hand, the dead shall rise!\"</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">2 </span>White Lantern: Life</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/White-Lanterns-Kyle-Rayner-And-Hal-Jordan-e1597762453298.jpg' /></figure><p>Opposite of the Black Lantern Corps, the <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/white-lanterns-explained/\">White Lantern Corps</a> bring life to the universe, harnessing the full range of colors that make up the Emotional Spectrum. Created during the Blackest Night, the White Lantern Corps began when Hal Jordan merged with the Entity, who was found hidden for millennia on Earth. Combining the strength of the entire Emotional Spectrum, White Lanterns can use the power of all Lantern Corps and even properly resurrect the dead unlike the Black Lantern Corps, who can only reanimate corpses.</p><p>White Lantern Corps Oath: “In brightest day, in brightest night let my ring shine the brightest light. When evil comes, I will join the fight. The power of the white lanterns is the strongest might!”</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">1 </span>Ultraviolet Lantern: Hidden Negative Feelings</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Ultraviolet-Lantern-Corps-e1597762547248.jpg' /></figure><p>Due to the <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dc-source-wall-break-explained/\">Source Wall</a> breaking, seven hidden forces were released into the DC Universe. One of those forces was the Invisible Emotional Spectrum. Unlike the other Lantern Corps that control the Emotional Spectrum, the Invisible Emotional Spectrum controls the Ultraviolet Lanterns. Feeding on hidden negative emotions, the Ultraviolet Lantern Corps is controlled by Umbrax, the sentient sun of a living phantom galaxy. Umbrax and the Lantern Corps of the unseen light, seek out planets with strong self-destructive forces and pull them into Umbrax’s galaxy, adding the inhabitants to the <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/justice-league-ultraviolet-corps-origin-powers/\">Ultraviolet Lantern Corps</a>.</p><p>Ultraviolet Lantern Corps Oath: \"By shield of day, and shield of night, We feed and grow, beyond all sight, Your darkest self shall be our knight, Wield the sword of unseen light!\"</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">NEXT: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/green-lantern-most-confusing-thing-about-corps/\">Green Lantern: The 10 Most Confusing Thing About The Corps, Finally Explained</a></span></p>\n                        \n 2020/08/White-Lanterns-Kyle-Rayner-And-Hal-Jordan-e1597762453298.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn39@2020_3/2020/08/24/21-43-25-481_44a77f404579440b.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Ultraviolet-Lantern-Corps-e1597762547248.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn20@2020_1/2020/08/24/21-43-25-952_7e82d0b56cd83d5d.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598305389169},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","title":"Powerpuff Girls Live-Action Series Headed to The CW | CBR","link":"https://www.cbr.com/powerpuff-girls-live-action-series-headed-to-the-cw/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Powerpuff-Girls-1998.jpg\"/></figure><p>A live-action <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/powerpuff-girls/\"><em>Powerpuff Girls</em></a> series is in development at The CW.</p><p>The series will be written and executive produced by Heather Regnier and Diablo Cody, with Berlanti Productions' Greg Berlanti, Sarah Schechter and David Madden also executive producing and Warner Bros. Television producing.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a class=\"bc-title-link\" title=\"Powerpuff Girls' Mojo Jojo Appeared in a Marvel Comic – What Does It Mean?\" href=\"https://www.cbr.com/mojo-jojo-powerpuff-girls-empyre-fantastic-four-cameo/\">Powerpuff Girls' Mojo Jojo Appeared In A Marvel Comic – What Does It Mean?</a></span></p><p>Created by Craig McCracken, <em>The Powerpuff Girls</em> debuted on Cartoon Network in 1998 and was produced by Hanna-Barbera Productions for the first four seasons and Cartoon Network Studios for the remaining two. The series centers on three superpowered, kindergarten-aged girls -- Bubbles, Blossom and Buttercup -- who live in the fictional suburb of Townsville, USA with their father, Professor Utonium, who creates them by accidentally adding \"Chemical X\" to a mixture intended to spawn the perfect little girls. The three pint-sized heroes use their impressive array of abilities to battle such recurring foes as  Mojo Jojo and Him.</p><p>The original run of <em>Powerpuff Girls</em> lasted until 2005, with a feature film released in 2002 and a CGI special in 2014. Then, in 2016, the property was rebooted by Cartoon Network, running for three seasons before concluding in 2019.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a class=\"bc-title-link\" title=\"Powerpuff Girls’ HIM: How a Beatles Cartoon Inspired the Subversive Villain\" href=\"https://www.cbr.com/powerpuff-girls-him-beatles-cartoon-yellow-submarine-subversive-villain/\">Powerpuff Girls’ HIM: How A Beatles Cartoon Inspired The Subversive Villain</a></span></p><p>(via <em><a href=\"https://variety.com/2020/tv/news/powerpuff-girls-live-action-series-cw-1234746828/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Variety</a></em>)</p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 24 Aug 2020 19:34:56 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Powerpuff-Girls-1998.jpg","linkMd5":"7309a69bf25391ec3cb76e21b79a035d","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn68@2020_4/2020/08/24/21-43-10-598_cbf3586782402463.webp","destWidth":1916,"destHeight":958,"sourceBytes":73378,"destBytes":73378,"author":"Jon Arvedon","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Powerpuff-Girls-1998.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn68@2020_4/2020/08/24/21-43-10-598_cbf3586782402463.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598305389172},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","title":"NOS4A2 EP Joe Hill On Strong Creatives & New Storylines + a Deleted Scene From the Finale","link":"https://www.cbr.com/nos4a2-joe-hill-season-2-postmortem-interview/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NOS4A2-Vic-Maggie.jpg\"/></figure><p><em><strong>WARNING: The following contains major spoilers for the second season of </strong></em><em><strong><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/nos4a2/\">NOS4A2</a>.</strong></em></p><p>The second season of <em>NOS4A2</em> has reached its conclusion with the end of the battle between Charlie Manx and Vic McQueen, and there's plenty to digest from this action-packed series of episodes. From meeting a new Strong Creative, the Hourglass Man, to learning Strong Creatives can alleviate some of the worst side effects of their gifts, and from Millie Manx making her way into the real world to discovering more of Charlie Manx's backstory, the season was full of fascinating revelations and surprising developments.</p><p>In a postmortem interview with CBR, executive producer Joe Hill, who wrote the novel the series is based on, discussed what inspired him to create the Hourglass Man, an original character for the show, and how his own experiences inspired the negative drawbacks endured by Strong Creatives. He also teased some potential Season 3 storylines and where to look for a hidden sequence from the Season 2 finale.</p><p>And for more <em>NOS4A2</em> intrigue, check out the juicy deleted scene at the end of the interview.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/nos4a2-zachary-quinto-interview/\">NOS4A2: Zachary Quinto Talks Playing Charlie Manx &#38; Rooting for Vic McQueen</a></span></p><p><strong>CBR: We met a new Strong Creative in the middle of the season, the Hourglass Man, who is an ally of Charlie Manx. I read that he was your idea. How and why did you create him?</strong></p><p><strong>Joe Hill:</strong> Yeah, so there's a couple things there. Jami O'Brien, who is the lead writer and showrunner on <em>NOS4A2</em> had a whole set of really fresh and exciting ideas that she brought to the table. And one of them was this club called Parnassus, a bar on the night road. And it's sort of outside of our own reality but other Strong Creatives go there to hang out, have a few beers and connect.</p><p>And I got kind of interested in that place. And I was thinking about, so in Season 1, Charlie underestimates Vic, and she's able to not only survive, but badly injure him and put him in jail. And I was thinking he's not going to underestimate her that way again. And with that in mind, he does have access to this bar where there are other powerful Creatives like him, other people who can twist reality. Maybe he can go and try and cut a deal with someone there. And I started to think who that might be, and came up with the Hourglass. And he became one more instrument for Charlie Manx to use to steal Wayne from Vic and to take his revenge.</p><p>And I think that's kind of exciting, and I think that if there was another season of <em>NOS4A2,</em> the Hourglass somewhat points the way towards what that season might look like. But, you know, there's this whole world out there, of people like Charlie Manx and Vic Queen. Some of them are good. Some of them are like Jolene in the first season with her roller skates. And some of them are very, very bad, people like Charlie or like the Hourglass. And, we've got, as Season 2 ends, we have Maggie following a thread that might lead her towards more people like the Hourglass. And it's not hard to imagine her finding one that maybe it would have been better to leave alone, and having to get the band back together to deal with a new menace.</p><figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/NOS4A2-Maggie-Hourglass-Man.jpg\"/></figure><p><strong>One of the things Maggie learns from her interaction with the Hourglass Man is how she can use her powers without the negative side effects. </strong></p><p>Well, yeah. Did she really escape the negative side effects? She's putting cigarettes out on her arm to forestall seizures, so I'm not really sure that she's quite figured out how to use her powers without damaging herself. She just moved the damage in another direction.</p><p><strong>That's fair. Why did you originally conceive of the Strong Creatives' powers having these negative drawbacks?</strong></p><p>Yeah. Why did I decide on that? That's a good question. I mean, I guess I feel like I was trying to say that every good attribute a person has can be turned against them. And that there are costs..., all our choices come with price tags on them. I like the idea that the heroes of  <em>NOS4A2</em> could bend reality but that doing so would come with a hefty price tag, would incur damage on them. And I thought a lot about Charlie, who seems to be immortal. And I thought, well what's it cost, and then gradually I decided what it costs him was his soul.</p><p><strong>Is there any metaphorical basis in your experiences as a creative?</strong></p><p>You know, I talked with my dad once or twice. I wrestled with a lot of anxiety over the last decade. I'm in a really good place now, but I had a nervous breakdown in 2010 and got into therapy and on anti-anxiety medication. And I talked to my dad about that, and the thing is, I spend most of my time coming up with paranoid scenarios. That's <em>actually</em> my job. And, my dad says that that's like an instrument, like a tool with a very sharp edge, and it has to cut something, and if it's not cutting it's way through a story then it's cutting you. And in that you kind of have the seed of my thinking about Strong Creatives, I guess.</p><p>But I do think that I spend so much time thinking about worst-case scenarios that it can be difficult sometimes not to get lost in my own storyline. Not to feel like: oh this is going to happen to me and then this is going to happen to me, and then I'm going to be dead of coronavirus. [<em>Laughs</em>]</p><p><strong>I hope that doesn't happen too often!</strong></p><p>It's not so bad anymore. I've gotten a lot better at holding my own paranoid scenarios at arms' length.</p><p><strong>That's good to hear. </strong></p><p><strong>Maggie, as you said, is in the process of finding these Strong Creatives. Do you have any more ideas of who these individuals could be in your head?</strong></p><p>Oh yeah, there's always more. [<em>Laughs</em>] There's always more. I mean, I've talked off and on for years about writing another novella about Maggie, called <em>The Crooked Alley</em>. And I had a pretty clear idea for the story and when it would take place....</p><p>So the world of the novel and the world of the TV show are adjacent but not exactly the same. For example, the <em>NOS4A2</em> TV show, makes a couple radically different choices in the ending. At least one character in the TV show survives who dies in the book. In the world of the book, there is this story I would write about Maggie that takes place after Maggie has met Vic for the first time, but before Maggie has re-encountered Vic following the birth of Vic's son.</p><p><strong>That would be a lot of fun.</strong></p><p>Yeah, it would be cool. And I had this idea, ...I said, \"Look at all these kids who have left Christmasland. Don't they need a support group or something?\" And then I was thinking, wow, that would be pretty good. Imagine a support group of kids from Christmasland. They're all in the early 20s and stuff. I think that could be pretty good, especially if Millie starts coming after them for being quitters.</p><p><strong>Last time we talked you said you love visiting the Christmasland sets, and we spend a lot of time there in this last part of the season. Were you happy about that?</strong></p><p>Oh yeah, absolutely. I <em>love</em> spending time in the ice maze. I was hoping from the moment we decided we were going to do a <em>NOS4A2</em> TV show, that we would get to ride all the rides in Christmasland, so it's cool that the story finally got us there and that we were able to spend not one but two episodes really enjoying the place.</p><p>You know, the one story that's in the <em>NOS4A2</em> world that hasn't been explored yet, in the comic book <em>Wraith</em> there's a kind of <em>Con Air</em> in Christmasland story. And I'd still like to see that happen. I still think that would make a great standalone movie.</p><p><strong>At the end of Season 2, we have Millie Manx surviving and entering the real world, which I believe is inspired by an alternate ending you wrote for the book of <em>NOS4A2</em>. Is Millie's experience in the real world something you've been itching to explore more?</strong></p><p>So, in the published novel, the book ends, and then there's an acknowledgements page and there's an \"About the Author\" section. And then in the very back of the book, you see this in some books, there's \"About the Type,\" which talks about the font that the book was set in, the typeset for the book. But in <em>NOS4A2</em> that turns into a whole secret chapter about Christmasland about Millie Manx. And that hidden chapter, that sort of secret track in the book, becomes the ending in the TV show, except in the digital release of the final episode of Season 2, there's a hidden chapter in that. I don't believe it's going to be on the air on AMC, so there is a hidden track on the TV show as well on the digital release of it.</p><figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/NOS4A2-Vampire-children.jpg\"/></figure><p><strong>Well that's good to know.</strong></p><p>[<em>Laughs</em>] But I'm sure the moment it crops up on YouTube, AMC's copyright lawyers will be busy squashing it.... Let me just tell you, people are going to be shocked when Samuel Jackson shows up at Vic's house and asks if she wants to join the Avengers.</p><p><strong>That is going to be shocking, no one's going to see that coming. </strong></p><p>Total curveball.</p><p><strong>In Season 2, Millie became a major character who really had a lot of conflict. Did you see her going in that direction when the TV show started?</strong></p><p>Not necessarily, and I think that's more Jami's vision, but it's a good one, it's an exciting vision. You know, Jami and I wound up talking about <em>Pinocchio</em> a lot. <em>Pinocchio</em> was one of the landmarks I used to find my way through writing the novel. Christmasland is... analogous in some ways to Pleasure Island, a major location in <em>Pinocchio</em>. Pleasure Island is this place where little boys go to drink and smoke and gamble. And by indulging their worst behavior, they gradually turn into jackasses. And Christmasland is a little bit the same, only by indulging their worst behavior, kids turn into soulless vampires.</p><p>What's interesting about that is Jami took that reflection of <em>Pinocchio</em> and began to apply it to Millie. Millie has been a child of Christmasland for almost 100 years and has reached a point in Season 2 where she's started to wonder what she might have missed out on by never growing up. So there is this storyline in Season 2 about Millie Manx wanting to be a real girl, to grow up and become a real girl the same way Pinocchio wants to be a real boy. And that, I think, is very interesting. And if there was another season of <em>NOS4A2</em>, it would be interesting to see if Wayne can pull Millie into a life of humanity, if he can pull Millie towards humanity, or Millie succeeds in pulling Wayne back into monstrousness.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/nos4a2-season-2-trailer-christmasland/\">NOS4A2 Season 2 Trailer Welcomes You to Christmasland</a></span></p><p><strong>In the second season, we also get a second episode about <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/nos4a2-charlie-manx-origin-explained/\">Manx's backstory</a> when he was a child, but it differs a lot from the backstory in the graphic novel you wrote in that it makes Charlie a predator even when he was a kid. Did you feel that was an appropriate choice for the show?</strong></p><p>Well, he's something of an unknowing predator in the flashback sequence in the show. I think he's kind of pushed out of his mind what this owner of the toy store is doing to the kids that he recruits for him.... I go back to what was in the comic, which is this idea [of] Manx becoming a person who uses his reality to [form] powers to abduct children and keep them in a state of neverending innocence. I tried to show in the comic book how that was rooted in destruction of his own innocence and hatred for a mother who didn't protect him.</p><p>And I think you could spread that out to Manx's view of women as a whole, which is not very favorable. Charlie has a set of patriarchal views about women that are so extreme that they're poisonous, almost sociopathic. You know, you'd like to think that those are attitudes that fell out of date 100 years ago, but unfortunately, apparently not.</p><iframe width=\"480\" height=\"270\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/Qfw7w2ZZPNw?feature=oembed\" frameborder=\"0\" allow=\"accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture\" allowfullscreen></iframe><p><em>NOS4A2 Season 2 stars Zachary Quinto, Ashleigh Cummings, Jonathan Langdon, Jason David, Ólafur Darri Ólafsson, Virginia Kull, Jahkara Smith and Ebon Moss-Bachrach.</em></p><p><span class=\"next-single\">NEXT: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/nos4a2s-paul-schneider-interview/\">NOS4A2: Paul Schneider on Bringing the Hourglass Man to Murderous Life</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 24 Aug 2020 14:45:40 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NOS4A2-Vic-Maggie.jpg","linkMd5":"c0d3d532dde047913201e1a3e1f7467e","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn32@2020_3/2020/08/24/21-43-10-385_ca20487e8644ad67.webp","destWidth":1300,"destHeight":650,"sourceBytes":75652,"destBytes":75652,"author":"Cynthia Vinney","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NOS4A2-Vic-Maggie.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn32@2020_3/2020/08/24/21-43-10-385_ca20487e8644ad67.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/NOS4A2-Maggie-Hourglass-Man.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn32@2020_2/2020/08/24/21-43-30-321_50304b77955e6c21.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/NOS4A2-Vampire-children.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn76@2020_2/2020/08/24/21-43-31-343_2bb8a9107bdb3d4a.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598305389181},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","title":"Marvel: 10 Best Moon Knight Cosplay | CBR","link":"https://www.cbr.com/marvel-moon-knight-best-cosplay/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/moon-knight-cosplay-featured.jpg\"/></figure><p><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/moon-knight/\">Moon Knight</a> may not be one of the most well known Marvel superheroes currently, given the success of the MCU juggernaut, but for his most ardent fans, he'll always be popular. His unique story, which focused on Marc Spector, a CIA agent left for dead and saved by the Egyptian Moon God Khonshu, continues to captivate fans who follow his intriguing descent into bloodthirstiness and insanity.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/moon-knight-fan-castings-mcu-disney-plus-keanu-reeves/\">Moon Knight: Top 10 Fan Castings For The Disney Plus Show, Ranked</a></span></p><p>With rumors within the last year that Moon Knight could finally be given the live-action treatment on Disney+, fans may not have to wait much longer to see him finally brought to life properly. Until then, fans are more than up to the task, donning various incarnations of Moon Knight's classic all-white hooded ensemble to be the ones you see coming.</p>\n                        <h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">10 </span>Knightmage</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/knightmage15-moon-knight-cosplay.jpg' /></figure><p>Rarely do mere mortals expect to come close to resembling their favorite superheroes in comics, thanks to the highly exaggerated way they're drawn. But <a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/Knightmage1/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Knightmage</a> manages to create a truly terrifying Moon Knight who looks like he stepped out of the pages of his own issue.</p><p>Knightmage's version of Moon Knight resembles the anti-hero after a particularly <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/moon-knight-villains-fans-hope-see/\">devastating battle with Bushman,</a> after which he almost retires. Instead, he adopted a costume similar to his classic outfit, including knuckle-spikes that were last seen in his werewolf hunting days. Best of all, Knightmage looks as brutal and unhinged as Spector did during that tumultuous time period.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">9 </span>Breezeeweezee</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/breezeeweezee-moon-knight-cosplay.jpg' /></figure><p>Here Moon Knight strikes a classic superhero pose, looking intimidating and mysterious in a dark alley. In the dim lighting, it's difficult to make out that this is a genderbent cosplay, adding to its appeal and mystique.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dc-batman-genderbent-cosplay-every-dc-fan-need-see/\">10 Genderbent Batman Cosplay Every DC Fan Needs To See</a></span></p><p>Talented cosplayer <a href=\"https://www.breezeeweezee.com/blog/how-i-made-my-moon-knight-cosplay\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Breezeeweezee</a> brought the cosplay to life in just a week. She chronicled her adventure on Snapchat, where she shared how she assembled all the pieces using second-hand items, some carved foam, and a trusty hot glue gun.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">8 </span>Spectra Cosplay</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/spectra-cosplay-moon-knight.jpg' /></figure><p>Moon Knight may not seem like a very intricate cosplay to pull off, but its simplicity belies its complexity. Cosplayers often have a difficult time creating a mystique of mystery and intrigue with an all-white outfit that can't conceal any mistakes.</p><p><a href=\"https://www.deviantart.com/mariegreycosplay/art/Moon-Knight-366723286\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Spectra Cosplay</a> has proven that simplicity and complexity can come together in a marriage of unrivaled professionalism, where every attention to detail is made. The result is an effective and efficient Moon Knight cosplay that is streamlined and satisfying.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">7 </span>Paradox Studios</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Mr-sarcasm-moon-knight-cosplay.jpg' /></figure><p>Moon Knight is one of the most anticipated Marvel characters to receive his own film franchise, but so far he has yet to get the MCU treatment. This encouraged fans to come together and make their own short for <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/the-punisher-marvel-comics-moon-knight/\">the titular vigilante</a>.</p><p>The costume, developed by <a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/paradoxstudiosfilms/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Paradox Studios</a> for the fan film, resembles Moon Knight's vestments from the '90s and '00s comic series, as opposed to the stark white version of the '80s.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">6 </span>Jason Childers</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/jason-childers-cosplay-moon-knight.jpg' /></figure><p>There have been notable occasions where Moon Knight has teamed up with other superheroes, including the Avengers and the X-Men, when it suits his needs. This member of the Arizona Avengers decided to ditch his normal costume and moonlight as Marc Spector at the Phoenix Comic-Con in 2011.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/avengers-marvel-cinematic-universe-best-cosplay/\">Avengers: 9 Cosplays That Are Better Than The Movies</a></span></p><p><a href=\"https://comicsalliance.com/best-cosplay-ever-this-week-08-06-12/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Jason Childers</a>, often seen donning a Hawkeye cosplay as part of the Arizona Avengers, decided to don Moon Knight's white robes, impressively filling out what could have been a lackluster body stocking.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">5 </span>Chris Wildrick</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/chris-wildrick-moon-knight-egyptian-cosplay.jpg' /></figure><p><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/moon-knight-best-worst-costumes/\">Moon Knight has had many different costumes over the years</a>, though all are some variant of his signature all-white costume from <em>Moon Knight </em>#1 in 1980. He's more recently sported an ivory Ancient Egyptian bird outfit, as seen in 2014's <em>Moon Knight </em>#3.</p><p><a href=\"https://chriswildrick.com/portfolio/magic-egyptian-armor-moon-knight/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Chris Wildrick</a> was inspired by the comic to create this difficult build. This included learning how to create scale mail and carving the bird head out of insulation foam, finally debuting it at DragonCon.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">4 </span>Brin Londo</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/brin-londo-cosplay-moon-knight.jpg' /></figure><p>There have been many comparisons between <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/batman-versus-moon-knight-who-better-fighter/\">Moon Knight and Batman.</a> In the variations of the former's suit over the years, it's a common mistake to think he's wearing the Dark Knight's signature batsuit with white accents.</p><p>Cosplayer<a href=\"https://www.tapatalk.com/groups/theleagueofheroes/memberlist.php?mode=viewprofile&#38;u=474169\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"> Brin Londo</a> developed their own take on Moon Knight's black and white ensemble, preferring to keep a mask that revealed their eyes (and no doubt allowed for better visibility while walking the convention floor). The belt is the real show stopper, featuring Spector's iconic crescents.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">3 </span>Mr. Lizard</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/mr-lizard-moon-knight-cosplay.jpg' /></figure><p>Moon Knight has had as many costume variations as he's had personalities. In the '90s, when just about every superhero received an \"armored\" version of their iconic supersuit, Moon Knight was no exception after being infected by a demonic parasite that required a complete overhaul of his protective gear.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/moon-knight-facts-about-marvels-batman/\">Moon Knight: 10 Facts About Marvel's Batman</a></span></p><p>This cosplay isn't as hypertrophied as Moon Knight's original suit of armor. Instead, it achieves a pleasant balance between functionality and efficacy by mimicking the Modern Moon Knight armor created by Declan Shalvey.
