Too much armor would be counterproductive to Moon Knight's combat style anyway.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">2 </span>JohnGalt777</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/mr-knight-john-galt-777-cosplay.jpg' /></figure><p>During Warren Ellis's <em>Secret Avengers </em>run, he developed Moon Knight into an even stealthier version of himself by giving him an all-white suit to wear on a mission for <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/best-female-captain-america-cosplay-ranked/\">Captain America</a>. This look proved so popular that when Ellis took over <em>Moon Knight </em>properly, the suit remained the same.</p><p>This cosplay by <a href=\"https://www.deviantart.com/johngalt777\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">JohnGalt777</a> reflects the indefatigable nature of Mr. Knight, known to prowl the streets of his city looking for everything from werewolves to gangsters. In his interactions with clients or the local authorities, he always dressed as Mr. Knight, seen here standing out amidst a wall of comics.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">1 </span>Prometheus023</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/moon-knight-cosplay-prometheus023.jpg' /></figure><p>One of the most prominent artists to ever depict Moon Knight remains Bill Sienkiewicz. After being given the rein to <em>Moon Knight </em>in the '80s, Sienkiewicz revolutionized mainstream comics in the US with his stylized art that combined both photorealism and total abstraction. One of his most famous prints depicts Moon Knight sitting on an enormous Egyptian throne.</p><p>Cosplayer <a href=\"https://www.deviantart.com/prometheus023\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Prometheus023</a> may not be on that throne, but he's perched on the Iron Throne as seen in the hit HBO series <em>Game of Thrones. </em>He still gives Moon Knight the appropriate gravitas, complete in his Modern Armor Look.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">NEXT: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/genderbent-spider-man-cosplay/\">10 Genderbent Spider-Man Cosplay Every Marvel Fans Needs To See</a></span></p>\n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 24 Aug 2020 14:30:37 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/moon-knight-cosplay-featured.jpg","linkMd5":"612905723137ee5c9804e904121466d7","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn87@2020_6/2020/08/24/21-43-11-561_943c83fe3f53a63d.webp","destWidth":1710,"destHeight":900,"sourceBytes":149256,"destBytes":149256,"author":"Kayleena Pierce-Bohen","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/moon-knight-cosplay-featured.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn87@2020_6/2020/08/24/21-43-11-561_943c83fe3f53a63d.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/knightmage15-moon-knight-cosplay.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn87@2020_4/2020/08/24/21-43-31-511_e356b19d8e0b2980.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/breezeeweezee-moon-knight-cosplay.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn48@2020_1/2020/08/24/21-43-26-182_6386773483fef634.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/spectra-cosplay-moon-knight.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn27@2020_1/2020/08/24/21-43-24-573_03146281b7271126.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Mr-sarcasm-moon-knight-cosplay.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn99@2020_4/2020/08/24/21-43-32-540_97943e70813f2b69.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/jason-childers-cosplay-moon-knight.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn52@2020_6/2020/08/24/21-43-21-107_acc60a06f9eacbba.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/chris-wildrick-moon-knight-egyptian-cosplay.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn88@2020_5/2020/08/24/21-43-25-672_2017054f83b0b1d1.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/brin-londo-cosplay-moon-knight.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn79@2020_4/2020/08/24/21-43-27-281_91a8a82c872b846e.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/mr-lizard-moon-knight-cosplay.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn96@2020_3/2020/08/24/21-43-31-563_b713a9f4aa09e791.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/mr-knight-john-galt-777-cosplay.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn44@2020_3/2020/08/24/21-43-28-673_7bef4f0d93b54ad4.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/moon-knight-cosplay-prometheus023.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn55@2020_6/2020/08/24/21-43-27-105_28b60fb259ba18a4.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598305389182},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","title":"Iron Man’s Newest Armor Looks Like Junji Ito's Body Horror Manga","link":"https://www.cbr.com/iron-man-armor-junji-ito-influence/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Iron-Man-Junji-Ito-feature.jpg\"/></figure><p><em><strong>WARNING: The following contains spoilers for </strong></em><strong><a href=\"http://cbr.com/tag/empyre\">Empyre</a> #5, <em>by Al Ewing, Dan Slott, Valerio Schiti, Marte Gracia and VC's Joe Caramagna, on sale now.</em></strong></p><p>The fallout of the <a href=\"http://cbr.com/tag/avengers\">Avengers</a>' mistaken support of the Cotati has brought Tony Stark back to a place with which he is all too familiar: the drawing board. In typical Tony fashion, he has retreated to Avengers Mountain to spend sleepless days developing a new suit of armor. However, it's not for him this time. Instead, it's for Reed Richards.</p><p>Because of Mister Fantastic's stretching abilities, Tony designs the suit to accommodate Richards' power. Thus, it bears a resemblance to an infamous piece of body horror by <a href=\"http://cbr.com/tag/junji-ito\">Junji Ito</a>.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">Related: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/x-men-empyre-new-mutants-magik-darkchilde/\">X-Men: Marvel Unleashes The New Mutants' Worst Nightmare</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Empyre-5-designs.jpg\"/></figure><p>Valerio Schiti's character designs in the backmatter of <em>Empyre</em> #5 reveal the <a href=\"http://cbr.com/tag/fantastic-four\">Fantastic Four</a> power armor created by Tony Stark for Reed Richards. The suit looks more or less like a blue and grey <a href=\"http://cbr.com/tag/iron-man\">Iron Man</a> suit, with the iconic four in place of the arc reactor. The sketches give a front and back view, in addition to a look at how the suit stretches with Reed's body. It's cool, yes, but it also bears an unnerving similarity the final horrific product of Junji Ito's <em>The Enigma of Maigara Fault</em>.</p><p><em>The Enigma of Amigara Fault</em> is the story of two teens, Owaki and Yoshida, who hike Amigara Mountain following an earthquake in a nameless Japanese prefecture. A recent earthquake revealed a series of indeterminably deep holes in a cliff face, which are shaped exactly like specific human silhouettes. Many hikers have gone to the mountain in search of their hole, saying that when they saw the news story on TV, the hole called out to them.</p><p>One by one people begin to enter the holes, even though they know they will be lost inside the mountain, unable to move any way but forward. The holes have an irresistible draw that eventually overtakes Yoshida and Owaki. The story then jumps ahead by months, to reveal a group of scientists discovering a similar cliff face with similar holes -- only these holes are far more abstract shapes, incredibly long and spindly. One of the researchers looks inside and sees a horrific, completely stretched out human creature coming toward him from the darkness, still a perfect fit for the hole.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">Related: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/scariest-stories-smashed-junji-ito-story-collection-ranked/\">The Scariest Stories in Smashed: Junji Ito Story Collection, Ranked</a></span></p><p>It is relatively common now for fans to recreate the panels of Ito's manga with popular characters like Mario, Plague Knight and Diglet. These panels have been memed. However, it is unlikely Marvel is making an intentional reference to Junji Ito.</p><p>This does, however, harken back to the roots of the Fantastic Four. While the group wasn't body horror per se, the idea of their mutations as being initially disturbing was a part of Stan Lee's original concept. Ben Grimm famously grappled with this in Stan Lee and Jack Kirby's classic, \"This Man... This Monster!,\" in which the darker side of the Thing's transformation is explored. The idea of the body horror inherent to Marvel's first family is also toyed with -- albeit unsuccessfully -- in Fox's 2015 <em>Fantastic Four</em> film.</p><p>Still, <em>Empyre</em> #5 makes it clear that it's better not to think too much about the properties of Mister Fantastic's semi-disturbing, bone-crunching anatomy.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">Keep Reading: <a href=\"http://cbr.com/captain-america-greatest-leader/\">Captain America Is OFFICIALLY Marvel’s Greatest Leader</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 24 Aug 2020 19:20:17 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Iron-Man-Junji-Ito-feature.jpg","linkMd5":"435db78fa69d3ff16b22f12274f752f2","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn67@2020_1/2020/08/24/21-43-09-434_0d1bff779b74c001.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":147238,"destBytes":147238,"author":"Carter Burrowes","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Iron-Man-Junji-Ito-feature.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn67@2020_1/2020/08/24/21-43-09-434_0d1bff779b74c001.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Empyre-5-designs.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn100@2020_5/2020/08/24/21-43-28-328_4214e7ec36cc338b.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598305389172},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","title":"What If...? Fan Art Puts Tom Hiddleston in Chris Hemsworth's First Thor Costume","link":"https://www.cbr.com/what-if-tom-hiddleston-thor-costume-fan-art/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/What-If-Loki-Was-Worthy.jpg\"/></figure><p>An upcoming Disney+ series called <em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/what-if-tv/\">What If…?</a></em> will take <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/marvel-cinematic-universe/\">Marvel Cinematic Universe</a> fans on a journey through alternate universes to explore what could have been. However, fans won’t have to wait until the show comes out to learn what would happen if Loki was the true hero of the Thor series.</p><p>French visual designer <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/B5c4GUyHmmQ/?utm_source=ig_web_copy_link\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Camille Vialet</a> posted an image on Instagram that featured the God of Mischief actor Tom Hiddleston dressed in Chris Hemsworth’s first Thor movie costume. The art challenged MCU fans to think about what would happen if Loki could wield Mjolnir and Thor had been the villain of the series.</p><iframe width=\"320\" height=\"320\" frameborder=\"0\" src=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/B5c4GUyHmmQ/?utm_source=ig_embed\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe><p><span class=\"related-single\">Related: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/charlie-wen-what-if-scenario-doctor-doom-infinity-gauntlet/\">Marvel Studios Artist Depicts What If? Scenario With Doctor Doom and the Infinity Gauntlet</a></span></p><p>\"What if Loki was worthy? I think this could be a very good episode. What about you? Would you like to see Loki as the good guy and Thor as the bad one?\" Vialet wrote.</p><p>The idea of Loki wielding Mjolnir is not a new concept. It was also explored in 1984's <em>What If?</em> #47  by Peter Gillis, Kelley Jones, Sam de la Rosa, Bob Sharen and John Morelli. The story, entitled \"What If Loki Had Found the Hammer of Thor?\" took readers into an alternate universe where Loki frees himself from Odin's imprisonment and finds Mjolnir before his brother.</p><p>These <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/what-if/\"><em>What If</em></a> comics are the basis of a TV adaptation Disney announced last year. Called <em>What If...?</em>, the animated series will explore alternate timelines in the MCU and show fans what could have happened if events played out differently. During each episode, The Watcher, voiced by <em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/westworld/\">Westworld</a></em>’s Jeffrey Wright, will take fans on a journey through a hypothetical universe just like in the comics. In fact, the upcoming series is expected to feature the aforementioned <em>What If?</em> #47 and reveal the ripple effects of what would happen if Loki wielded Mjolnir.</p><p>Many actors, including Chris Hemsworth and Tom Hiddleston, will reprise their MCU roles in the animated series and bring the show directly into the cinematic universe.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/mcu-theory-loki-become-thor-disney-series/\">MCU Theory: Loki Will Become Thor on the Disney+ Series</a></span></p><p><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/what-if-information-guide/\">The first season of <em>What If...?</em></a> will consist of 10 episodes released weekly and will be available on <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/disney-plus/\">Disney+</a> in the summer of 2021.</p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 24 Aug 2020 15:55:04 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/What-If-Loki-Was-Worthy.jpg","linkMd5":"4c8a3329fece32e5b798b05f627b4a7f","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn96@2020_3/2020/08/24/21-43-09-399_eec92617bd929503.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":79050,"destBytes":79050,"author":"Jessica Andrews","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/What-If-Loki-Was-Worthy.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn96@2020_3/2020/08/24/21-43-09-399_eec92617bd929503.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598305389179},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","title":"One Piece: 10 Devil Fruits That Are Insanely Underrated | CBR","link":"https://www.cbr.com/one-piece-devil-fruits-underrated/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/chopper-sengoku-featured-one-piece.jpg\"/></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">There is no power system in the anime medium that can rival the Devil Fruits’ state of perfect equilibrium. This </span><i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/one-piece/\">One Piece</a></span></i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> power system is easily one of the simplest and most straightforward, yet it holds so much complexity and remains shrouded in a veil of mystery.</span></p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/one-piece-devil-fruit-abilities-counter-luffy-handle/\">One Piece: 5 Devil Fruit Abilities That Perfectly Counter Luffy (&#38; 5 He Can Handle)</a></span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Throughout the series’ run, plenty of Devil Fruits have been introduced. Some of these could be considered cannon fodder just as their users; while others left a deep memorable impression on the audience. If </span><i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">One Piece</span></i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> taught fans one thing, then it’s that there is no such thing as a useless Devil Fruit, only unskilled users. With that being said, there are times when a good Devil Fruit falls in the hands of a skilled user but it still gets overlooked.</span></p>\n                        <h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">10 </span>Door-Door Fruit</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/blueno-in-one-piece.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The Door-Door fruit was introduced in the <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/one-piece-luffys-best-fight-saga-ranked/\">Water 7 saga</a>. It’s a Paramecia-type Devil Fruit that was eaten by Blueno, a previous member of <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/one-piece-enies-lobby-villains-ranked/\">the CP9</a>.</span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The ability granted by this Devil Fruit is overpowered. The capability to create doors on any given surface, including the air itself, has a wide variety of uses. It could be used for espionage and stealth work or even just teleportation. With this bad boy in hand, almost no enemy in the world can hope to pin down its user.</span></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">9 </span>Swamp-Swamp Fruit</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Caribou.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The Swamp-Swamp fruit is mainly underrated <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/one-piece-weakest-big-name-pirates/\">due to its user, Caribou</a>. As the Devil Fruit is of the Logia category, it being overpowered is a given. Those without Haki can forget about harming Caribou, and this can mean near-invincibility in the first half of the Grand Line.</span></p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/one-piece-best-logia-devil-fruits/\">Top 10 Logia Devil Fruits in One Piece, Ranked</a></span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Another ability that this fruit can grant is near-infinite storage capacity. Everything that goes into the swamp, stays in the swamp. Caribou used this auxiliary ability to abduct multiple mermaids without causing much of a scene.</span></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">8 </span>Barrier-Barrier Fruit</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/11/Bartholomeo-Barrier.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">A Barrier that is semi-indestructible is an ability that even Yonko-class heavy hitters would desire. According to its previous wielder, Kurozumi Semimaru, the barriers conjured by this Devil Fruit can easily withstand a barrage of attacks from the man himself, <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/one-piece-oden-facts/\">Kozuki Oden</a>. </span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">That is the very same Kozuki Oden who left a permanent scar on Kaido, a man/creature known for his invincibility. Hopefully, this puts things into perspective. </span></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">7 </span>Human-Human Fruit</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Chopper-Fine-In-Water.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Before jumping into conclusions, one has to understand that <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/one-piece-strongest-characters-non-human/\">Chopper was but a wandering reindeer</a> prior to eating this Devil Fruit. After eating it, not only did Chopper acquire a human-level intelligence, but he also gained way more than that. </span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">What is criminally overlooked about the Human-Human Fruit is the superintelligence that Chopper received. A human, such as Luffy, has absolutely zero chances of becoming a talented doctor like Chopper. Let that sink in.</span></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">6 </span>Human-Human Fruit, Model: Daibutsu</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/11/Blackbeard-Sengoku.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The same as the aforementioned Devil Fruit, but of a different model. This model Daibutsu is one of the rarest Devil Fruits in the world of </span><i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">One Piece</span></i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">; even rarer than Logia.</span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> It’s a <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/one-piece-mythical-zoan-devil-fruits-powers-granted/\">Mythical Zoan</a> that comes with multiple equally-overpowered abilities, and fans have only seen the tip of the iceberg when it comes to its potential. Both Devil Fruit and the user share the same fate of being underrated.</span></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">5 </span>Clear-Clear Fruit</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/xiYPNMXM.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">A simple argument that could possibly discredit this Devil Fruit for good is Observational Haki. Having said so, it’s the very same argument – Haki – that is capable of making this Devil Fruit shine.</span></p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/powerful-devil-fruits-one-piece-incompetent-users/\">10 Powerful Devil Fruits In One Piece With Incompetent Users</a></span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">As showcased by Rayleigh, an advanced Haki user can successfully eliminate their entire presence; rendering them nigh-undetectable. If the Clear-Clear Fruit was augmented with advanced Haki, then the result would be striking, to say the least.</span></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">4 </span>Weapon-Weapon Fruit</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/0552b1cfc2a555b803c305212606bc0d-Cropped.png' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The Weapon-Weapon Fruit was eaten by Baby 5; a previous <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/one-piece-donquixote-pirate-bounty/\">Donquixote Officer</a> and Sai's current spouse. This Devil Fruit allows its user to transform a part of, or their entire body, into a weapon. If it does exactly what it says it does, then that makes it one of the series' most overwhelming Devil Fruits.</span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Baby 5 was shown to be able to transform into a bomb; therefore, does that mean that with enough knowledge (or imagination) she could transform into a nuclear weapon?</span></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">3 </span>Chop-Chop Fruit</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/12/Mihawk-Buggy-Luffy.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Do not be misdirected by the comic nature of this fruit and its user. One of the abilities it grants is complete slice damage immunity. It seems apparent that slices from a random ragtag cannon fodder and slices from the World’s Strongest Swordsman all prove futile against its wielder, which protects Buggs from a lot of potential enemies.</span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Buggy D Clown and his Devil Fruit should get the full recognition they very much deserve.</span></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">2 </span>Hobby-Hobby Fruit</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/06/Sugar-One-Piece.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">If used correctly, there exists no opponent that this Devil Fruit can not topple – Yonkos included. Doflamingo’s entire regime was based on this Hobby-Hobby Fruit; without it, he would’ve had a much harder time expanding his underground influence.</span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Basically, anyone who Sugar makes physical contact with can fall victim to its effects. While this Devil Fruit might not be necessarily underrated, it does not get the attention it deserves either.</span></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">1 </span>Rumble-Rumble Fruit</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/10/Luffy-vs-Enel-.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The Rumble-Rumble Fruit is the kind of Devil Fruit that belongs in endgame content. It’s far too overpowered to be situated in the first half of the series. If it – alongside Enel – does not make a comeback sometimes in the future, then that’d be a serious waste of potential. </span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Some of this fruit’s perks include the ability to conjure, manipulate, and transform into electricity as well as providing an unrealistic range of Observational Haki.</span></p><p><span class=\"next-single\" style=\"font-weight: 400;\">NEXT: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/best-one-piece-fight-scenes/\">Top 10 Fight Scenes in One Piece, Ranked</a></span></p>\n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 24 Aug 2020 16:30:07 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/chopper-sengoku-featured-one-piece.jpg","linkMd5":"7f73029117a56ddb3becdce37b403eb4","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn31@2020_2/2020/08/24/21-43-11-974_329e2261935c859a.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":73592,"destBytes":73592,"author":"Suliman Omar","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/chopper-sengoku-featured-one-piece.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn31@2020_2/2020/08/24/21-43-11-974_329e2261935c859a.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/blueno-in-one-piece.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn59@2020_2/2020/08/24/21-43-31-309_9e6ea9b069cdc56c.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Caribou.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn79@2020_3/2020/08/24/21-43-24-853_d6daa70febecdce5.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/11/Bartholomeo-Barrier.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn7@2020_2/2020/08/24/21-43-23-430_1b2ad08356c7f1c5.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Chopper-Fine-In-Water.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn91@2020_6/2020/08/24/21-43-25-662_2ec56f2ff5114518.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/11/Blackbeard-Sengoku.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn40@2020_6/2020/08/24/21-43-23-575_9d9c8a7a8f6e039c.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/xiYPNMXM.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn3@2020_4/2020/08/24/21-43-29-273_e5cf6e6d6ff0a007.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/0552b1cfc2a555b803c305212606bc0d-Cropped.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn87@2020_3/2020/08/24/21-43-22-399_2d5fc97c7584cb74.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/12/Mihawk-Buggy-Luffy.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn19@2020_3/2020/08/24/21-43-22-604_6ec373a4bce7fd0a.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/06/Sugar-One-Piece.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn7@2020_2/2020/08/24/21-43-21-148_2d3141c7c08838a4.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/10/Luffy-vs-Enel-.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn59@2020_1/2020/08/24/21-43-23-214_f5a9fd74ab695e2e.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598305389179},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","title":"10 Love Interests Of Iron Man, Ranked From Worst To Best | CBR","link":"https://www.cbr.com/marvel-iron-man-love-interests-ranked-best/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/10-Love-Interests-Of-Iron-Man-Ranked-From-Worst-To-Best-featured-image.jpg\"/></figure><p><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/iron-man/\">Iron Man</a> is one of the most popular superheroes to come from Marvel comics, with no small part being due to the movie portrayal by Robert Downey, Jr. The fan-favorite Avenger has only shown romance with <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/pepper-potts/\">Pepper Potts</a> on the big screen. While movie fans may be familiar with that relationship, there is more to the story in the comics.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/iron-man-tony-stark-closest-allies/\">Iron Man: Tony Stark's 10 Closest Allies </a></span></p><p>Not to mention, Tony Stark has had many other romantic relationships, some worse than others. Most of them, however, are significant in Tony's history. While Iron Man is a great hero, he doesn't always have a great love life.</p>\n                        <h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">10 </span>Kathy Dare</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/kathy-dare-tony-stark.jpg' /></figure><p>Kathy Dare was a fun-loving woman when she began a casual relationship with <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/mcu-iron-man-endgame-tony-stark-changes/\">Tony Stark</a>. However, she proved to be prone to jealousy. She grew extremely jealous of other women in Tony's life, even the ones with whom he had no romantic history. Tony would break up with Kathy only for her to respond by shooting him.</p><p>Tony Starks's death was faked while he recuperated from the gunshot, which left him paralyzed for some time. Kathy was overcome with grief over what she had done to Tony and died by suicide.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">9 </span>Indries Moomji</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Indries-Moomji-.jpg' /></figure><p>Tony Stark fell hard for Indries Moomji. Little did he know that that was Obadiah Stane's plan. <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/ranked-iron-man-villains/\">Iron Man villain Obadiah</a> hired Indries to seduce Stark and make sure he fell off the wagon. After posing as a bystander during a disaster that <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/iron-man-most-powerful-armors-not-in-mcu/\">Iron Man</a> would save her from, she began using pheromones to increase his attraction to her. She had been trained to make herself appear as attractive to men as possible.</p><p>Indries would continuously tempt Tony to drink during their relationship. When she eventually cruelly rejected him, he hit the bottle and completely fell off the wagon, leaving Stark Industries vulnerable to Obadiah Stane.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">8 </span>Joanna Nivena</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Joanna-Nivena-.jpg' /></figure><p>Tony Stark was actually engaged to a woman named Joanna Nivena when he first became Iron Man. At the beginning of his days as the hero, Tony kept it a secret from Joanna and pushed her away. Eventually, he would tell her the truth, however.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/iron-man-tony-stark-closest-allies/\">10 She-Hulk Love Interests Fans Need To Know About </a></span></p><p>Joanna would actually encourage Tony to use the Iron Man suit to become a hero. As he did, however, she realized that he couldn't be Iron Man and a good husband to her. Therefore, they ended their relationship.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">7 </span>Rumiko Fujikawa</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Rumiko-Fujikawa.jpg' /></figure><p>Rumiko Fujikawa was the daughter of Kenjiro Fujikawa, who had taken over Stark Industries after Tony's apparent death. However, the latter would return and begin dating Rumiko. Rumiko entered the relationship in large part as a rebellion against her parents, who disapproved of Tony. Rumiko enjoyed the relationship with Tony, except for the fact that he was so busy, he hardly paid attention to her.</p><p>They ended the relationship and Rumiko slept with Tony's enemy, Tiberius Stone. She felt remorseful about sleeping with Stone and helped Stark get his company back as a way to make up for it.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">6 </span>Madame Masque</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Madame-Masque-Cropped.jpg' /></figure><p><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/madame-masque/\">Madame Masque</a> and Iron Man had quite a complicated relationship. Their initial attraction came to an end when she revealed she had feelings for Jasper Sitwell. However, when she returned to Stark Industries under the guise of Krissy Longfellow, they fell for each other again. Unfortunately, her criminal father, Count Nefaria, would return.</p><p>Masque tried to force Tony to save her ill father but he refused and they fought. Their encounter led to him accidentally destroying the equipment keeping Count Nefaria alive. Madame Masque would leave Tony and fully become a villain after this devastating loss.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">5 </span>Bethany Cabe</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Bethany-Cabe-Cropped.jpg' /></figure><p>Bethany Cabe and Tony Stark became romantically involved shortly after she joined his security team. Their relationship had a rough patch, as he began drinking heavily as her late husband had. However, unlike her late husband, Tony asked for her help and eventually became sober.</p><p>When Cabe discovered her husband was indeed alive, she left Tony. She intentionally got herself arrested for espionage in an attempt to help her husband. She told Tony that she knew he was Iron Man and needed his help to rescue her husband.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">4 </span>Black Widow</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Black-Widow-Cropped.jpg' /></figure><p>Tony Stark fell for Natasha Romanov when she was a spy for the Russian government. After discovering she was a spy, they broke things off. However, Natasha would defect to the US and join the Avengers. As <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/black-widow/\">Black Widow</a>, she became a close comrade and friend for Tony Stark.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/iron-man-marvel-comics-pathetic-villains-lamest-losers/\">Iron Man: His 10 Most Pathetic Villains </a></span></p><p>The pair renewed their romantic interest in Russia, where they were battling Titanium Man. However, the relationship would proceed no further after this trip. They remain close comrades and <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/black-widow-facts-trivia-marvel/\">Black Widow</a> backed Iron Man during the first <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/captain-america-civil-war-iron-man-worst-things/\">Civil War</a>. Despite the relationship not going far, it is significant that the two Avengers had one at all.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">3 </span>She-Hulk</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/She-Hulk-Cropped.jpg' /></figure><p><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/she-hulk/\">She-Hulk</a> and Iron Man had a casual relationship consisting of on-again-off-again hookups. They enjoyed being together without being in a serious romantic relationship. What makes this relationship so significant is the parallels between the two and the double standard it forms.</p><p>Tony Stark was a womanizer and player who was famous for sleeping around. <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/she-hulk-transformation-facts/\">She-Hulk</a> got around a lot too but she was quicker to be judged for it. This double-standard was thankfully acknowledged during their hookups, making it one of Iron Man's more significant flings.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">2 </span>Janet Van Dyne</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Wasp-and-Iron-Man-Cropped.jpg' /></figure><p>Tony Stark's most recent relationship is with Janet Van Dyne, also known as <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/wasp/\">The Wasp</a>. After her marriage with Hank Pym fell apart, the two founding Avengers quickly got together. Captain America tried to get Tony Stark to end the relationship but he didn't.</p><p>Their first affair fell apart after Janet discovered that Tony was Iron Man. This information did not keep them from rekindling things after she filed for divorce from <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/hank-pym/\">Hank Pym</a>.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">1 </span>Pepper Potts</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Tony-Stark-and-Pepper-Potts-Iron-Man-2.jpg' /></figure><p><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/iron-man-pepper-potts-real-hero-iron-man-avengers-tony-stark/\">Pepper Potts</a> is without a doubt the most well known of Iron Man's romantic partners. This is in no small part due to Gwyneth Paltrow's portrayal in the <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/marvel-cinematic-universe/\">Marvel Cinematic Universe</a>. What fans of the movies may not know, however, is that things didn't work out for Tony and Pepper in the comics.</p><p>Their romance was limited, as Pepper Potts would end up marrying Happy Hogan. Although Pepper had renewed feelings for Tony later, they would keep things platonic and continue working together.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">NEXT: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/best-daredevil-love-interests/\">10 Best Daredevil Love Interests, Ranked </a></span></p>\n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 24 Aug 2020 14:30:51 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/10-Love-Interests-Of-Iron-Man-Ranked-From-Worst-To-Best-featured-image.jpg","linkMd5":"f417e2908121d3f51146140e89e7fede","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn8@2020_5/2020/08/24/21-43-11-708_5d2b06dac7173bb1.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":147240,"destBytes":147240,"author":"jarod-milanese","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/10-Love-Interests-Of-Iron-Man-Ranked-From-Worst-To-Best-featured-image.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn8@2020_5/2020/08/24/21-43-11-708_5d2b06dac7173bb1.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/kathy-dare-tony-stark.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn43@2020_6/2020/08/24/21-43-23-690_c20cc13bd5e02ff8.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Indries-Moomji-.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn67@2020_6/2020/08/24/21-43-23-199_6da42b4551cb0c55.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Joanna-Nivena-.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn47@2020_2/2020/08/24/21-43-21-136_ddec3d200c9a5ac0.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Rumiko-Fujikawa.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn35@2020_2/2020/08/24/21-43-23-647_1b4f3d699ecfac34.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Madame-Masque-Cropped.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn59@2020_6/2020/08/24/21-43-21-234_a23ea284e48c9454.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Bethany-Cabe-Cropped.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn75@2020_3/2020/08/24/21-43-27-247_e91af9e19fc6519a.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Black-Widow-Cropped.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn87@2020_6/2020/08/24/21-43-29-974_903780ffbd224afb.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/She-Hulk-Cropped.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn92@2020_3/2020/08/24/21-43-24-149_a92e7e0b210aa0ac.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Wasp-and-Iron-Man-Cropped.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn72@2020_6/2020/08/24/21-43-29-846_ff0c1ef9154c3b08.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Tony-Stark-and-Pepper-Potts-Iron-Man-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn44@2020_6/2020/08/24/21-43-27-924_bfeab02843939d60.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598305389182},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","title":"Yu-Gi-Oh!: The Subtle Horror of Being a Duel Monsters Card | CBR","link":"https://www.cbr.com/yu-gi-oh-subtle-horror-duel-monsters-card/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/yugioh-1.jpg\"/></figure><p>Whether you've watched the anime, read the manga or played the games, any <em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/search/yu-gi-oh!/\">Yu-Gi-Oh!</a></em> fan is familiar with <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/yu-gi-oh-duel-monsters-kids-card-game-to-global-empire/\">the focal game of Duel Monsters</a>. Pitched as a children's card game but with a depth and complexity that makes even longtime fans pine for a comprehensive guidebook, Duel Monsters has players using monsters, spells and traps to reduce their opponent's life points to zero. If a player is particularly unlucky, this ends with a one-way ticket to the Shadow Realm (in the dub) or the playing of a Penalty Game.</p><p>Despite being billed as a game for kids, Duel Monsters was the ancient Shadow Games made real in modern times, <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/yu-gi-oh-card-game-invented-anime/\">at least according to the original series</a>. While the later spinoffs treated the game with varying degrees of seriousness -- from warranting a school focused on the game to being able to duel your way out of getting arrested -- <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/yu-gi-oh-yami-yugi-pharaoh-history-explained/\">the first series established</a> that the monsters themselves were, in reality, the monsters inside all of us, the <em>ka</em> that could be forcibly extracted from criminals (and sometimes innocents) or willingly brought forth by the protagonists. The death of the <em>ka</em> meant the death of the duelist, and these life-and-death stakes continued in the modern setting the characters most frequently found themselves in.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/digimon-adventure-2020-episode-11-leomons-role-reboot/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Digimon Adventure 2020 Reveals Leomon's Role in the Reboot</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Untitled-design-5.png\"/></figure><p>In the anime-exclusive \"Waking the Dragons\" season, Yugi and the Pharaoh learn of the existence of the Duel Spirit Realm, an alternate dimension exclusively populated by the Duel Monsters themselves. Later spinoffs such as <em>Yu-Gi-Oh! GX</em> and <em>Yu-Gi-Oh! 5Ds</em> would continue to make use of this realm, and even make extensive trips (or, in the case of <em>GX</em>'s Bastion Misawa, decide to live there full-time with the Amazoness card of his dreams). This establishes that the Duel Monster cards are indeed alive and sentient, which raises some major ethical questions regarding their use and suggests a sort of creeping horror regarding the daily life of such a <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/pokemon-goh-perfect-time-to-phase-ash-out-of-anime/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">monster</a>.</p><p>After all, one of the major mechanics of the game is sacrificing weaker monsters to bring out stronger ones -- and this isn't even getting into the concept of fusion summoning, in which two or more monsters are fused to make a new one. Later series are a bit nicer in their depictions of these summons, but early installments were not, showing the monsters disintegrating or exploding. In one memorable instance, having two disparate monsters being force-fusioned resulted in them slowly <em>melting</em> in agony.</p><p>These are living creatures whose entire existence is at the mercy of the duelists, who may or may not treat them with anything regarding care. Take, for example, Seto Kaiba ripping Grandpa Muto's <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/yu-gi-ohs-best-duelists-are-constantly-cheating/\">prize Blue Eyes White Dragon in half</a>, or the sheer callousness with which the Rare Hunters treat their cards. Some are capable of fighting back, such as the Egyptian god monsters, but most must hope that their owner is benevolent, or at the least merciful.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/fruits-basket-season-2-episode-20-cinderella-cast/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Fruits Basket: The Class Casts Its Cinderella Play</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Untitled-design-1.png\"/></figure><p>And even before the concept of these monsters being real beings is made manifest in later story arcs, the original series shows this clearly, with the monsters having realistic reactions to the actions taking place on the field--Kuriboh's responses are often played for laughs, but in many cases you can see the monsters in agony upon being hit, and during the Arkana duel in Battle City, Arkana's Dark Magician is horrified at the notion that his master would so callously destroy him for a quick gain. Since they can be summoned back from the graveyard or used in later duels, death is not a release for a suffering Duel Monster.</p><p>The more you consider the concept of Duel Monsters as living things, the more terrifying their very <em>existence</em> becomes. Low-powered monsters must hope for buffs or come to terms with being fodder for traps or <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/digimon-tamers-deserves-the-tri-treatment/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">larger monsters</a>. The sight of face down cards elicits fear. Chumley Huffington from the<em> GX</em> series having a heart-to-heart with one of the cards he intends to swap out of his deck is initially played for laughs, but how many cards didn't even get <em>that</em> courtesy?</p><p>But there's a heartwarming aspect when you consider the monsters' relationships with the main characters, especially in <em>GX</em> onward where the Duel Monster spirits directly interact with the characters. These genuine friendships give a different spin to the \"Heart of the Cards.\" The cards themselves want to see their duelists win and are fully capable of responding to their needs. The existence of a Duel Monster is a harsh one, but sometimes it can be rewarding.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/god-of-high-school-episode-6-mujin-nox-mistake-traitor/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">The God of High School: Mujin’s Enemies Just Made a Costly Mistake</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 24 Aug 2020 04:00:58 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/yugioh-1.jpg","linkMd5":"ce6feef5b0c5b109c92912a434fb88eb","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn84@2020_4/2020/08/24/21-43-10-511_71015e67aed3b629.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":179880,"destBytes":179880,"author":"Kelsey Dickson","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/yugioh-1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn84@2020_4/2020/08/24/21-43-10-511_71015e67aed3b629.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Untitled-design-5.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn59@2020_5/2020/08/24/21-43-21-151_1581474aef5da61d.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Untitled-design-1.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn75@2020_2/2020/08/24/21-43-28-243_dcc5154cc1a347d3.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598305389186},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","title":"Mortal Kombat: 5 Ways Scorpion Is A Hero (& 5 He's A Villain)","link":"https://www.cbr.com/mortal-kombat-scorpion-hero-vs-villain-kharon-quan-chi-raiden/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Scorpion-good-bad.jpg\"/></figure><p>First debuting in the original <em>Mortal Kombat</em> game, <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/mortal-kombat-scorpion-cosplay/\">Scorpion</a>'s legacy is one of the most contentious of the cast's entire roster. In a world that is often black and white, he is a complex and morally gray character with a long list of actions in service of both good and evil.</p><p>RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/mortal-kombat-fighters-should-have-lost/\">Mortal Kombat: 10 Heroes Who Should Lose Their Story Fights, But Don't</a></p><p>This divided <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/best-mortal-kombat-movie-original-vs-scorpions-revenge/\">legacy</a> incurs speculation as to whether or not he has ultimately done more harm than good. To determine this, we explore Scorpion's history, weighing his feats of heroism against those of his depravity. Through this assessment, it is easiest to definitively determine whether or not he is a hero.</p>\n                        <h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">10 </span>Hero - Saving Kharon</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/kronika-kharon-Cropped.jpg' /></figure><p>Should Kronika deem one unfit to join their ranks ~ or should they pose a threat to her grand schemes ~ she is inclined to leave them in the tender care of her sadistic servant, D'vorah. The bug queen's ants feasted on Kharon's flesh, hoping to prevent him from ferrying her mistress's enemies.</p><p>However, her taste of victory was short-lived. Scorpion would intervene on his behalf, attacking D'vorah and forcing her to retreat. Without his invaluable aid, <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/mortal-kombat-reasons-johnny-cage-should-be-main-character-instead-of-liu-kang/\">Liu Kang's allies </a>would not have been able to reach their mutually shared opponent.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">9 </span>Villain - Executing Quan Chi</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/scorpion-kills-quan-Cropped.jpg' /></figure><p>Executing Quan Chi was morally dubious even as an isolated incident. Though he was responsible for manipulating Scorpion and misdirecting his anger toward Sub-Zero, he was also a prisoner of war, one helpless to defend himself.</p><p>More importantly, he was capable of restoring the revenants back to their previous forms. By decapitating him, Hanzo had eliminated the <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/mortal-kombat-jax-cosplay-love/\">Special </a>Forces' best hope of reuniting their friends, a plight which Scorpion himself should be able to relate to.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">8 </span>Hero - Listening To Raiden</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/raiden-scorpion-Cropped.jpg' /></figure><p>Desperate to avoid the current path of history, Raiden approached Scorpion with a simple proposition; spare Sub-Zero's life, and he would ask that his family and clan be restored. Hanzo considered this carefully, finally agreeing to the <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/mortal-kombat-dc-raiden-fight-win-lose/\">Thunder God</a>'s deal.</p><p>While he would later surrender to his passions in an unfortunate fit of rage compelled by the scheming Quan Chi, this nonetheless demonstrated Scorpion's priorities as a character. He values his family and happiness more than he does revenge; if he did not, he never would have agreed to Raiden's offer in the first place.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">7 </span>Villain - Ambushing Johnny Cage</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/scorpion-movie-Cropped.jpg' /></figure><p>Under the instruction of his dark masters, Scorpion attacked Johnny Cage in the middle of a forest, navigating his spears among the trees in an attempt to skewer him. Eliminating him would remove another obstacle Shang Tsung would have to contend with in his quest to merge Outworld and Earthrealm.</p><p>Unfortunately for Hanzo,<a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/mortal-kombat-johnny-cage-fan-art/\"> Johnny Cage</a> had a plan. Utilizing the terrain to his advantage, he seized the shield of a nearby fallen warrior, using it to block Scorpion's flames and then cleaving through his head. Due to his quick thinking, he was able to avoid a dishonorable assassination.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">6 </span>Hero - Making Peace With Sub-Zero</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/scorpion-making-peace-Cropped.jpg' /></figure><p>Despite the bitter rivalry between Scorpion and Sub-Zero, they were able to make amends, reconciling their differences at the Lin Kuei Palace. This offering of peace would be interrupted by Frost, who identified Hanzo as an enemy and attempted to exterminate him against her Grandmaster's wishes.</p><p>Nonetheless, the meeting was a success. With the misunderstanding between both ninja cleared up, Scorpion and <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/mortal-kombat-awesome-sub-zero-cosplays/\">Sub-Zero</a> could work together in more productive endeavors, ones which would channel their righteous anger through into more deserving targets. It was a defining moment of character growth for Hanzo, one which demonstrates his abilities of reason.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">5 </span>Villain - Murdering Bi-Han</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/bihan-death-Cropped.jpg' /></figure><p>While Scorpion may have promised otherwise, he would ultimately be as much of a slave to his own rage as he was to Quan Chi. During the tournament in <em>Mortal Kombat 9,</em> he would bring him to the Netherrealm for their battle. After the cryomancer's defeat, his sorcerer master would manifest artificial images of the Shirai Ryu's slaughter to provoke his wrath.</p><p>Bi-Han's provocation immediately before the fight would not help his case. Overcome with grief and anger, Scorpion ripped out his spine, returning to Shang Tsung's palace and presenting it to all those in attendance. This would result in the birth of Noob Saibot, a fierce warrior that would serve the forces of evil in the battles to follow.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">4 </span>Hero - Helping Restore Cyrax</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/scorpion-cyrax-Cropped.jpg' /></figure><p>Hanzo would come to realize that he was not the only ninja to have his freedom stolen from him. After the peace he struck with Sub-Zero, his new ally requested his assistance in freeing his Lin Kuei friend, Cyrax, from the clutches of Sektor and his Cyber Initiative.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/mortal-kombat-villains-always-lose-fights/\">Mortal Kombat: 10 Villains That Always Lose Their Fights</a></span></p><p>Despite an unprecedented intervention and attack by Frost, this venture would bear fruit. Hanzo and Sub-Zero would disable Cyrax's behavior inhibitor, returning him to the man he was in<em> Mortal Kombat 9 </em>and giving them an invaluable ally.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">3 </span>Villain - Fighting In The Mortal Kombat Tournament</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/scorpion-tournament-Cropped.jpg' /></figure><p>Scorpion's involvement in Shang Tsung's tournament was under his benefactor, Quan Chi. Should he succeed in his battles, he would have the privilege of enacting justice on Sub-Zero, however that \"justice\" would manifest.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/mortal-kombat-complete-franchise-games-ranked/\">Mortal Kombat: Every Game In The Franchise, Ranked</a></span></p><p>The problem with this is that he's still acting in the interest of the Outworld and Netherrealm forces. It entails that if he was victorious, Shang Tsung would be able to merge the realms together. Essentially, Scorpion prioritized a petty victory over the entire planet he was born and raised in.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">2 </span>Hero - Literally Redeeming Himself</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/REDEEM-Cropped.jpg' /></figure><p>When Kronika had brought back warriors from different timelines to do her bidding, Scorpion was among those she returned. This contrasted the Hanzo of the present timeline, giving them an opportunity to face one another.</p><p>Sharing what the future held for his younger self, Hanzo expressed to him the folly of his vengeance, reminding him that his true priorities were in his family. After his death, the Scorpion of the past would take these words to heart, volunteering his services to Raiden and Liu Kang.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">1 </span>Villain - Attacking The Special Forces</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/special-forces-attack-Cropped.jpg' /></figure><p>To get to Quan Chi, Hanzo would have to contend with the Special Forces. Though he and his warriors offered them an opportunity to stand down, he was exerting his authority over Earthrealm's protectors, an authority that he did not have.</p><p>Since they were understandably unwilling to relinquish him, Scorpion unleashed his wrath on his opponents, beating down many of their allies and weakening their defenses. With D'vorah and the revenants still on the loose, turning on his friends to slake his thirst for revenge was a poor and selfish decision.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">NEXT: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/mortal-kombat-reasons-shao-kahn-best-villain-kronika-better/\">Mortal Kombat: 5 Reasons Shao Kahn Is The Best Villain (&#38; 5 Why It's Kronika)</a></span></p>\n
