Actors","link":"https://www.cbr.com/brooklyn-nine-nine-star-canadian-version-latina/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/brooklyn-nine-nine.jpg\"/></figure><p><em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/brooklyn-nine-nine/\">Brooklyn Nine-Nine</a></em> star Melissa Fumero has criticized the show's Canadian remake, entitled <em>Escouade 99</em>, for casting white actors as Latina characters.</p><p>\"OMG OMG OMG!! This is like peeking through another dimension,\" Fumero said in her initial quote tweet of the trailer for <em>Escouade 99</em>. \"Gotta day though after watching this... I’m suddenly curious about the Latina population in Quebec. Just sayin,\" Fumero stated in a follow-up tweet.</p><iframe width=\"320\" height=\"320\" frameborder=\"0\" src=\"https://twitter.com/melissafumero/status/1296520183092142080\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe><iframe width=\"320\" height=\"320\" frameborder=\"0\" src=\"https://twitter.com/melissafumero/status/1296521707864207360\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/brooklyn-nine-nine-scraps-season-8-scripts-will-start-over/\">Brooklyn Nine-Nine Scraps Season 8 Scripts, Will ‘Start Over’</a></span></p><p>\"I’ve been thinking about this a lot, and it basically comes down to this,\" Fumero continued in a subsequent tweet. \"While I understand the Latina population is v small in Quebec (&#38; how many of them are funny actors?) the Amy n Rosa roles could’ve gone to ANY BIPOC so it’s disappointing to see that missed opportunity.\"</p><p>Fumero further expanded on her thoughts on <em>Escouade 99</em> by noting, \"Furthermore, I love actors so I do not mean to shame these actresses, it’s not their fault... it’s up to the decision makers. Also, you guyssssss Amy is not sexy ON PURPOSE. So that bums me out too,\" before concluding with a tweet reading, \"<span class=\"css-901oao css-16my406 r-1qd0xha r-ad9z0x r-bcqeeo r-qvutc0\">Lastly, if the show is successful I hope the creators take that opportunity to hire more BIPOC in supporting and guest roles.\"</span></p><iframe width=\"320\" height=\"320\" frameborder=\"0\" src=\"https://twitter.com/melissafumero/status/1296873174563295232\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe><iframe width=\"320\" height=\"320\" frameborder=\"0\" src=\"https://twitter.com/melissafumero/status/1296874008239996928\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe><iframe width=\"320\" height=\"320\" frameborder=\"0\" src=\"https://twitter.com/melissafumero/status/1296875876303298560\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe><p>Fellow Latina <em>Brooklyn Nine-Nine</em> star Stephanie Beatriz responded to Fumero's second tweet with a string of worried-face emojis.</p><iframe width=\"320\" height=\"320\" frameborder=\"0\" src=\"https://twitter.com/iamstephbeatz/status/1296566954233233408\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe><p>Created in 2013 by Dan Goor and Michael Schur, <em>Brooklyn Nine-Nine</em> stars Andy Samberg, Andre Braugher, Stephanie Beatriz, Joe Lo Truglio, Terry Crews, Dirk Blocker and Joel McKinnon Miller. The show will air its eighth season on NBC at a yet-to-be-determined date.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/brooklyn-nine-nine-andy-samberg-retool-police-comedy/\">Brooklyn Nine-Nine: Andy Samberg Is Confident They Can Retool Police Comedy</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 24 Aug 2020 17:58:35 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/brooklyn-nine-nine.jpg","linkMd5":"31f811a54d205727eedf8e8c3f506d6e","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn35@2020_6/2020/08/24/21-43-11-224_73786de4d22ad729.webp","destWidth":1500,"destHeight":750,"sourceBytes":129802,"destBytes":129802,"author":"Douglas Laman","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/brooklyn-nine-nine.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn35@2020_6/2020/08/24/21-43-11-224_73786de4d22ad729.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598305389175},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","title":"Persona 5 Royal Is the Perfect Game for Quarantined Students","link":"https://www.cbr.com/persona-5-royal-is-the-perfect-game-for-quarantined-students/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/persona-5-royal.jpg\"/></figure><p>While 2021's upcoming <em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/shin-megami-tensei-v-release-date-plot-news-so-far/\">Shin Megami Tensei V</a></em> and <em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/shin-megami-tensei-nocturne-dante-meme/\">Nocturne HD</a></em> have stolen the minds of players, a different ATLUS series continues to steal our hearts: <em>Persona</em>. With <em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/persona-5-royal-new-version/\">Persona 5 Royal's</a></em> Western release and <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/persona-4-golden-need-to-know/\"><em>Persona 4 Golden's</em> PC port</a>, there has been plenty of JRPG goodness to go around. While these games have always been incredibly special, PS4's <em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/persona-5/\">Persona 5 Royal</a></em> carries even more weight today.</p><p>With the current COVID-19 pandemic, students around the world are confined. They're forced to take classes online, unable to truly connect with those around them. Remote classes rob students of connection. Remote classes rob students of school's intrinsically important, non-academic aspects. It's impossible to build relationships, explore new places, have new experiences, and grow as a person when all one does at school is click join on a Zoom link. It's an isolating experience. However, there is a way to fill that void from home: <em>Persona 5 Royal</em>.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/past-persona-games-should-release-next-gen/\">After Persona 5, Past Games in the Series Should Come to Next-Gen</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/P5R1.jpg\"/></figure><p>At its core, <em>Persona 5 Royal</em> is a systemically complex Japanese RPG. On the surface, though, it's an engaging life simulator. The game's protagonist and core characters are part-time Phantom Thieves, yes. But, they're also full-time high school students in modern-day Tokyo, Japan. Considering that <em>Persona 5 Royal</em> works on an in-game calendar system where you play out each day of the characters' lives, attending Shujin Academy is a vital part of gameplay. Yet, while you'll sit through classes answering the occasional question, the crux of the life sim gameplay is the high school experience that surrounds the classroom.</p><p>In terms of the <em>Persona</em> experience, activities like chatting with confidants, attending part-time jobs, and exploring Tokyo are all in service of the game's fantastical elements. In a pre-COVID world, everyday occurrences like hanging out with a friend or working at a convenience store in-game form were decidedly milquetoast in a vacuum. The gameplay thrill came from how partaking in these things allowed for success in the Metaverse – more items, stronger Personas, etc. It's a tantalizing dynamic that makes every aspect of the gameplay loop feel important. This is not a pre-COVID world anymore, though.</p><figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/P5R2.jpg\"/></figure><p>While it may seem hyperbolic, the thrill today (to some extent) is inherent to simply existing comfortably in the world. Infiltrating palaces and stealing hearts in Persona's eclectic world continues to be an unforgettable experience. The game's commitment to style and aesthetics makes it one of the loudest, most confidently captivating games on the market. Yet, today, it's hard not to marvel at the most subtle and unintentional things, like a subway train safely filled to standing-room-only without a moment's hesitation.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/how-persona-shin-megami-tensei-are-related/\">How Persona and Shin Megami Tensei Are Related</a></span></p><p>In this sense, <em>Persona 5 Royal</em> is captivating in a fresh way. It allows for a quainter wish-fulfillment: getting to be back in a world that doesn't feel so foreign. Simply strolling around the subway station or exploring the streets of Shibuya is uniquely engaging. While you're able to pass directly through all of Japan's bustling inhabitants (perhaps a vestigial limitation from the game's PS3 roots), this world still feels so alive. It's crawling with people to talk with and things to do.</p><figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/P5R3.jpg\"/></figure><p>It offers the perfect framework for those real-world students studying remotely. The morning trip from Café Leblanc to Shujin Academy offers the adventure which is lost by simply rolling out of bed and hopping into an online class apparatus. The school grounds provide the camaraderie that's lost when sequestered at home. The hours after class offer a sense of unrestrained autonomy. Perhaps you'll head into the city with Ryuji or stop into a café with Ann. Maybe you'll head back to Sojiro's and brew some coffee for the customers. Or, you'll head to a part-time job, earn some yen, and go shopping. Such choices only begin to scratch the surface of the game's social content.</p><p>No game will be able to replace the feeling of actually getting out into the world and learning about yourself. It's a vital part of life. However, it just isn't in the cards for everyone right now. As such, we have to turn to the escapist power of video games to find some avenue to express our longing. There is no better outlet than <em>Persona 5 Royal</em>. With its impeccable writing, robust social systems, and overall polish, getting lost in Tokyo is as magical as ever. These days though, that magic is augmented by our real-world conditions. <em>Persona 5 Royal</em> truly is the game that students need right now.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/next-persona-game-should-be-persona-6/\">The Next Persona Game Should Be Persona 6, Not Another Persona 5 Sequel</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 24 Aug 2020 13:15:50 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/persona-5-royal.jpg","linkMd5":"5df70a90060f0651531819cfb805249a","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn59@2020_5/2020/08/24/21-43-11-293_3fdc317003bb4c45.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":114426,"destBytes":114426,"author":"Abram Buehner","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/persona-5-royal.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn59@2020_5/2020/08/24/21-43-11-293_3fdc317003bb4c45.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/P5R1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn7@2020_4/2020/08/24/21-43-30-043_0165abf8766367a7.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/P5R2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn76@2020_5/2020/08/24/21-43-22-456_605199449e0f0060.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/P5R3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn43@2020_4/2020/08/24/21-43-22-128_c200dc30fde039e0.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598305389184},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","title":"Dragon Ball Z: 5 Villains Android 18 Could Defeat (& 5 She'd Lose To)","link":"https://www.cbr.com/dragon-ball-z-android-18-characters-can-cant-beat/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/21-18-Freiza-Fight.jpg\"/></figure><p>Introduced in arguably the most famous Dragon Ball Z storyline, The Andriod/Cell Saga, Andriod 18 quickly became a fan favorite after establishing herself as one of the most powerful villains and fighters the Z-Fighters had ever seen. Originally as one of the only female warriors in the series, 18 was a powerhouse capable of taking on <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/Piccolo/\">Piccolo</a>, <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/Trunks/\">Mirai Trunks</a>, and even <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/Vegeta/\">Vegeta</a>.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dragon-ball-worst-things-android-18-did/\">Dragon Ball: The 10 Worst Things Andriod 18 Ever Did, Ranked</a></span></p><p>Following <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/Cell/\">Cell's</a> defeat, 18<a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dragon-ball-villains-changed-stayed-bad/\"> turned over a new leaf</a> and allied herself with the Z-Fighters. Though she preferred to stay on the sidelines in subsequent stories (for some reason), 18's pure power never dwindled,  helping <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/Goku/\">Goku</a> win one of his final fights in the series. With an unlimited power supply, 18 could easily trounce several of <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dragon-ball-movie-villains-should-be-canon-stay-out/\">DBZ's villains</a>... but she'd still lose out to some.</p>\n                        <h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">10 </span>Could Beat: Captain Ginyu</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Dragon-Ball-S-Captain-Ginyu.jpg' /></figure><p>Though Ginyu does have his famous \"Body Swap\" technique, he usually saves it as a last resort. Combined with his inability to get a read on 18 quick enough would allow her to kill him before he had a chance.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">9 </span>Would Lose To: Andriod 21</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/android-21.jpg' /></figure><p>Considering that Andriod 18 was powerless against Cell, it's pretty easy to see how she'd lose to 21. Thanks to Buu's DNA, 21 would most likely turn 18 into a sweet and eat her.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">8 </span>Could Beat: Freiza</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/friezaghost-ptess-112757.png' /></figure><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dragon-ball-best-group-fights-in-franchise/\">Dragon Ball: 10 Best Group Fights In The Franchise, Ranked</a></span></p><p>Freiza doesn't possess enough speed to keep up with the Android and has been shown to need time to charge up enough power to destroy a planet. 18's built-in power generator allows her to unleash attacks without exhausting herself, while Freiza would tire himself out.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">7 </span>Would Lose To: Dabura</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/dabura.jpg' /></figure><p>Though 18 had faced beings of similar power beforehand, it's Dabura's magical ability that give him the edge. Most notably, his spit was able to turn people into stone for him to shatter, such as Piccolo. However, unlike the Namekian, 18 did not possess the ability to self to regenerate, making a fight between her and Dabura more fatal.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">6 </span>Could Beat: Andriod 13</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Android-13-1-1-2.jpg' /></figure><p>Though Dr. Gero created both of them, 18 &#38; 13 never meet. 13 was part of Gero's backup plan should 18 and her brother Andriod 17 ever grow hostile, which they did. 13 is programmed by Gero's supercomputer and sent to finish the doctor's revenge on Goku. Though a formidable opponent, 13 would not be a match for 18.</p><p>13 struggled with overwhelming even one Super Sayian; something 18 demonstrated she could do with ease, even fighting two Supers at once.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">5 </span>Would Lose To: Goku Black</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/j5KerC-Cropped.png' /></figure><p>Introduced in <em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/Dragon-Ball-Super/\">Dragon Ball Super</a></em>, Goku Black was an <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dragon-ball-super-goku-black-arc-storyline-explained/\">alternate version of Goku</a>, who had had his body stolen by the Supreme Kai Zamasu. Goku Black retained all of Zamasu's original abilities and intelligence as well as Goku's Saiyan biology and raw power. As a result, he was powerful enough to overwhelm the likes of Vegeta, Trunks, and the original Goku.</p><p>Though 18 is undoubtedly capable of besting Super Saiyans, she would not be powerful enough to overcome a Saiyan's might that's been augmented by the god power of a Kai.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">4 </span>Could Beat: Cooler</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Cooler-1-1-1.jpg' /></figure><p>As Frieza's older brother, Cooler was every bit as strong as him and then some. Aside from having four transformations instead of three, Cooler appears to be more adept at tactical planning. He was able to hide his ki to avoid detection, something Freiza never could do. He's also able to gather energy for attacks much faster. Still, 18 would be able to defeat him swiftly, granted she doesn't toy with him.</p><p>Even with his new \"Golden Cooler\" form, 18 has enough speed to dodge his attacks and wait for him to exhaust himself. Afterward, she'd still be able to go in for the kill.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">3 </span>Would Lose To: Janemba</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Janemba-1-1.jpg' /></figure><p>His powers were so vast that it took the fusion Gogeta to defeat him, making him one of the most powerful <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dragon-ball-super-villainchinese-zodiac/\">villains in DBZ</a>.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">2 </span>Could Beat: Zangya</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Zangya.jpg' /></figure><p>Like her fellow Galaxy Soldiers, Zangya was such a threat to the universe that King Kai had to seal her inside a star. Following his death, Zangya and her companions make their way to Earth after sensing the energy created by The Cell Games. She's able to battle and win against Piccolo, Trunks, and Tien, making her a dangerous threat. With many video games implementing unique dialogue between the women about their mutual attraction to 18's husband, Krillin, a real fight between the two has always piqued fan interest.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dragon-ball-characters-most-least-resurrections/\">Dragon Ball: The Characters With The Most Resurrections, Ranked From Least To Most</a></span></p><p>Zangya was unable to utilize her race's ability to transform, which would have increased her power by a large margin. As a result, 18 would be more than a challenge for her. Though Zangya was demonstrated to be able to outmatch a Super Saiyan, she often was aided by the other members of her gang.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">1 </span>Would Lose To: Baby</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Dragon-Ball-GT-Baby.jpg' /></figure><p>By the time Baby surfaced as a threat, 18 had mostly given up on her fighting days... for some reason. It's worth noting that due to her primarily organic nature, 18 could have continued to grow stronger throughout the series and remain a prominent threat (she just wasn't written that way). Regardless, 18 would have struggled immensely with fighting Baby, a parasite based life form.</p><p>Though she is shown being controlled by the parasite in <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/Dragon-Ball-GT/\"><em>Dragon Ball GT</em></a>, it's not shown whether or not she faced him in battle. Still, the result is pretty clear. Baby can gain all powers of a host he infects, which, combined with his already great innate power, would have largely outclassed 18.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">NEXT: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dragon-ball-towa-characters-defeat/\">Dragon Ball: 5 Characters Towa Can Defeat (&#38; 5 She Can't)</a></span></p>\n                        \n l-GT-Baby.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn56@2020_1/2020/08/24/21-43-23-615_667dc7da72746ed7.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598305389174},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","title":"The Batman Trailer Brings One of His Most Iconic Lines to the Big Screen","link":"https://www.cbr.com/the-batman-teaser-trailer-iconic-line-vengeance/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/batman-trailer-feature.jpg\"/></figure><p>During DC FanDome, Warner Bros. released <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/batman-teaser-trailer-dc-fandome/\">the first teaser trailer</a> for Matt Reeves' upcoming film <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/the-batman/\">The Batman</a>. The movie, which is set outside the DC Extended Universe, will introduce yet another new take on the Caped Crusader, with Robert Pattinson taking over the role from Ben Affleck. <em>The Batman</em> will explore the exploits of a young Bruce Wayne, who will find himself operating in his <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/matt-reeves-batman-film-year-two/\">second year as Gotham City's protector</a>.</p><p>While this Batman will already be established, the character still isn't the experienced crime-fighter he will eventually become. As the first teaser trailer makes clear, <em>The Batman</em>'s Bruce wayne will still be wrestling with the darkness inside of himself and the complications of his crusade. This darkness is perfectly exemplified by the use of an iconic line that finally makes the jump to the big screen.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/the-batman-hbo-max-series-year-one-prequel-matt-reeves/\">The Batman HBO Max Series Is A Year One Prequel To Matt Reeves' Film</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/batman-trailer-joker-gang.jpg\"/></figure><p>In <em>The Batman</em> teaser, Robert Pattinson's Batman is clearly a dark and tormented figure. This Dark Knight is clearly rough around the edges, something that becomes all too clear when, in the trailer, Batman faces what looks to be a <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/the-batman-trailer-suggests-the-joker-is-already-active-in-gotham/\">Joker-inspired street gang</a>. When one of them asks who he's supposed to be, Batman performs one of the greatest live action beat-downs, dealing out both pain and justice with his fists. Then, when he's done and the members of the street gang are left with nothing but terror, he finally answers: \"I'm vengeance.\"</p><p>This iconic line was first used in the <em>Batman: The Animated Series</em> episode \"Nothing to Fear,\" which aired in 1992. In the episode, Batman first went up against the Jonathan Crane/Scarecrow. After getting dosed with the villain's Fear Toxin, Bruce began to experience hallucinations of his father, who called him out for being a disgrace. However, Batman eventually overcame his fear by declaring \"I am vengeance! I am the night! I am Batman!\"</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/twilight-official-twitter-robert-pattinson-batman-approval/\">Twilight's Official Twitter Account Gives Robert Pattinson's Batman The Seal Of Approval</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/batman-trailer-batman2.jpg\"/></figure><p>Since then, the line has become something of a signature for the character, and it has been used in other media. However, its presence in <em>The Batman</em> trailer marks the first time the character has used this line on the big screen -- and it already has fans ecstatic.</p><p>It's not just the line people love. It's that the entire scene perfectly illustrates the identity of this new take on Batman. He's brutal, and he's certainly not playing around. He really is the night.</p><p>The Batman<em> is directed by Matt Reeves and co-written by Reeves and Mattson Tomlin. The film stars Robert Pattinson as Bruce Wayne/Batman, Andy Serkis as Alfred Pennyworth, Jeffrey Wright as James Gordon, Zo<span class=\"itemprop\">ë Kravitz as Selina Kyle/Catwoman, Colin Farrell as Oswald Cobblepot/The Penguin, Paul Dano as Edward Nashton/The Riddler, John Turturro as Carmine Falcone and Peter Sarsgaard as District Attorney Gil Colson. The Batman </span>is set to be released in theaters on Oct. 1, 2021.</em></p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/the-batman-trailer-suggests-the-joker-is-already-active-in-gotham/\">The Batman Trailer Suggests The Joker Is Already Active In Gotham</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 24 Aug 2020 19:45:15 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/batman-trailer-feature.jpg","linkMd5":"0a33bca2635a243386e2919632d1fa88","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn11@2020_2/2020/08/24/21-43-10-934_7b7dc53ac648da8f.webp","destWidth":1200,"destHeight":600,"sourceBytes":44156,"destBytes":44156,"author":"Ian Cardona","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/batman-trailer-feature.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn11@2020_2/2020/08/24/21-43-10-934_7b7dc53ac648da8f.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/batman-trailer-joker-gang.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn8@2020_3/2020/08/24/21-43-27-511_33c7b78682639e9d.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/batman-trailer-batman2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn92@2020_3/2020/08/24/21-43-26-636_42d79c9c6d31678a.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598305389172},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","title":"Superman: Man of Tomorrow's Director on the Importance of Parasite to Clark Kent's Origin","link":"https://www.cbr.com/superman-man-of-tomorrows-director-importance-parasite/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/superman-man-of-tomorrow-header-2.jpg\"/></figure><p>As a retelling of Clark Kent arriving in Metropolis to fulfill his superhero destiny, the animated movie <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/superman-man-of-tomorrow/\"><em>Superman: Man of Tomorrow</em></a> features plenty of major characters in the Man of Steel's vast mythos, including the Kents, Lois Lane and Lex Luthor. It also includes a lesser known villain who plays a prominent role in the film: Parasite, voiced by former <em>Marvel's Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D.</em> star Brett Dalton.</p><p>According to director Chris Palmer, Parasite's role in the film is intended to play up the inherent tragedy of the purple supervillain while providing Clark with another parallel who was viewed and treated as an outsider by the general public, a theme that is also mirrored in supporting characters Martian Manhunter and Lobo.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/batman-long-halloween-two-part-animated-film-confirmed/\">Batman: The Long Halloween - Two-Part Animated Film Adaptation Confirmed</a></span></p><p>\"Parasite at this point... he's always a tragic character, he's definitely a tragic character in this one. I don't give too much away...part of it is damaged, he's damaged coming from a fight with Lobo,\" Palmer tells CBR. \"All this in the film is showing that there's not just Clark, but that there's other aliens living on Earth. There's these other outsiders, and the way that each of them choose to be on Earth is different.\"</p><p>Clark encounters Rudy Jones before his monstrous transformation into the purple-hued, power-sucking villain, and his horrific metamorphosis changes Clark's perspective on what an outsider could be. For the young man who had to grow up concealing his true self from his friends in Smallville, this reveal is especially eye-opening.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/man-of-tomorrow-clip-supermans-first-costume/\">Superman: Man of Tomorrow Clip Reveals Clark Kent's First Costume</a></span></p><p>\"For Parasite, when Clark meets him, he doesn't know [what he is]. At first, he sees something that's another alien to him, something that wants to do harm. And once he figures that he's actually Rudy Jones, whom he had met earlier, and he's this human, there's a little different take on what even Clark thinks is an outsider,\" Palmer explained. \"There's Lobo and Martian Manhunter, who are aliens to Earth, we have Parasite, who is an actual Earthling being treated like an outsider, even though he's from here, as he's changing. It just felt like another side of the coin for what like an outsider feels.\"</p><p>Directed by Chris Palmer, <em>Superman: Man of Tomorrow</em> stars Darren Criss as Clark Kent/Superman, Zachary Quinto as Lex Luthor, Alexandra Daddario as Lois Lane, Ryan Hurst as Lobo, Brett Dalton as Rudy Jones/Parasite, Ike Aamadi as Martian Manhunter, Neil Flynn as Jonathan Kent and Bellamy Young as Martha Kent. The film is available now on digital HD and on Blu-ray and 4K UHD on Sept. 8.</p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 24 Aug 2020 18:06:10 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/superman-man-of-tomorrow-header-2.jpg","linkMd5":"3d5254cc9fcc31ad3767096bdc633a08","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn12@2020_1/2020/08/24/21-43-11-744_0d02f528c9c9cf23.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":102178,"destBytes":102178,"author":"Sam Stone","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/superman-man-of-tomorrow-header-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn12@2020_1/2020/08/24/21-43-11-744_0d02f528c9c9cf23.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598305389175},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","title":"Bleach Creator's Burn the Witch Anime Headed to Crunchyroll This Fall","link":"https://www.cbr.com/bleach-creators-burn-the-witch-anime-crunchyroll/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Burn-The-Witch-anime-header.jpg\"/></figure><p>The world of <em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/bleach/\">Bleach</a> </em>is flying to London this Fall -- courtesy of <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/crunchyroll/\">Crunchyroll</a>.</p><p>The anime brand has announced that Tite Kubo's <em>Burn the Witch</em>, which is <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tite-kubo-burn-the-witch-manga-bleach/\">set in the world</a> of the <em>Shonen Jump </em>series, will arrive exclusively on its streaming service this October. Taking in place in Reverse London, <em>Burn the Witch </em>follows two young witches working for Soul Society's Western Branch. Tatsuro Kawano (<em>Kabaneri of the Iron Fortress</em>) will direct the anime.</p><p>A trailer and an official synopsis from Crunchyroll can be found below.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">Related: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/crunchyroll-expo-the-god-of-high-school-dr-stone-onyx-equinox-noblesse-guests/\">Crunchyroll Expo Adds The God Of High School, Dr. Stone, Onyx Equinox, Noblesse Guests, &#38; More</a></span></p><iframe width=\"480\" height=\"270\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/bJzUi09q4q8?feature=oembed\" frameborder=\"0\" allow=\"accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture\" allowfullscreen></iframe><blockquote><p>Historically 72% of all the deaths in London are related to dragons, fantastical beings invisible to the majority of the people.</p><p>While unknown to most, some people have been standing up to these dragons.</p><p>Only inhabitants of Reverse London who live in the hidden “reverse” side of London can see the dragons. Even then, only a selected few become qualified enough as witches or wizards to make direct contact with them.</p><p>The protagonists of the story are witch duo Noel Niihashi and Ninny Spangcole. They are protection agents for Wing Bind (WB), an organization for dragon conservation and management. Their mission is to protect and manage the dragons within London on behalf of the people.</p></blockquote><p>First published as a one-shot in <em>Weekly Shonen Jump </em>in 2018, it was <a href=\"https://www.newsweek.com/bleach-anime-returns-2021-thousand-year-blood-war-season-1493047\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">announced</a> in March that the <em>Bleach </em>spinoff story was to be expanded into a four-chapter miniseries, alongside the news that an anime adaptation was also in the works. <em>Burn the Witch</em> began serialization in the magazine this month. After publishing the first chapter in English in July, Viz Media began digitally simulpublishing the series on Sunday.</p><p>According to <em><a href=\"https://www.animenewsnetwork.com/news/2020-08-23/burn-the-witch-theatrical-anime-reveals-more-cast-october-2-streaming-debut-worldwide/.163196\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Anime News Network</a></em>, the English-language version of the anime will differ from the version releasing theatrically in Japan on October 2. Rather than a feature-length adaptation, the site, quoting a statement released in Issue #38 of <em>Weekly Shonen Jump</em>, reported that the international release will be \"an edited version where the content will be a little different from the version that will screen [in Japanese theaters].\" Instead, the streamed version will be \"reorganized\" into three episodes.</p><p>The main <em>Bleach </em>anime series is also set to <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/bleach-anime-return-thousand-year-blood-war/\">return next year</a> to adapt the final arc of Kubo's manga, \"The Thousand-Year Blood War,\" coinciding with the franchise's 20th anniversary.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">Keep Reading: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/bleach-captain-tosen-zanpakuto-suzumushi-explained/\">Bleach: Captain Tosen's Bloodless Zanpakuto, Suzumushi, Explained</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 24 Aug 2020 15:11:08 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Burn-The-Witch-anime-header.jpg","linkMd5":"8effc720ed43156cde20cacca6de1000","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn80@2020_3/2020/08/24/21-43-09-340_f54c4416e2cf1226.webp","destWidth":2880,"destHeight":1440,"sourceBytes":89428,"destBytes":89428,"author":"Hannah Collins","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Burn-The-Witch-anime-header.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn80@2020_3/2020/08/24/21-43-09-340_f54c4416e2cf1226.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598305389181},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","title":"Without Peter Parker, Spider-Woman Should Lead Sony's Spider-Verse","link":"https://www.cbr.com/without-peter-parker-spider-woman-lead-sony-spider-verse/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/11/spider-woman-header.jpg\"/></figure><p>It was recently announced that Olivia Wilde had signed on to direct an untitled film for Sony as part of its Marvel Universe. While details regarding the project were sparse, it was implied that the film would be <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/spider-woman-film/\">Spider-Woman</a>, bringing Jessica Drew to the big screen.</p><p>The Sony world of Marvel movies has seemingly redubbed itself the Venomverse. <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/spider-man-film/\">Spider-Man</a> is in the Marvel Cinematic Universe, and <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/venom-film/\">Venom</a> was the next top name in the Sony catalog. However, there might be a better person to lead this shared universe of Marvel films. With the news of the <em>Spider-Woman</em> movie, Sony might have found the perfect character to spearhead Sony's ever-growing franchise.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a class=\"bc-title-link\" title=\"Olivia Wilde Should Also STAR in Spider-Woman as Jessica Drew\" href=\"https://www.cbr.com/olivia-wilde-should-star-spider-woman-jessica-drew/\">Olivia Wilde Should Also STAR In Spider-Woman As Jessica Drew</a></span></p><p>In the best-case scenario, Sony and the MCU could work hand-in-hand with the universe, sharing Peter Parker, but that isn't going to happen. Considering how Sony almost cost the MCU Spider-Man last year, it is time for each studio to find its way to use the characters. Spider-Woman would have been a perfect fit in the MCU, with her connections to Hydra and S.H.I.E.L.D. However, that ship has sailed, but that does not mean all is lost for Jessica Drew.</p><figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/12/spider-woman-jessica-drew.jpg\"/></figure><p>It is time for Sony to see the value it has in <em>Spider-Woman</em>, as this movie could be unlike anything Marvel or DC has put out to date. It took a long time for the studios to trust a female-led superhero movie after the disappointing <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/elektra/\"><em>Elektra</em></a> and <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/catwoman-film/\"><em>Catwoman</em></a>. However, once Warner Bros. pulled the trigger with <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/wonder-woman-film/\"><em>Wonder Woman</em></a>, that film ended up a massive success. Add in both <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/captain-marvel-film/\"><em>Captain Marvel</em></a> and <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/birds-of-prey-film/\"><em>Birds of Prey</em></a>, and it is clear that fans are ready for smart, entertaining female-led superhero movies. With <em>Spider-Woman</em>, Sony could go one step further. They could use a female superhero to lead the entire franchise. Jessica Drew could be Sony's version of Tony Stark.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a class=\"bc-title-link\" title=\"Olivia Wilde to Direct Sony Marvel Film, Rumored to Be Spider-Woman\" href=\"https://www.cbr.com/olivia-wilde-direct-sony-marvel-film-spider-woman/\">Olivia Wilde To Direct Sony Marvel Film, Rumored To Be Spider-Woman</a></span></p><p>The best news is that Sony can play around with her origin story thanks to one of Jessica Drew's key traits from the comic books. Drew doesn't even know her exact history due to the manipulation of her mind as a young woman. An excellent example of what a Spider-Woman movie could look like came with the Netflix series <em>Jessica Jones</em>, who ironically is one of Drew's close friends in the comics. Much like Jones, Spider-Woman is also a private investigator, and that could lead to a great introductory storyline. Drew operates on the West Coast, the same as Venom, so she is in a perfect location to play in the universe Sony already created.</p><figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2018/08/spider-woman-skrull-display.jpg\"/></figure><p>To fit in the character of Jessica Drew, Sony has to ignore Hydra and S.H.I.E.L.D. and go full-on with an origin in the Wundagore Mountain storyline. Her parents were geneticists who accidentally gave their baby superpowers before she is even born. The film could use Wundagore, or better yet, throw Jessica right into the action in San Francisco as a private investigator, hinting at her origin as the <em>Venom</em> movie did for Eddie Brock. Speaking of Brock, using Jessica as a private investigator in California could give her a perfect chance to meet Brock, someone else seeking to expose the truth, if Sony wants its first big crossover.</p><p>The success of a <em>Spider-Woman</em> series could lead to Jessica Drew becoming the poster child for Sony's Marvel world. The film could also open the door for other projects Sony passed on in recent years. Sony had the plans to make a movie called <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/silver-and-black/\"><em>Silver &#38; Black</em></a>, which was supposed to bring in Black Cat and Silver Sable. Both of these characters could show up in Spider-Woman films, and it makes more sense for them to connect with Drew than with Venom.</p><p>If Sony needs a new star for its Marvel Universe, it may have found it in Spider-Woman.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a class=\"bc-title-link\" title=\"Spider-Woman's Secret Origin Is Revealed in Giant-Sized 100th Issue\" href=\"https://www.cbr.com/spider-woman-secret-origin-giant-sized-100th-issue/\">Spider-Woman's Secret Origin Is Revealed In Giant-Sized 100th Issue</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 24 Aug 2020 09:45:09 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/11/spider-woman-header.jpg","linkMd5":"59c0438a09bdbfeae2a513699e4e6bc8","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn84@2020_3/2020/08/24/21-43-09-465_2cb801b2d1ee6f1d.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":177002,"destBytes":177002,"author":"Shawn S. Lealos","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/11/spider-woman-header.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn84@2020_3/2020/08/24/21-43-09-465_2cb801b2d1ee6f1d.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/12/spider-woman-jessica-drew.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn51@2020_3/2020/08/24/21-43-27-951_2592b5d354015425.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2018/08/spider-woman-skrull-display.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn20@2020_3/2020/08/24/21-43-29-353_53f7a22862a63af0.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598305389185},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","title":"5 Summer 2020 Anime That Are Surpassing Our Expectations (& 5 That Should Get Better As The Season Goes On)","link":"https://www.cbr.com/anime-summer-season-surpass-expecations-fell-short/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Summer-Anime-2020.jpg\"/></figure><p>Despite a global pandemic causing a lot of <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/spring-anime-movies-need-more-attention/\">Spring 2020</a> anime to be pushed back into the summer season, Summer 2020 still managed to snag some good anime. From the highly-anticipated manhwa adaption of <em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/god-of-high-school/\">The God of High School </a></em>to the much anticipated second season of <em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/re-zero/\">Re:Zero - Starting Life in Another World</a></em>, there were both fears and expectations that this season held.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/best-80s-manga-my-anime-list/\">10 Best 80s Manga (According to My Anime List)</a></span></p><p>However, now that fans are halfway into Summer 2020, it is time to take a look back on which Summer 2020 anime has surpassed expectations and which ones are expected to get better within the remaining weeks.</p>\n                        <h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">10 </span>SURPASSED EXPECTATIONS: Japan Sinks: 2020</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Japan-Sinks-2020-Family-1.jpg' /></figure><p><em>Japan Sinks: 2020 </em>is one of the best anime to come out this year, and critics and fans alike are sure to agree.</p><p>With a soundtrack by Kensuke Ushio and the unpredictable nature of the series directed by prolific anime director Masaaki Yuasa <em>(The Tatami Galaxy, Keep Your Hands Off Eizouken!,</em> etc.)<em>,</em> <em>Japan Sinks: 2020</em> is a disaster anime that would be best binge-watched with some friends.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">9 </span>SHOULD GET BETTER: Monster Girl Doctor</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/monster-girl-doctor-header.jpg' /></figure><p>To put it lightly,<a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/does-monster-girl-doctor-do-anything-new/\"><em> Monster Girl </em></a><em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/does-monster-girl-doctor-do-anything-new/\">Doctor</a> </em>is interesting. Glenn Leitbeit is a human doctor who treats monster girls because, somehow, he is the only human ー and male doctor, at that ー who can do so. The only other exception is his childhood friend lamia, Saphentite Neikes.</p><p>Other than that? Nothing. Glenn treats a monster girl, something sexual or a sexually charged misunderstanding happens, and Saphentite becomes upset because she is obviously in love with him. It would be best to go back and watch <em>Daily Life with Monster Girls </em>for some monster-girl themed ecchi instead.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">8 </span>SURPASSED EXPECTATIONS: Rent-A-Girlfriend</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/The-Girls-Of-Rent-A-Girlfriend.jpg' /></figure><p><em>Rent-A-Girlfriend </em>looks exactly what it sounds like ー a college boy is dumped by his girlfriend and to appease his loneliness, he decides to rent a girlfriend. While <em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/rent-a-girlfriend/\">Rent-A-Girlfriend</a></em> gives fans exactly what they want and expected from the title, it also manages to break the mold of the raunchy romantic comedy and <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/best-romance-anime-2020-so-far/\">have substance.</a></p><p>With Mami, his ex-girlfriend, appearing to be into NTR (netorare, or cuckolding)<strong> </strong>and Kazuya wavering between her and Chizuru, what more could one ask for in a series?And this doesn't even mention the other girlfriends and what they have to offer.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">7 </span>SHOULD GET BETTER: No Guns No Life 2nd Season</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/4-No-Guns-Life.jpg' /></figure><p>On paper, <em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/no-guns-life/\">No Guns Life</a> </em>was a crazy anime idea that had just enough of a plot to make fans want to watch it right away. With the main character, Juzo Inui, literally having a gun for a head and the anime's unique cyberpunk aesthetics and setting, it was a great watch when it first debuted.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\"> RELATED: <a class=\"bc-title-link\" title=\"Every Character In The No Guns Life Intro (And Who They Are)\" href=\"https://www.cbr.com/no-guns-life-intro-every-character/\">Every Character In The No Guns Life Intro (And Who They Are)</a></span></p><p>However, the series is lackluster in its second half, with the culprit being the horrid pacing and the use of obvious CGI in the background. It would be best to sit this one out, fans.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">6 </span>SURPASSED EXPECTATIONS: Re:Zero - Starting Life In Another World 2nd Season</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/12/7-re-zero.jpg' /></figure><p>After quite the wait, <em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/Re:Zero/\">Re:Zero - Starting Life in Another World</a> </em>returns just when fans thought they would never see it again. Of course, Subaru continuous to be <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/rezero-season-2-episode-6-always-get-worse-subaru/\">tortured</a> by this new world, and new enemies are abound in this season filled to the brim with psychological tricks as well as literal blood, sweat, and tears.</p><p>Fans were afraid that the new season would not pack as much as a punch as it did back in 2016, but that was thankfully not the case. The series retains its reign in the hearts of fans, keeping them at the edge of their seats with each passing episode.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">5 </span>SHOULD GET BETTER: My Teen Romantic Comedy SNAFU Climax</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/my-teen-romantic-comedy-snafu.jpg' /></figure><p><em>My Teen Romantic Comedy SNAFU </em>picks up from where the <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/my-teen-romantic-comedy-snafu-climax-episode-1/\">second season</a> leaves fans. And, boy, were fans amped up for this wonderful, yet bittersweet, romance anime.</p><p>While fans could not contain their excitement to see savaged protagonist Hachima, ice-cold Yukino, and pure-hearted Yui together again, <em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/my-teen-romantic-comedy-snafu/\">My Teen Romantic Comedy SNAFU Climax</a> </em>is the kind of anime that requires a build-up to reach its ultimate (well) climax. Fans can expect smiles, but more than above else, <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/my-teen-romantic-comedy-snafu-climax-episode-2/\">tears</a> for the sad nature of this season.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">4 </span>SURPASSED EXPECTATIONS: Sword Art Online: Alicization - War Of Underworld 2nd Season</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Sword-Art-Online-Alicization-War-of-Underworld.jpg' /></figure><p>When fans heard the second part of <em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/sword-art-online/\">Sword Art Online: Alicization</a> </em>would be coming in 2020, some had lukewarm reactions, as they have been waiting for Kirito's awakening since 2018.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/sword-art-online-similar-anime-worth-watching/\">15 Anime To Watch If You Love Sword Art Online</a></span></p><p>However, when <em>Sword Art Online: War of Underworld </em>made its way to the airwaves once again, even the most jaded of fans could not deny the hype surrounding the series, especially with the glorious opening fight with <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/sword-art-online-alicization-episode-14-bercouli-death/\">Bercouli and Gabriel.</a> It is safe to say the latest entry in the <em>Sword Art Online </em>franchise has surpassed initial doubt and haters.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">3 </span>SHOULD GET BETTER: The God Of High School</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/god-of-high-school-header.jpg' /></figure><p><em>The God of High School </em>paved its way for one of the best fighting anime with its debut episode, but one complaint fans have talked about is the pacing and the lack of an actual story.</p><p>While the most pivotal part of the anime is how it is basically a series-long tournament arc all the way through, the story takes a backseat to the point where it feels like entire arcs were crammed into a single episode. The story is sure to be included in the later episodes... at least according to the manhwa readers. For now, <em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/god-of-high-school/\">The God of High School </a></em>fans are enjoying the fights and the characters' interactions.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">2 </span>SURPASSED EXPECTATIONS: The Misfit Of Demon Academy</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/misfits-of-demon-academy.jpg' /></figure><p><em>The Misfit of </em><em>Demon Academy </em>was said to be another boring isekai anime starring yet another overpowered protagonist in a transparent wish-fulfillment story. But while <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/the-misfit-of-demon-king-academy-authenticity-fakery/\">Anos</a> is definitely overpowered ー as he is the reincarnated demon king ー the anime actually runs with it, which makes it excellent.</p><p>Anos is also a rare <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/why-so-many-isekai-protagonists-are-the-same/\">isekai protagonist</a> that appears different from the other isekai heroes, and he does not have a harem ー at least yet ー and he seems to know what kind of story he's in. The matter-of-fact way that <em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/the-misfit-of-demon-king-academy/\">The Misfit of Demon Academy</a></em> flaunts its isekai-ness is refreshing, with non-fans of isekai and fantasy alike loving it.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">1 </span>SHOULD GET BETTER: Fire Force 2nd Season</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Fire-Force.jpg' /></figure><p>The previous season of <em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/fire-force/\">Fire Force</a> </em>garnered fans who fell for the beautiful animation and exciting fights, but how does it hold up in the second half? Fairy well, it seems, with the fights only getting better as the series progresses.</p><p>Also, with less <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/fire-forces-season-one-sexualized-violence/\">Tamaki losing her clothes</a> and becoming a proper character this time around, the anime is at a turning point where it focuses more on the story of Shinra and the fights. This can only means that <em>Fire Force </em>will become better from here on out.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">NEXT: <a class=\"bc-title-link\" title=\"Summer Anime You Should Stick With (and Ones You Can Skip)\" href=\"https://www.cbr.com/summer-anime-2020-best-worst/\">Summer Anime You Should Stick With (And Ones You Can Skip)</a></span></p>\n                        \n Albert","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Summer-Anime-2020.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn40@2020_2/2020/08/24/21-43-11-249_2e49f6060619a7ba.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Japan-Sinks-2020-Family-1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn59@2020_1/2020/08/24/21-43-25-486_7c500bc89e3ccb12.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/monster-girl-doctor-header.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn35@2020_2/2020/08/24/21-43-31-161_eb5eaa73868f3f3c.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/The-Girls-Of-Rent-A-Girlfriend.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn52@2020_3/2020/08/24/21-43-23-582_526a905f4e2e4819.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/4-No-Guns-Life.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn39@2020_1/2020/08/24/21-43-27-890_92f7d8de9f9b096e.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/12/7-re-zero.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn60@2020_3/2020/08/24/21-43-32-471_e55a05bf4f116289.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/my-teen-romantic-comedy-snafu.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn88@2020_2/2020/08/24/21-43-21-103_b8b353c1dd4fa57a.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Sword-Art-Online-Alicization-War-of-Underworld.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn23@2020_2/2020/08/24/21-43-22-094_1b69cdfe826fd9c1.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/god-of-high-school-header.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn67@2020_6/2020/08/24/21-43-25-526_9144809e0df09175.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/misfits-of-demon-academy.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn8@2020_3/2020/08/24/21-43-28-353_6c720a80d850048a.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Fire-Force.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn32@2020_6/2020/08/24/21-43-22-258_d3120d00ac3a21f1.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598305389184},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","title":"Amazon Teams With Dark Horse to Release comiXology Digital Originals in Print","link":"https://www.cbr.com/amazon-dark-horse-team-to-print-comixology-originals/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/black-ghost-header.jpg\"/></figure><p><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/dark-horse-comics/\">Dark Horse Comics</a> is teaming up with the Amazon-owned <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/comixology/\">comiXology</a> to bring the latter's comiXology Originals titles to print for the very first time.</p><p>Dark Horse's official press release is below:</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a class=\"bc-title-link\" title=\"Aliens: Dark Horse's Original Comics Collected in New Marvel Omnibus\" href=\"https://www.cbr.com/marvel-dark-horse-aliens-omnibus-vol-1-april-2021/\">Aliens: Dark Horse's Original Comics Collected In New Marvel Omnibus</a></span></p><p><em><strong>August 24, 2020 – New York, NY / Portland, OR</strong> – Dark Horse Comics, the legendary comic book publisher of titles including Black Hammer, Hellboy, Sin City and The Umbrella Academy, and comiXology, the world’s premier digital comics service, are announcing that Dark Horse will distribute print editions of comiXology Originals graphic novels and collections. Select titles from the creator-owned line of comiXology Originals will be available in print for the first time for customers in comic shops, bookstores, and libraries. The program will commence in Spring 2021 with the release of paperback editions of the Eisner Award winner AFTERLIFT, Breaklands, YOUTH, and The Black Ghost.</em></p><p><em>\"The ComiXology Originals line is of the highest quality and diverse in its storytelling and talent,\" said Dark Horse publisher and CEO Mike Richardson. \"ComiXology’s line of creator-owned comics sits perfectly alongside the acclaimed creator-owned graphic novels that are the bedrock of Dark Horse Comics.\"</em></p><p><em>\"We were always hopeful comiXology Originals books would get into readers’ hands via comics retailers and book stores, and Dark Horse is a terrific collaborator to work with to do so, with an unmatched history of supporting creator-owned projects alongside unmatched distribution expertise. This deal fortifies the ability for these stories to reach customers like never before,\" said David Steinberger, comiXology Co-Founder and CEO. \"We’re thrilled to be working with Dark Horse.\"</em></p><p><em>Through this deal, Dark Horse Comics will be responsible for distribution and fulfillment for the titles through Diamond Comic Distributors for comic shops and Penguin Random House for bookstores around the world. ComiXology Originals will remain available to be read digitally for members of Amazon Prime, Kindle Unlimited, and comiXology Unlimited and for purchase on Kindle and comiXology.</em></p><p><em>ComiXology Originals' exclusive content line debuted in 2017, and in their first year garnered an Eisner Award for Harvey Kurtzman’s Marley’s Ghost. The next year saw an Eisner Award nomination for The Stone King by Kel McDonald and Tyler Crook, and in 2020 an Eisner Award win for AFTERLIFT. In addition to the creator-owned line of exclusive content, comiXology Originals, through a partnership with Kodansha Comics, has re-released and newly translated manga such as BECK, Initial D and The Drops of God.</em></p><p><em>The comiXology Originals making their print debut in 2021 include:</em></p><p><em>AFTERLIFT, collecting the Eisner Award-winning issues #1-5 <strong>– </strong>For the first time in print!</em></p><ul><li><em>Written by Eisner Award winner Chip Zdarsky, best known for his work on Sex Criminals and Marvel Comics, with art by Jason Loo, the acclaimed artist of The Pitiful Human-Lizard, colors by Paris Alleyne, letters by Aditya Bidikar and edited by Allison O’Toole.</em></li><li><em>AFTERLIFT is a 2020 Eisner Award winning series.</em></li><li><em>In AFTERLIFT, Janice Chen is adrift. She quits her day job in finance and signs up to be a driver on a ride-sharing app. But what was at first a mundane but enjoyable way to pass the time takes a terrible turn when a mysterious passenger updates his ride with a very final destination: Hell.</em></li><li><em>136 pages / color / on sale February 2 in bookstores and everywhere books are sold and February 3 in comic shops / MSRP $19.99/$25.99 pbk / ISBN: 978-1-5067-2440-9</em></li></ul><p><em>Breaklands Volume One, collecting issues #1-5 <strong>– </strong>For the first time in print!</em></p><ul><li><em>Written by Justin Jordan, the co-creator and writer of The Strange Talent of Luther Strode, with art by acclaimed artist Tyasseta, colors by Sarah Stern, and letters by Rachel Deering.</em></li><li><em>Set 150 years after humanity developed psychic powers and ended the world as we know it, a new world has emerged. Everyone has powers. Some powers, like the ability to light a match, are modest. But some powers—like the ability to reshape the world—are both vast and dangerous. Kasa Fain is different. She doesn’t possess powers. Kasa is an outsider, a teenager who has been in hiding, until the day her younger brother is kidnapped and everything changes.</em></li><li><em>152 pages / color / on sale March 2 in bookstores and everywhere books are sold and March 3 in comic shops / MSRP $19.99/$25.99 pbk / ISBN: 978-1-5067-2441-6</em></li></ul><p><em>YOUTH Volume One, collecting issues #1-4<strong>–</strong>For the first time in print!</em></p><ul><li><em>Written by visionary writer Curt Pires with art by Alex Diotto, the co-creators of the acclaimed comic Olympia, and features colors by Dee Cunniffe, and lettering by Micah Myers.</em></li><li><em>In YOUTH, Franklin and River struggle to navigate family, friends, high school, work, drugs, and all the pressures of growing up. As a queer couple, they yearn to escape their lives in a small, bigoted Midwest town. They steal River’s stepfather’s Mustang and hit the road. Their destination? California. But along the way, the car breaks down. They meet some kids who are travelling the country, partying, and attempting to find themselves. They party some more. . . . And soon everything changes.</em></li><li><em>A sequel to YOUTH is underway and the comic series is in development as an original TV show with Amazon Studios.</em></li><li><em>136 pages / color / on sale on sale April 6 in bookstores and everywhere books are sold and April 7 in comic shops / MSRP $19.99/$25.99 pbk / ISBN: 978-1-5067-2461-4</em></li></ul><p><em>The Black Ghost Volume One, collecting issues #1-5–For the first time in print!</em></p><ul><li><em>Co-written by Anthony Award-Nominated Novelist Alex Segura and acclaimed writer Monica Gallagher, with art by George Kambadais, colors by Ellie Wright, lettering by Taylor Esposito and edited by Greg Lockard.</em></li><li><em>The Black Ghost is a modern take on the urban vigilante story. Lara Dominguez is a journalist chasing that one, big story. After a stint in the Middle East, the alcoholic reporter moves from her hometown of Miami to Creighton – a mid-Atlantic city that’s seen better days. She needs a huge, viral scoop that’ll send her into the journalistic stratosphere. Her target? Uncovering the identity of The Black Ghost – a masked vigilante trying to take down the wealthy oligarchs carving up the fading metropolis. But as she searches for the breakthrough story she desperately needs, Lara will have to navigate the corruption of her adopted city, the uncertainties of virtue, and her own personal demons.</em></li><li><em>136 pages / color / on sale May 4 in bookstores and everywhere books are sold and May 5 in comic shops / MSRP $19.99/$25.99 pbk / ISBN: 978-1-50672-446-1</em></li></ul><p><em>More comiXology Originals print editions will be announced at a later date.</em></p><p><em>\"These are high caliber comics that will resonate not only in the comic shop stores and bookstores, but also with libraries across the country,\" said Mark Bernardi, Vice President of Book Trade and Digital Sales at Dark Horse Comics.</em></p><p><em>\"Today’s announcement is a game changer,\" said Chip Mosher, Head of Content for comiXology Originals. \"The team at Dark Horse Comics provides tremendous resources and a path for readers everywhere to discover comiXology Originals.\"</em></p><p><em>For more updates on comiXology Originals, check out <a href=\"http://comixologyoriginals.com/\">http://comixologyoriginals.com</a> and follow comiXology on <a href=\"https://twitter.com/comiXology\">Twitter</a>, <a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/comixology/\">Facebook</a> and <a in 2019\" href=\"https://www.cbr.com/2019-comic-book-sales-record-high/\">Comic Book Sales Recorded An All-Time High In 2019</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 24 Aug 2020 18:18:13 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/black-ghost-header.jpg","linkMd5":"fbf083f6f35569a95d1fda9fd9497f7f","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn40@2020_2/2020/08/24/21-43-12-222_374f64dd5fca274a.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":46776,"destBytes":42896,"author":"Jon Arvedon","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/black-ghost-header.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn40@2020_2/2020/08/24/21-43-12-222_374f64dd5fca274a.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598305389175},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","title":"Captain Marvel Nearly Had Winter Soldier-Level Fights - So Why Didn’t It?","link":"https://www.cbr.com/captain-marvel-amazing-fight-sequences-not-included-final-film/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/captain-marvel-1.jpg\"/></figure><p>Brie Larson's stunt double in <em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/captain-marvel-film/\">Captain Marvel</a></em>, Joanna Bennett, recently released <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/captain-marvel-stunt-concept-bts-video/\">an extended video showing the concept fight scenes</a> the film's stunt team worked on prior to the start of production. These sequences were filmed with no costumes or sets, just the stunt performers showing what Captain Marvel fighting could look like -- and the results are nothing short of astonishing.</p><p>Bennett leaps across the screen, demonstrating calculated brutality and efficiency while she takes on a litany of enemies. There's also plenty of wire work, which allows her to perform amazing stunts. The inventive choreography also adds Carol's signature photon blasts to create some truly epic moments. And yet, none of those fights made it into the film. But why?</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/captain-marvel-concept-3d-model-costume/\">Captain Marvel Concept Artist Shares First 3D Model For Carol's Costume</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/captain-marvel-train.png\"/></figure><p>With a global box-office total of more than $1.1 billion,<em> Captain Marvel</em> us among Marvel Studios' highest-grossing films, and it, of course, has plenty of strengths. Nevertheless, there are fans who were disappointed because it didn't create a particular spark for Carol Danvers. After all, the hero is supposed to be the next leader of Earth's Mightiest Heroes following the events of <em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/avengers-4/\">Avengers: Endgame</a></em>, but some argue her theatrical debut didn't provide enough substance for Captain Marvel to stand out in a major, character-defining way.</p><p>In that regard, the film could be compared to <em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/captain-america-the-first-avenger/\">Captain America: The First Avenger</a></em>, which drew similar complaints about Steve Rogers. However, those doubts were all but put to rest with the release of <em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/captain-america-the-winter-soldier/\">Captain America: The Winter Soldier</a></em>, which massively changed the character. In the sequel, Captain America adopted a new fighting style that cemented him as a powerhouse, and that, coupled with strong characterization, made Steve Rogers a fan favorite who would go on to rival Tony Stark as the most popular Avenger.</p><figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2018/01/IMG-2115.jpg\"/></figure><p>And now, Bennet's stunt video showcasing what Captain Marvel <em>could</em> have delivered in her cinematic debut reveals the action scenes that might have rivaled those in <em>The Winter Soldier</em>. The video demonstrates why Carol Danvers is a force to be reckoned with -- not only because of raw power, but because of her skills. The footage gives Carol a defined fighting style, which perfectly complements her military background.</p><p>A character isn't defined simply by action scenes, of course, but they certainly help. It's par for the course in Marvel's films, after all, which have given us some fan-favorite fights, such as Captain America's assault on the Lemurian Star or Thor's lightning-fueled attack on Hela's forces on the Bifrost.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/captain-marvel-original-script-killed-talos/\">Captain Marvel's Original Script Killed Off a Major Hero</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/captain-marvel-power.jpg\"/></figure><p>Unfortunately, for whatever reason, the dynamic fight scenes by Bennett and  <em>Captain Marvel</em>'s stunt team didn't make it into the final product. That's a shame, considering the fight sequences in <em>Captain Marvel</em> are mostly forgettable (save for when Carol goes Super Saiyan on a fleet of Kree ships).</p><p>Who knows, if <em>Captain Marvel</em> did include these concept fight scenes, perhaps fans would love the character even more, and there would be even more excitement for her leading a new incarnation of the Avengers. Hopefully, <em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/captain-marvel-2/\">Captain Marvel 2</a></em> will accomplish what <em>The Winter Soldier</em> did for Captain America by allowing the character to shine even more -- not only because of her powers, but because of who she is.</p><p><em>Directed by Anna Boden and Ryan Fleck, </em>Captain Marvel<em> stars Brie Larson, Samuel L. Jackson, Jude Law, Clark Gregg, Lee Pace, Djimon Hounsou, Gemma Chan, Ben Mendelsohn, Lashana Lynch and Algenis Perez Soto, with Annette Bening as the Supreme Intelligence. The film is now available on Digital HD, Blu-ray and 4K UHD and is streaming on Disney+.</em></p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/captain-marvel-strongest-avenger-has-her-weaknesses/\">Captain Marvel: Even The Strongest Avenger Has Her Weaknesses</a></span></p>\n                        \n
