05:43:09","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","title":"The Suicide Squad: James Gunn Unveils Logo-Filled Poster for DC Film","link":"https://www.cbr.com/the-suicide-squad-james-gunn-logo-filled-poster/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/The-Suicide-Squad-Character-Logo-Poster.jpg\"/></figure><p>Director James Gunn revealed a splashy new poster featuring logos for the zany cast of characters set to appear in his upcoming DC film <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/suicide-squad-2\">The Suicide Squad</a>.</p><p>Following the DC FanDome event, at which Gunn treated fans to <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dc-fandome-every-trailer-teaser-released-event/\">an sneak peek</a> at The Suicide Squad and revealed its sizable cast of characters, the director shared a poster featuring all of those characters' stylized logos to <a href=\"https://twitter.com/JamesGunn/status/1297588419959259136?s=20\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Twitter</a>. \"#DCFanDome is over, but #TheSuicideSquad lives on… at least until a good amount of them get massacred in August 2021,\" Gunn wrote. \"I can't tell you guys how moved &#38; grateful I am by all your support &#38; compliments yesterday. Thank you!\"</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/the-suicide-squad-james-gunn-king-shark-actor-other-dc-role-film/\">The Suicide Squad: James Gunn Reveals King Shark Actor's Other DC Role in the Film</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/EgH1eKAU0AAHi3M.jpg\"/></figure><p>Thanking his highly passionate fan base is a standard trait for the director, but Gunn's declaration that a good amount of <em>The Suicide Squad</em>'s characters will end up dead before the end is quite the promise. Though, given the title attributed to the offbeat team, Gunn's announcement may not be met with much perplexity. Still, Gunn's affirmation sets up an expectation for a high body count, something fans noticed 2016's <em>Suicide Squad</em> was short on, as the only core members of that film's version of the team to bite the dust were El Diablo and Slipknot.</p><p>Written and directed by James Gunn, The Suicide Squad stars Viola Davis as Amanda Waller, Joel Kinnaman as Rick Flagg, Michael Rooker as Savant, Flula Borg as Javelin, David Dastmalchian, as Polka-Dot Man, Margot Robbie as Harley Quinn, Daniela Melchior as Ratcatcher, Idris Elba as Bloodsport, Mayling NG as Mongal, Peter Capaldi as The Thinker, Alice Braga as Solsoria, Steve Agee as King Shark, Pete Davidson as Blackguard, Nathan Fillion as TDK, Sean Gunn as Weasel, Jai Courtney as Captain Boomerang, John Cena as Peacemaker, Taika Waititi and Storm Reid. The film arrives in theaters Aug. 6, 2021.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/james-gunn-favorite-batman-villain-the-suicide-squad/\">James Gunn's Favorite Batman Villain Will NOT Be in The Suicide Squad</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 24 Aug 2020 13:20:29 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/The-Suicide-Squad-Character-Logo-Poster.jpg","linkMd5":"593bcccb8d7760546b82fb7bf79be420","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn75@2020_1/2020/08/24/21-43-09-312_46b6b31ae29acd07.webp","destWidth":1200,"destHeight":600,"sourceBytes":103562,"destBytes":103562,"author":"Andrew Cavalluzzi","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/The-Suicide-Squad-Character-Logo-Poster.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn75@2020_1/2020/08/24/21-43-09-312_46b6b31ae29acd07.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/EgH1eKAU0AAHi3M.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn11@2020_5/2020/08/24/21-43-21-180_d8b93712d8c3ccf5.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598305389184},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","title":"Walking Dead Creator Robert Kirkman Confirms Comic Easter Egg 15 Years in the Making","link":"https://www.cbr.com/walking-dead-kirkman-connecting-tpb-cover-easter-egg-confirmed/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Walking-Dead-Days-Gone-Bye-Header.png\"/></figure><p><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/the-walking-dead/\">The Walking Dead</a> writer and co-creator Robert Kirkman has confirmed a sneaky connection 15 years in the making between the Image Comics series' first collected edition from 2004 -- <em>Days Gone Bye</em> -- and its final one from 2019 -- <em>Rest In Peace</em>.</p><p>The covers of the various collected volumes of <em>The Walking Dead</em> all feature a group of zombies walking towards the viewer in the foreground, with each cover connecting to the last to create one massive horde of the undead -- as one fan <a href=\"https://twitter.com/nytryan/status/1293173011521122305?s=20\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">pointed out</a> in a Twitter thread discussing connecting covers in comics. This prompted <a href=\"https://twitter.com/nytryan/status/1297530563771981825?s=20\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">another fan</a> to look at their copy of <em>The Walking Dead</em> Vol. 32 to see if it connected back to Vol. 1 to bring the piece full circle. Sure enough, it did, creating what the fan describes as \"an endless zombie loop spanning 15 years of art.\"</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/kirkman-announces-walking-dead-series-color-extra-content/\">Walking Dead Creator Announces Full-Series Color Re-Issue, With Extra Content</a></span></p><p><em>The Walking Dead</em>'s creator himself commented on the discovery, <a href=\"https://twitter.com/RobertKirkman/status/1297553250594353152?s=20\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">quote-tweeting</a> the post. \"You may actually be the first to notice this,\" Kirkman wrote. \"I was always wondering when someone would. Nice work!\"</p><iframe width=\"320\" height=\"320\" frameborder=\"0\" src=\"https://twitter.com/RobertKirkman/status/1297553250594353152?s=20\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe><p>Created by Kirkman alongside artist Tony Moore, <em>The Walking Dead</em> released its very first issue in October of 2003. The first trade paperback, <em>Days Gone Bye</em> -- which collects the series' first six issues -- hit shelves several months later in May of 2004. <em>The Walking Dead</em> officially came to an end in July of 2019 with the release of issue #193 by Kirkman and Charlie Adlard. The final TPB, <em>Rest In Peace</em> -- collecting the series' last seven issues -- arrived one month later in August.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/walking-dead-robert-kirkman-charlie-adlard-negan-survives/\">Walking Dead: Kirkman Tells Negan Fans to Thank Adlard for His Survival</a></span></p><p>Of course, Kirkman, Moore and Adlard's <em>The Walking Dead</em> inspired the television series of the same name, which premiered on AMC in 2010. AMC's <em>The Walking Dead</em> is currently in the midst of a hiatus brought about by the current real-life global health crisis, with the series officially set to return for its Season 10 finale in October, followed by bonus Season 10 episodes next year. <em>TWD</em> has already been renewed for Season 11.</p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 24 Aug 2020 03:16:56 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Walking-Dead-Days-Gone-Bye-Header.png","linkMd5":"c943f589a0cb819c26f75d3c11ecc2df","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn91@2020_1/2020/08/24/21-43-10-637_0f568bd722d251a0.webp","destWidth":1200,"destHeight":600,"sourceBytes":638722,"destBytes":638722,"author":"Noah Dominguez","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Walking-Dead-Days-Gone-Bye-Header.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn91@2020_1/2020/08/24/21-43-10-637_0f568bd722d251a0.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598305389186},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","title":"Justice League: The Snyder Cut's Trailer Holds A Devious Joker Easter Egg","link":"https://www.cbr.com/justice-league-snyder-cut-trailer-joker-easter-egg/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/joker-justice-league-header.jpg\"/></figure><p>The <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/zack-snyder-justice-league-trailer-darkseid-shocking-death/\">first trailer</a> for <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/justice-league-film/\">Zack Snyder's Justice League</a> paints a bleak picture, opening with Darkseid's intimidating debut, Superman's brutal death and then going straight into the smouldering wreckage of the fallen Hall of Justice. This particular scene, of course, is from Snyder's Knightmare sequence, which was a glimpse of the future where Darkseid won and the forces of Apokolips overran Earth. However, in this expanded version of Earth's future, there's a devious Joker Easter egg that links to Batman's role as an aggressive hunter in this warped timeline.</p><p>In the Knightmare sequence, Bruce hunted Parademons and other soldiers who submitted to Darkseid and the Anti-Life Equation. At 0:15 in the trailer, the Omega symbol is burned into the ground, but amid the debris and warships scorching the terrain, a Joker card floats on the air. It's the Clown Prince of Crime's signature card.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/zack-snyder-claps-back-justice-league-trailer-critique/\">Zack Snyder Claps Back at Justice League Trailer Critique: 'This is Made for Grownups'</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Batman-V-Superman-Knightmare-Zack-Snyder.jpg\"/></figure><p>Toys for <em>Justice League </em>as well as 2016's <em>Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice </em>made clear the Dark Knight actually had this <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/batman-v-superman-every-easter-egg-and-reference/\">card taped to the butt</a> of his gun during this period of being a freedom fighter and resistance leader. The technical and/or functional purpose of the card isn't known, but it's likely just a simple Easter egg, though potentially one that plays into when Joker spray painted the <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/zack-snyder-robin-dceu-joker-killed/\">dead Robin's suit</a> in the DC Extended Universe. That said, Batman could be carrying the card as a motivator to stop the next threat, in this case the <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/15-darkest-versions-of-superman/\">corrupted Superman</a>.</p><p>As for the card's origin, it's not clear if the one shown in the trailer is the same one Bruce keeps as a memento or if it's just a piece of debris. There's also a theory Superman could have killed the Joker <em>Injustice</em>-style to stem crime the way Batman never could, so it's possible Bruce is keeping this as a reminder of how far the Kryptonian went.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/justice-league-snyder-cut-trailer-music-watchmen-hallelujah/\">Justice League Snyder Cut Trailer Calls Back to the Director's Most Controversial Musical Choice</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/2-Joker-Card-in-Zack-Snyders-Justice-League-compared-with-the-card-taped-to-Knightmare-Batmans-rifle.jpg\"/></figure><p>Ultimately, it's nice to see Joker getting some airtime, because he wasn't in the Snyder/Joss Whedon version of <em>Justice League</em> that released in 2017. This quick cameo, though, keeps the evil, sadistic clown alive in some way, even in the darkest of timelines.</p><p><em>Justice League stars Ben Affleck as Batman, Gal Gadot as Wonder Woman, Henry Cavill as Superman, Amy Adams as Lois Lane, Jason Momoa as Aquaman, Ezra Miller as The Flash, Ray Fisher as Cyborg, Jeremy Irons as Alfred Pennyworth, Diane Lane as Martha Kent, Ciarán Hinds as Steppenwolf, Jesse Eisenberg as Lex Luthor and J.K. Simmons as Commissioner Gordon. Zack Snyder's Justice League will premiere exclusively on HBO Max in 2021.</em></p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/justice-league-snyder-cut-trailer-silas-stone-death/\">The Justice League Snyder Cut Trailer Straight-Up Spoils a Character Death</a></span></p>\n                        \n Matadeen","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/joker-justice-league-header.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn55@2020_1/2020/08/24/21-43-09-393_ed822db213ad6301.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Batman-V-Superman-Knightmare-Zack-Snyder.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn80@2020_1/2020/08/24/21-43-30-677_012fd80e35c20371.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/2-Joker-Card-in-Zack-Snyders-Justice-League-compared-with-the-card-taped-to-Knightmare-Batmans-rifle.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn32@2020_4/2020/08/24/21-43-31-198_9801d14b7ae323aa.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598305389173},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","title":"Renee Young Issues Statement on WWE Departure, Reclaims Her Real Name","link":"https://www.cbr.com/wwe-renee-young-statement-on-departure/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/renee-young-header.jpg\"/></figure><p class=\"body-text\"><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/wwe/\">WWE</a> commentator and <em>Backstage</em> host Renee Young has confirmed she’s leaving after nearly eight years of working with the company.</p><p class=\"body-text\">\"I am so excited to be here doing my last hurrah in WWE,\" Young said Sunday, Aug. 23 <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/wwe-blew-opportunity-post-summerslam-ppv/\">during <em>SummerSlam</em></a>. \"I'd be no other place than here at <em>SummerSlam</em> with this beautiful panel in the ThunderDome!\"</p><iframe width=\"320\" height=\"320\" frameborder=\"0\" src=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/CEROxp6jewt/\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/renee-young-leaving-wwe/\">REPORT: Renee Young Is Leaving the WWE</a></span></p><p class=\"body-text\">She also gave an extended farewell in a lengthy Instagram post, writing, \"This November would mark 8 years in WWE. 8 years!! An opportunity of a lifetime with a global company to learn, grow, make history and do things beyond my wildest dreams before I left Toronto for this adventure. I made friends, family -- literally family -- I met my husband here (what a fucking dreamboat) and people that will be a part of my life forever.\"</p><p class=\"body-text\">Young went on to list a number of her accomplishments while working for WWE, which included being the first woman to sit at the commentary desk full time on <em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/wwe-monday-night-raw-modern-nation-of-domination/\">Raw</a></em>, calling <em>WrestleMania</em> and anchoring <em>WWE Backstage</em> on Fox Sports. She also noted that she will be going back to using her birth name Renee Paquette professionally.</p><p class=\"body-text\">\"And as the ride slows down -- as the world slows down, I see it as my opportunity to make a move,\" she added. \"So I just wanted to say thanks to WWE and to the all the fans that have been so damn cool to me over the years. And send a crap ton of love to all of my people. I’m excited for the future! Thanks for everything.\"</p><p class=\"body-text\">During her WWE tenure, Young worked as a presenter, backstage interviewer and color commentator. She most recently served as a co-host host of <em>WWE Backstage</em> on Fox Sports 1, alongside Booker T and CM Punk. That series was canceled by the network in June. Young is married to former WWE Superstar Dean Ambrose, who is currently competing under the name Jon Moxley at AEW.</p><p class=\"body-text\"><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/wwe-host-renee-young-covid-19-positive/\">WWE Host Renee Young Confirms Positive COVID-19 Diagnosis</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 24 Aug 2020 20:27:51 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/renee-young-header.jpg","linkMd5":"11347be95d7d4846bd27de6cb0a87a68","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn44@2020_2/2020/08/24/21-43-09-313_78f0ccb3c4e5dabc.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":55034,"destBytes":55034,"author":"Keegan Prosser","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/renee-young-header.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn44@2020_2/2020/08/24/21-43-09-313_78f0ccb3c4e5dabc.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598305389171},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","title":"One Piece: The Known Bounty Of Every Blackbeard Pirate, Ranked From Lowest To Highest","link":"https://www.cbr.com/one-piece-blackbeard-pirates-bounty-ranked/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/One-Piece-The-Known-Bounty-Of-Every-Blackbeard-Pirate-Ranked-From-Lowest-To-Highest-featured-image-2.jpg\"/></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The Blackbeard Pirates are the newest addition to the upper-most brass of the <em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/one-piece/\">One Piece</a></em> pirate world. They’ve been granted the title of Yonko crew after the almost unrealistic expansions they aggressively pulled during the timeskip. The crew’s rise to infamy was so swift that it left many people speechless; everyone from the good residents of the world of </span><i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">One Piece</span></i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> to the fans. In essence, it was a plot twist that few saw coming, at least not that early on.</span></p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/one-piece-strongest-pirates-under-blackbeard/\">One Piece: 10 Strongest Pirates Under Blackbeard</a></span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The Blackbeard crew comprises multiple <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/one-piece-yonko-commanders-best-worst/\">Yonko commanders</a>, several hundred members, and multiple subordinate crews. With that being said, besides the overly shallow bits that are most likely outdated, there is little to no information about the individual members of the crew. For example, the only confirmed bounty that is up to date is Blackbeard’s; everyone else either has an outdated one or are just straight out N/A. With that out of the way, here’s <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/one-piece-every-beast-pirate-ranked-bounty/\">every known bounty</a>, old and new, concerning the Blackbeard Pirates, ranked from lowest to highest.</span></p>\n                        <h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">5 </span>Jesus Burgess (At Least 20,000,000 Berries)</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/10/Jesus-Burgess-Cropped.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Burgess is one of Blackbeard’s earliest subordinates as well as one of the most loyal ones. Perhaps due to his undeniable loyalty, he was designated the captain of the first ship’s position. Burgess was introduced as early as the Jaya arc, appearing alongside Blackbeard and a few other crewmates.</span></p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/one-piece-fan-favorite-villains-myanimelist/\">One Piece: Top 10 Fan-Favorite Villains, According To MyAnimeList</a></span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">More information was revealed about Burgess in </span><i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">One Piece’s</span></i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> visual dictionary. His bounty, at the time of his debut, was 20,000,000 berries; an amount that one can safely assume has witnessed continuous inflations throughout the timeskip. Especially considering the atrocious actions done by the entirety of the crew, it wouldn’t be surprising if Burgess had a bounty of 800,000,000 berries. </span></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">4 </span>Laffitte (At Least 42,000,000)</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/10/Laffite-Cropped.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Laffitte is also one of the OG members who has been with Blackbeard since the formation of the crew. Unlike the brute Jesus Burgess, Laffitte seems to be rather refined – perhaps even a bit too refined for a pirate. And like all the other original members, he is extremely loyal to Blackbeard; loyal enough to threaten <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/one-piece-strongest-characters-impel-down-arc/\">Avalo Pizarro</a>, a fellow Titanic Captain, due to him jokingly downplaying Blackbeard.</span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">As the captain of the 5th ship of the Blackbeard Pirates and a certified Yonko commander, it’s pretty much certain that Laffitte would possess above-average combat prowess. Armament and observational Haki are, of course, a given as well. Moreso, a bounty of 42,000,000 berries is way too unproportionate to his true capabilities. Anything above 500,000,000 berries wouldn’t be out of the question. </span></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">3 </span>Van Augur (At Least 64,000,000 Berries)</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Van-augur-one-piece.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Van Augur is the Blackbeard Crew’s sniper, as well as the captain of the 3rd ship. His capabilities as a sniper are the real deal, with even the likes of Usopp finding some of Van Augur's shots to be impossible to pull. Just like the aforementioned two members, Van Augur also was a core member of the early crew. Thus, his loyalty to Blackbeard can not be doubted.</span></p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/one-piece-usopp-characters-defeat-lose/\">One Piece: 5 Characters Usopp Can Beat (&#38; 5 He Can't)</a></span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">According to the information available, the Yonko commander with the least bounty was Charlotte Snack. He had a bounty of 500,000,000 berries prior to his defeat at the hands of Urouge. With that in mind, it can be safely assumed that Van Augor has a bounty similar to, if not more than, Snack’s bounty. After all, Van Augor’s history with the World Government most certainly goes deeper than that of Snack’s.</span></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">2 </span>Doc Q (At Least 72,000,000 Berries)</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Doc-Q-one-piece.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Out of all the original members of the Blackbeard Crew, Doc ”Death God” Q is the one <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/one-piece-mysteries-resolved-unanswered/\">shrouded in the most mystery</a>. According to him, he has a chronic illness that robs him off most of his energy, rendering him unable to walk for long distances on his own. Hence, Doc Q's over-reliance <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/one-piece-strongest-animals-beasts/\">on his horse</a>, Stronger, for most of his transportation. </span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Yet despite all that, Doc Q is insanely strong. With only a single hand, he swung at and successfully wounded Whitebeard with a scythe; now, in all fairness, the latter was already in rough shape. Prior to the timeskip, Doc Q had a bounty of 72,000,000 berries, which has likely inflated to multiple times that amount by now. </span></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">1 </span>Blackbeard (2,247,600,000 Berries)</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/gATcjbrW.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Last but definitely not least, there is <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/one-piece-pirates-more-than-one-crew/\">Marshall D. Teach, a.k.a Blackbeard</a>. He is the newest emperor of the sea and one of the series’ evilest men, even by pirate standards. What’s so impressive about Teach isn’t the men he commands or <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/one-piece-yonko-vs-world-government-protection/\">territory he controls</a>, it’s the inhumane amount of resilience and deep level of scheming he has shown that separates him from other villains. </span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">For decades, Blackbeard nurtured his ambitions and hid under Whitebeard’s magnificent shadow. He made sure to attract no attention until the time was right. And boy oh boy! He certainly attracted a massive amount of attention when the time was right. He struck ever-so-aggressively and took the entire world by storm. Blackbeard's bounty stands at a staggering amount of 2,247,600,000 berries, a number very much befitting a man of his caliber. </span></p><p><span class=\"next-single\" style=\"font-weight: 400;\">NEXT: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/one-piece-blackbeard-facts-know-anime/\">One Piece: 10 Facts You Didn't Know About Blackbeard</a></span></p>\n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 24 Aug 2020 18:30:48 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/One-Piece-The-Known-Bounty-Of-Every-Blackbeard-Pirate-Ranked-From-Lowest-To-Highest-featured-image-2.jpg","linkMd5":"457240d4574a7799bc928a3329fd9202","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn91@2020_1/2020/08/24/21-43-11-523_7c4d4bf9c908cc9b.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":103868,"destBytes":103868,"author":"Suliman Omar","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/One-Piece-The-Known-Bounty-Of-Every-Blackbeard-Pirate-Ranked-From-Lowest-To-Highest-featured-image-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn91@2020_1/2020/08/24/21-43-11-523_7c4d4bf9c908cc9b.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/10/Jesus-Burgess-Cropped.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn84@2020_1/2020/08/24/21-43-28-153_026855edb5018a29.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/10/Laffite-Cropped.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn39@2020_1/2020/08/24/21-43-29-577_cf6fe6b7bfe7704d.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Van-augur-one-piece.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn4@2020_6/2020/08/24/21-43-32-510_435cdc6a5d2918f9.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Doc-Q-one-piece.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn56@2020_4/2020/08/24/21-43-21-092_ab6a1606403c746e.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/gATcjbrW.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn68@2020_6/2020/08/24/21-43-22-282_2b3c807f39c385d9.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598305389173},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","title":"The Flash: How Wally West Met Kid Flash for the First Time | CBR","link":"https://www.cbr.com/the-flash-wally-wallace-west-meeting/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/The-Flash-Wally-West-Wallace-West.jpg\"/></figure><p>The <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/the-flash\">Flash</a> Family has undergone some significant changes over the last decade. The arrival of the New 52 changed things up for the entire DC Universe, but it shattered the world of the Flash more than any other hero.</p><p>This is because the New 52 eliminated the existence of one of the most enduring members of the Flash universe, Wally West, who had grown from Kid Flash into a generation's defining speedster. When DC Rebirth began years later, Wally West eventually returned to the DC Universe, but he wasn't the only Wally West in town anymore, since a young new Kid Flash was running around with that name and identity. After Wally started to get reacclimated in the universe, it was time for Wally West to meet the new Kid Flash, Wallace West.</p><p>Wallace West made his first appearance in Van Jensen, Robert Venditti, Brett Booth and Ron Frenz's <em>The Flash Annual</em> #3 in 2014, where he debuted in an alley spray-painting a circle with a slash through the Flash symbol. Barry Allen stopped him and had him arrested before realizing Wally was the nephew of Iris West, her nephew who she took in to keep out of foster care after the Crime Syndicate attacked. When Wally gained his powers, Flash tried to be a positive role model for him. Much like the original Wally West, the Flash was very much there to help him.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a class=\"bc-title-link\" title=\"The Flash Finds the Ultimate Super-Speed Challenge\" href=\"https://www.cbr.com/flash-lightning-cup-race/\">The Flash Finds The Ultimate Super-Speed Challenge</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Wally-West-Wallace-West.jpg\"/></figure><p>In Joshua Williamson and Jorge Corona's <em>The Flash</em> #9, Wallace and Wally finally met. By this time, Wallace was Kid Flash, and he was working as the Flash's sidekick, although he still didn't know that Flash was Barry Allen yet. The two were working on rebuilding a bridge to save people when suddenly, out of nowhere, the original Wally West showed up and helped. Barry let Kid Flash know that this was a friend, and he was also known as the Flash.</p><p>Wally West set up the meeting as he was trying to figure out his place in the world that had changed drastically from before he was wiped from existence. However, when Wally shook Flash's hand, something happened, and Barry ended up zapped by something that caused him to start to lose himself in the Speed Force. He began to lose his grip and start verbally attacking the two, even going as far as to tell Kid Flash that his father was Daniel West, the Reverse-Flash. The two Wally's teamed up and used their love of Barry to pull him out and save him.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a class=\"bc-title-link\" title=\"The Flash: Reverse-Flash Has ANOTHER Connection to Rebirth\" href=\"https://www.cbr.com/the-flash-757-reverse-flash-second-rebirth-connection/\">The Flash: Reverse-Flash Has ANOTHER Connection To Rebirth</a></span></p><p>Wally was there for two reasons. He wanted to talk to Kid Flash, give him a little advice about believing in himself, and not letting the fact his dad was Reverse-Flash define him. He wanted to be there for him the same way Barry was there for him in the past. He wanted to let him know they were family. In reality, they were cousins, with Wally's father Rudy and Kid Flash's dad Daniel being brothers. His other reason was to check in with Barry about what was happening with the Speed Force.</p><p>The two Wallys became like family, as many of DC's speedsters are. Wallace ended up on the Teen Titans, and Wally ended up back with his original teammates, the adult Titans. By this time, the Titans and Superman knew who Wally was and remembered him, joining Barry Allen in his efforts to find his place in the universe. However, things got dark for Wally West. He developed a heart condition and ended up dying from a heart attack in a battle with H.I.V.E. Luckily, Wallace saved him, healing his heart condition in the process. Since then, these two Flashes have both run alongside each other many times as parts of the <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/the-flash-kid-flash-impulse-meeting/\">ever-growing Flash</a> Family.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a class=\"bc-title-link\" title=\"The Reverse-Flash Stole a Move From The Flash TV Show\" href=\"https://www.cbr.com/the-flash-756-reverse-flash-mentors-tornado-twins-tv-show-comparison/\">The Reverse-Flash Stole A Move From The Flash TV Show</a></span></p><p><!-- Used for easily cloning the properly namespaced rect --></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 24 Aug 2020 15:20:36 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/The-Flash-Wally-West-Wallace-West.jpg","linkMd5":"177ef665f6d513f183c5d84b22619bf2","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn63@2020_1/2020/08/24/21-43-11-328_68e1446e1eb576c8.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":219624,"destBytes":219624,"author":"Shawn S. Lealos","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/The-Flash-Wally-West-Wallace-West.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn63@2020_1/2020/08/24/21-43-11-328_68e1446e1eb576c8.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Wally-West-Wallace-West.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn76@2020_6/2020/08/24/21-43-23-251_d4308985856f1d49.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598305389180},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","title":"REVIEW: The Boys Season 2 Is a Huge Win for Amazon Prime Video","link":"https://www.cbr.com/review-the-boys-season-2/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Butcher-Clean-Boys-Header.jpg\"/></figure><p>Based on Garth Ennis and Darick Robertson's comic series of the same name, <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/the-boys-tv/\">The Boys</a> Season 1 proved a smash hit for Amazon Prime Video thanks to its compelling examination of a world in which superheroes are <em>actually </em>very, very bad people. The second season of <em>The Boys </em>is set to release on Sept. 4, and the show's sophomore outing does a lot right by finding compelling ways to advance the world and its characters.</p><p><em>The Boys </em>Season 2 picks up after <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/boys-season-2-homelander-photo-blood-cuddles/\">Billy Butcher</a> (Karl Urban) fails to kill Homelander (Antony Starr) at the home of Madelyn Stillwell (Elisabeth Shue). While Billy survives his encounter with Homelander, he's also learns that Becca (Shantel VanSanten) -- his wife whom he thought was dead -- is still alive, which drives pretty much everything he does in Season 2. Meanwhile, the rest of his team focuses on taking down Vought International. However, making things more complex is that The Boys are now wanted as a result of the deaths of Translucent (Alex Hassell) and Stillwell. Despite that impediment, the team becomes increasingly embroiled in a political conspiracy surrounding Compound V -- which is how Supes get their powers --  while contending with the <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/the-boys-stormfront-social-media-age/\">social-media savvy superhero Stormfront</a> (Aya Cash) and an increasingly unhinged Homelander.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/the-boys-when-season-3-plans-to-film/\">The Boys Showrunner Reveals When Season 3 Plans to Start Filming</a></span></p><p><em>The Boys</em> Season 2 introduces a big status quo change for the team by having them exposed and in the open rather than operating in the shadows. This leads to a lot of tension, as they are at every turn in an incredible amount of danger, though this is somewhat undercut by the fact people don't seem to notice with any consistency that they're in the presence of the most wanted people in the United States. Still, there's a lot of fantastic intrigue in <em>The Boys Season 2</em>, with its best moments made possible by the internal strife and shifting alliances generated from the various twists of Season 1 as well as the dark history of Vought International and the cabalistic ambitions of CEO Stan Edgar (Giancarlo Esposito).</p><p>While <em>The Boys </em>Season 2 certainly has its fill of action, the slow, thoughtful moments are really where the series excels. <em>The Boys </em>isn't afraid to challenge its characters -- or relationships like the one between Kimiko/The Female (Karen Fukuhara) and Frenchie (Tomer Capon) -- to grow, and it's all the better for that choice. At some point in the Season 2, every main character -- and many of the side characters -- are challenged by a difficult revelation, their history and/or their desires, making everyone feel more fleshed out and alive than ever. Hughie Campbell (Jack Quaid) in particular grows a lot in Season 2, which causes some tension between him and Billy, who himself undergoes a pretty major character arc this time around.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/the-boys-showrunner-five-seasons-series/\">The Boys Showrunner Thinks Five Seasons Is a Good Run for the Series</a></span></p><p>Of course, those challenges wouldn't matter without the acting, which remains top-notch throughout <em>The Boys </em>Season 2. In terms of the returning cast, Antony Starr's Homelander is worth singling out. Starr is absolutely magnetic in each and every scene that he appears, carrying a sort of dread-inspiring gravitas that makes him feel entirely unpredictable and dangerous. As for the new additions, Aya Cash is solid and charismatic as Stormfront, but she's no match for <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/boys-season-2-shawn-ashmore-lamplighter/\">Shawn Ashmore's Lamplighter</a>, who burns brightly as he challenges everyone with whom he comes into contact.</p><p>A major part of <em>The Boys </em>Season 1's appeal -- and of the comic, too -- was its deconstruction of superhero culture, which worked especially well considering the popularity of the Marvel Cinematic Universe and DC Extended Universe. While that exploration still plays a role in Season 2, the focus is much more on politics, particularly contemporary alt-right and Neo-Nazi discourse. However, the net here gets cast rather wide, and <em>The Boys</em> doesn't always have time to address those issues in the depth that they deserve. Admittedly, though, the set-up for Season 3 does tease a deeper exploration of some of the political angles that don't quite get done justice in Season 2. Plus, <em>The Boys </em>anti-fascist message is quite clear and, at times, rather nuanced, which is really the show's main focus this time around.</p><p>If there's any real downside to <em>The Boys </em>Season 2, it's that the show's trademark crassness and gore actually sometimes get in its way. While there are a number of scenes -- especially emotional ones -- that get enhanced by these two elements, the show will sometimes use them more for shock value than actual substance. This was a bit of a problem in Season 1, but it's more pronounced in Season 2. One scene later on in the season (and so not discussable here for spoiler reasons) uses a kind of mix of humor and gore to undercut a pretty major emotional moment that just occured, which disappointingly robs several characters of a good, interesting moment. For the most part, the best episodes of Season 2 don't actually use crasness and gore more than absolutely necessary, instead saving them for key, impactful moments.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/boys-season-2-homelander-photo-blood-cuddles/\">The Boys Star Teases Blood (and Cuddles) in Season 2 With an Ominous Homelander Photo</a></span></p><p>While so often a popular show's sophomore outing can fail to live up to the hype, The<em> Boys </em>Season 2 is a triumphant return that pushes the Amazon Prime Video series in bold new directions by challenging its characters in big ways. There are still some issues and growing pains, but overall <em>The Boys</em>' sophomore outing is a great season of television.</p><p><em>Amazon Studios' <a href=\"https://screenrant.com/the-boys-season-2-3-comic-stories/amp/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">The Boys</a> stars Karl Urban as Billy Butcher, Jack Quaid as Hughie, Laz Alonso as Mother's Milk, Tomer Kapon as Frenchie, Karen Fukuhara as the Female, Erin Moriarty as Annie January, Chace Crawford as the Deep, Antony Starr as Homelander, Aya Cash as Stormfront and Simon Pegg as Hughie's dad. Season 2 premieres Sept. 4 on Amazon Prime Video.</em><em> </em></p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/boys-season-3-supernatural-jensen-ackles-soldier-boy/\">The Boys Recruits Supernatural Star Jensen Ackles for Season 3</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 24 Aug 2020 16:00:06 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Butcher-Clean-Boys-Header.jpg","linkMd5":"aa5a4c102d227dd55b10135ca8d4f15b","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn27@2020_6/2020/08/24/21-43-12-031_ebf977668d5a9212.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":247542,"destBytes":222520,"author":"Liam Nolan","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Butcher-Clean-Boys-Header.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn27@2020_6/2020/08/24/21-43-12-031_ebf977668d5a9212.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598305389179},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","title":"Make It So: The 10 Greatest Quotes From Star Trek's Captain Picard","link":"https://www.cbr.com/stark-trek-captain-picard-greatest-best-quotes/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Star-Trek-The-Next-Generation-Captain-Picard-and-the-Enterprise.jpg\"/></figure><p>In all of science fiction, there are few characters as complex as <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/star-trek-the-next-generation/\"><em>Star Trek: The Next Generation</em></a>'s Captain <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/star-trek-things-need-to-be-in-picard-season-2/\">Jean-Luc Picard</a>. From the start, Picard was older than the usual TV hero, and he had far less hair too. He was stern, confident, and more than willing to yell at his crew on the Enterprise, which was something <a href=\"https://screenrant.com/star-trek-captain-kirk-trivia-weird/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Captain Kirk</a> was far less likely to do.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/star-trek-aliens-coolest-lamest/\">Star Trek: The 5 Coolest Aliens (&#38; the 5 Lamest)</a></span></p><p>But under all his stoicism, Picard has an artificial heart that beat with a love for the arts and all living things. Picard is a man who sees greatness in everyone and pushes himself and his peers to be better. He never has contempt for others, but he's also not very good at expressing his true feelings. But when the words do come to Picard, they are like poetry. These are but a handful of things Picard has said that capture his true essence...</p>\n                        <h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">10 </span>“Seize The Time! Live Now! Make Now Always The Most Precious Time. Now Will Never Come Again.”</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Star-Trek-The-Next-Generation-Picard-Playing-The-Flute.jpg' /></figure><p>While it took Jean-Luc Picard <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/every-star-trek-tv-season-ranked/\">seven years</a> to finally sit down with his crew and play poker, it would be a grave mistake to say he led a less than full life. A bar fight ended with him stabbed through the heart, necessitating a replacement. But what makes that story special is that as Picard looked down to see his would-be mortal wound, he laughed.</p><p>He laughed because even at that young age, he believed one thing above all else: life is meant to be lived. Of course, one can live a full life and not get stabbed in the heart, but Picard had his own path to take.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">9 </span>“It Is Possible To Commit No Mistakes And Still Lose. That Is Not Weakness, That Is Life.”</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Star-Trek-The-Next-Generation-Peak-Performance.jpg' /></figure><p>As any Trekkie can tell you, to be a commander in Starfleet, a cadet must first go through the Kobayashi Maru scenario. This test places the cadet in the captain's chair and puts them in a no-win scenario. Captain Kirk famously beat the Kobayashi Maru scenario by cheating because he never believed in the idea of a no-win scenario.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/star-trek-best-worst-ship-designs/\">Star Trek: 5 Best Ship Designs (&#38; 5 Worst Ship Designs)</a></span></p><p>Captain Picard, meanwhile, learned the true meaning of the Kobayashi Maru scenario: sometimes you can not win, but how you handle yourself in defeat is just as important. Picard, if nothing else, always met every scenario with grace and courage.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">8 </span>\"There Can Be No Justice So Long As Laws Are Absolute.\"</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Star-Trek-The-Next-Generation-Picard-Beverly-Crusher-and-Data.jpg' /></figure><p>Every society needs laws. Laws lay out the blueprints for a just society and without them, there is nothing that will hold a society together. But laws cannot be considered absolute, because morality exists in a grey area. A law that does account for the circumstances that led to the breaking of the law is not upholding justice, but creating injustice.</p><p>This is an issue humanity has long worked to understand and by the time Captain Picard is flying into the final frontiers, we have learned how to balance laws and justice. As part of his mission for <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/star-trek-best-starfleet-uniforms-ranked/\">Starfleet</a>, Picard looks to share that knowledge with other civilizations.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">7 </span>\"There Are Four Lights\"</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Star-Trek-The-Next-Generation-There-Are-Four-Lights.jpg' /></figure><p>The idea is simple: show a person four lights, and tell them that if they say there are five they will no longer be tortured. The goal is to break that person's will, to make them bend to the torturer's whim, thus giving the torturer full control. When Jean-Luc Picard was taken captive and tortured by the Cardassians, they used this method against him. Picard would not break.</p><p>No matter how much they hurt him, the Captain would always defiantly respond with \"There are four lights.\" This is the power that the mind of a strong-willed person has. No matter what is done to them, they will not give in.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">6 </span>\"Things Are Only Impossible Until They're Not.\"</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Star-Trek-The-Next-Generation-Captain-Picard-Day.jpg' /></figure><p>History is made by the impossible being conquered. From the first person creating fire to mankind breaking free from the chains of gravity and launching into the skies and placing a foot on the moon, things that once seemed like a fool's dreams have time and again become milestones that have been met and surpassed.</p><p>For Captain Picard, traveling at speeds faster than light and using teleportation devices to hang out on previously undiscovered countries makes all of the impossible things seem far more possible. As with all of <em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/star-trek/\">Star Trek</a></em>, the joy is in believing that the impossible will, one day, be very possible.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">5 </span>\"There Was A Time You Looked At The Stars And Dreamed Of What Might Be.\"</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Star-Trek-The-Next-Generation-Picard-and-Shinzon.jpg' /></figure><p>Jean-Luc Picard, like so many heroes before him, understands the importance of dreams. He knows that the person who strives to be more and create more than what exists now is who makes the universe a better place. With each dream realized, new dreams come into being, helping everyone reach greater heights. But as we dream of bigger and better things, we must remember where we started and appreciate how far we have come.</p><p>In this instance, Picard was speaking to his evil clone Shinzon who had lived a life of pain, but the idea stands for us all. We all dream of a better world and our place in it.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">4 </span>\"If We're Going To Be Damned, Let's Be Damned For What We Really Are.\"</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Star-Trek-the-Next-Generation-Encounter-at-Farpoint-Picard-and-Q.jpg' /></figure><p>Above all else, Jean-Luc Picard believed it was imperative that a person lives up to their personal beliefs. This doesn't mean a person needs to be perfect, quite the opposite. What it means is that a person needs to stand up for what they believe in and be ready to deal with the consequences.</p><p>This quote comes from the very first episode of <em>Star Trek: The Next Generation</em>. As the <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/star-trek-top-q-episodes-imdb/\">omnipotent being Q</a> watches the crew of the <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/star-trek-secrets-of-the-enterprise-that-only-real-trek-fans-know/\">Enterprise</a> so he can judge all of the human race, Picard makes it clear to his crew what he expects: for them to be true to themselves and the ideology of mankind.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">3 </span>\"There Are Times, Sir, When Men Of Good Conscience Cannot Blindly Follow Orders.\"</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Star-Trek-the-Next-Generation-Offspring.jpg' /></figure><p>Sometimes, <em>Star Trek</em> explores the differences between following orders and doing what is right. Rules can be unjust or cruel, and it is up to each person to decide for themselves what they are willing, or unwilling, to do. For Picard, his beliefs are clear.</p><p>He will never intentionally harm a living being if it can be avoided, even if that means going against orders from his higher-ups. There is bravery in refusing to carry out unjust orders. It is a bravery that Picard and the crew of the Enterprise exhibited on more than one occasion.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">2 </span>\"Villains Who Twirl Their Mustache Are Easy To Spot. Those Who Clothe Themselves In Good Deeds Are Well-Camouflaged.\"</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Star-Trek-The-Next-Generation-The-Drumhead.jpg' /></figure><p>Fiction tends to make the bad guys easy to recognize. They do clearly evil things in clearly evil ways. In reality, a lot of bad people are great at hiding their true colors behind a façade of kindness and charity. Captain Picard knows this, and he makes it clear that this is still a problem in the far off future.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/star-trek-tos-zodiac-personality/\">Which Star Trek: TOS Character Are You Based On Your Zodiac?</a></span></p><p>As the Captain of the Enterprise, there are hundreds of people who depend on Picard to keep them safe. Part of that safety comes from Picard's ability to recognize a wolf in sheep's clothing, and this is something he is well aware of.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">1 </span>\"Open Your Mind To The Past... To History, Art, Philosophy. And Then... This Will Mean Something.\"</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Star-Trek-The-Next-Generation-Picard-and-Wesley-Crusher.jpg' /></figure><p><em>Star Trek</em> is about just how great humanity could become if we learn to move past our biases and work together to create a better future. The episodes usually focus on smart people facing difficult problems and coming up with smart answers. No franchise has led more people to become scientists, engineers, or doctors more than <em>Star Trek.</em></p><p>But at its heart,<em> Star Trek</em> is about what makes life worth living and what it means to create a legacy. Stories about good people doing good will inspire future generations. Art, music, and literature are as much a part of what makes mankind great as the science we have discovered. To Picard, you can not have one without the other.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">NEXT: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/star-wars-vs-star-trek-better-franchise/\">5 Reasons Star Wars is the Best (&#38; 5 Reasons Star Trek is the Best)</a></span></p>\n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 24 Aug 2020 14:30:12 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Star-Trek-The-Next-Generation-Captain-Picard-and-the-Enterprise.jpg","linkMd5":"d3edf5f5e464851b6622d3f8198b3b23","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn63@2020_3/2020/08/24/21-43-09-461_c7338bfd08190092.webp","destWidth":1710,"destHeight":900,"sourceBytes":79866,"destBytes":79866,"author":"Derek Faraci","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Star-Trek-The-Next-Generation-Captain-Picard-and-the-Enterprise.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn63@2020_3/2020/08/24/21-43-09-461_c7338bfd08190092.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Star-Trek-The-Next-Generation-Picard-Playing-The-Flute.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn51@2020_1/2020/08/24/21-43-32-095_2a72d41077a6adb3.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Star-Trek-The-Next-Generation-Peak-Performance.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn3@2020_6/2020/08/24/21-43-25-003_7d8f6843f8be01c9.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Star-Trek-The-Next-Generation-Picard-Beverly-Crusher-and-Data.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn8@2020_4/2020/08/24/21-43-22-451_21eda24ca7f0c906.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Star-Trek-The-Next-Generation-There-Are-Four-Lights.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn87@2020_1/2020/08/24/21-43-21-234_35f86ff3486a072d.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Star-Trek-The-Next-Generation-Captain-Picard-Day.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn67@2020_5/2020/08/24/21-43-28-925_0f0d44cc6f2e51d3.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Star-Trek-The-Next-Generation-Picard-and-Shinzon.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn7@2020_6/2020/08/24/21-43-22-192_75810238f01a4342.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Star-Trek-the-Next-Generation-Encounter-at-Farpoint-Picard-and-Q.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn48@2020_5/2020/08/24/21-43-27-904_eeaf0509af0edb56.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Star-Trek-the-Next-Generation-Offspring.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn28@2020_5/2020/08/24/21-43-22-614_d3fa8c866e74844a.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Star-Trek-The-Next-Generation-The-Drumhead.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn27@2020_6/2020/08/24/21-43-31-048_e8bdba0beef0e082.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Star-Trek-The-Next-Generation-Picard-and-Wesley-Crusher.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn100@2020_4/2020/08/24/21-43-26-692_35fe68ce3d69f488.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598305389183}],"record":{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 05:43:09","feedId":3746,"fetchDate":"Mon, 24 Aug 2020 21:43:09
